sentences.zh: 秦之先，帝顓頊之苗裔孫曰女修。

translations.literal: Qin's ancestors, Emperor Zhuan Xu's distant descendant grandson called Nu Xiu.
translations.idiomatic: The ancestors of Qin were distant descendants of Emperor Zhuan Xu. There was a grandson named Nu Xiu.

sentences.zh: 女修織，玄鳥隕卵，女修吞之，生子大業。

translations.literal: Nu Xiu wove. Dark bird fell egg. Nu Xiu swallowed it, gave birth to son Da Ye.
translations.idiomatic: Nu Xiu was weaving when a dark bird dropped an egg. She swallowed it and gave birth to a son named Da Ye.

sentences.zh: 大業取少典之子，曰女華。

translations.literal: Da Ye took Shao Dian's daughter, called Nu Hua.
translations.idiomatic: Da Ye took as wife the daughter of Shao Dian, named Nu Hua.

sentences.zh: 女華生大費，與禹平水土。

translations.literal: Nu Hua gave birth to Da Fei, with Yu pacified waters and lands.
translations.idiomatic: Nu Hua bore Da Fei, who helped Yu pacify the floods and tame the land.

sentences.zh: 已成，帝錫玄圭。

translations.literal: Already completed, emperor bestowed dark jade tablet.
translations.idiomatic: When the work was done, the emperor bestowed a dark jade tablet upon him.

sentences.zh: 禹受曰：「非予能成，亦大費為輔。」

translations.literal: Yu accepted said: 'Not I could complete, also Da Fei as assistant.'
translations.idiomatic: Yu accepted it and said: 'I could not have accomplished this alone; Da Fei assisted me.'

sentences.zh: 帝舜曰：「咨爾費，贊禹功，其賜爾皁游。

translations.literal: Emperor Shun said: 'Consult you Fei, aided Yu merit, will bestow you dark banner.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Shun said: 'Ah, Fei! You aided Yu's achievements. I shall bestow upon you the dark banner.

sentences.zh: 爾後嗣將大出。」

translations.literal: Your descendants will greatly emerge.'
translations.idiomatic: Your descendants shall greatly prosper.'

sentences.zh: 乃妻之姚姓之玉女。

translations.literal: Then married him to Yao surname's jade girl.
translations.idiomatic: He was then married to a jade maiden of the Yao clan.

sentences.zh: 大費拜受，佐舜調馴鳥獸，鳥獸多馴服，是為柏翳。

translations.literal: Da Fei bowed accepted, assisted Shun trained tamed birds beasts. Birds beasts many tamed submissive. This called Bai Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Da Fei bowed and accepted the marriage. He assisted Shun in training and taming birds and beasts, and many became docile. This is why he was called Bai Yi.

sentences.zh: 舜賜姓嬴氏。

translations.literal: Shun bestowed surname Ying clan.
translations.idiomatic: Shun granted him the surname Ying.

translations.literal: Qin's ancestors were the descendants of Emperor Zhuanxu. His grandson was called Nüxiu. Nüxiu was weaving when a dark bird dropped an egg. Nüxiu swallowed it and gave birth to a son named Daye. Daye took Shao Dian's daughter, named Nü Hua. Nü Hua gave birth to Da Fei, who helped Yu pacify the waters and lands. When it was completed, the emperor bestowed a dark jade tablet. Yu accepted it and said: 'I could not have completed it alone. Da Fei was my assistant.' Emperor Shun said: 'Ah, you Fei, you aided Yu's merit. I will grant you the dark banner. Your descendants will greatly emerge.' Then he married him to a jade girl of the Yao surname. Da Fei bowed and accepted. He assisted Shun in taming birds and beasts. Many birds and beasts were tamed. He was called Bai Yi. Shun granted him the surname Ying.

sentences.zh: 大費生子二人：一曰大廉，實鳥俗氏；

translations.literal: Da Fei gave birth to sons two: one called Da Lian, established Niao Su clan;
translations.idiomatic: Da Fei had two sons: one named Da Lian, who founded the Niao Su lineage;

sentences.zh: 二曰若木，實費氏。

translations.literal: Second called Ruo Mu, established Fei clan.
translations.idiomatic: The second was named Ruo Mu, who founded the Fei lineage.

sentences.zh: 其玄孫曰費昌，子孫或在中國，或在夷狄。

translations.literal: His great-grandson called Fei Chang. Descendants or in central states, or among barbarians.
translations.idiomatic: His great-grandson was named Fei Chang. His descendants lived sometimes in the central states, sometimes among the barbarians.

sentences.zh: 費昌當夏桀之時，去夏歸商，為湯御，以敗桀於鳴條。

translations.literal: Fei Chang during Xia Jie time, left Xia joined Shang, for Tang drove chariot, with defeated Jie at Ming Tiao.
translations.idiomatic: During Xia Jie's reign, Fei Chang abandoned Xia for Shang. He drove Tang's chariot and helped defeat Jie at Ming Tiao.

sentences.zh: 大廉玄孫曰孟戲、中衍，鳥身人言。

translations.literal: Da Lian great-grandsons called Meng Xi, Zhong Yan, bird bodies human speech.
translations.idiomatic: Da Lian's great-grandsons were named Meng Xi and Zhong Yan. They had bird bodies but spoke with human voices.

sentences.zh: 帝太戊聞而卜之使御，吉，遂致使御而妻之。

translations.literal: Emperor Tai Wu heard and divined made drive chariot, auspicious. Then caused made drive chariot and married to him.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Tai Wu heard of this and divined about having him drive chariots. The omen was favorable, so he had him drive and married a woman to him.

sentences.zh: 自太戊以下，中衍之後，遂世有功，以佐殷國，故嬴姓多顯，遂為諸侯。

translations.literal: From Tai Wu downward, Zhong Yan's descendants, then generations had merit, with assisted Yin state. Therefore Ying surname many illustrious, then became feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: From Tai Wu onward, Zhong Yan's descendants generation after generation achieved merit assisting the Yin state. Therefore the Ying surname became numerous and distinguished, eventually becoming feudal lords.

translations.literal: Da Fei had two sons: one named Da Lian, who established the Niaosu clan; the second named Ruomu, who established the Fei clan. His great-grandson was named Fei Chang. His descendants were sometimes in the central states, sometimes among the barbarians. Fei Chang, during Xia Jie's time, left Xia and joined Shang. He drove for Tang and helped defeat Jie at Mingtao. Da Lian's great-grandson was named Meng Xi and Zhong Yan. They had bird bodies but human speech. Emperor Tai Wu heard of it and divined to have them drive. It was auspicious. He then had them drive and married them to him. From Tai Wu onward, Zhong Yan's descendants generation after generation had merit and assisted the Yin state. Therefore the Ying surname had many illustrious members and became feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 其玄孫曰中潏，在西戎，保西垂。

translations.literal: His great-grandson called Zhong Hao, at western Rong, guarded western frontier.
translations.idiomatic: His great-grandson was named Zhong Hao. He lived among the western Rong and defended the western marches.

sentences.zh: 生蜚廉。

translations.literal: Gave birth to Fei Lian.
translations.idiomatic: He sired Fei Lian.

sentences.zh: 蜚廉生惡來。

translations.literal: Fei Lian gave birth to E Lai.
translations.idiomatic: Fei Lian sired E Lai.

sentences.zh: 惡來有力，蜚廉善走，父子俱以材力事殷紂。

translations.literal: E Lai had strength, Fei Lian good at running. Father and son both with abilities and strength served Yin Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: E Lai was immensely strong, Fei Lian swift of foot. Father and son both served King Zhou of Yin with their talents and might.

sentences.zh: 周武王之伐紂，并殺惡來。

translations.literal: Zhou Wu Wang attacked Zhou, also killed E Lai.
translations.idiomatic: When King Wu of Zhou attacked King Zhou, he also executed E Lai.

sentences.zh: 是時蜚廉為紂石北方，還，無所報，為壇霍太山而報，得石棺，銘曰「帝令處父不與殷亂，賜爾石棺以華氏」。

translations.literal: At this time Fei Lian for Zhou carved northern regions, returned, had nothing to report, made altar Huo Mount Tai to report, obtained stone coffin, inscription said 'Heaven commanded Chu Fu not participate Yin rebellion, bestowed you stone coffin to flourish clan'.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Fei Lian was carving stone monuments in the northern regions for King Zhou. Upon returning with nothing to report, he built an altar on Mount Huo Tai to make his report. He received a stone coffin with an inscription: 'Heaven commanded Chu Fu not to participate in Yin's rebellion. I bestow upon you this stone coffin to make your clan flourish.'

sentences.zh: 死，遂葬於霍太山。

translations.literal: Died, then buried at Huo Mount Tai.
translations.idiomatic: He died and was buried at Mount Huo Tai.

sentences.zh: 蜚廉復有子曰季勝。

translations.literal: Fei Lian again had son called Ji Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: Fei Lian had another son named Ji Sheng.

sentences.zh: 季勝生孟增。

translations.literal: Ji Sheng gave birth to Meng Zeng.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Sheng sired Meng Zeng.

sentences.zh: 孟增幸於周成王，是為宅皋狼。

translations.literal: Meng Zeng favored by Zhou Cheng Wang, this called Zhai Gao Lang.
translations.idiomatic: Meng Zeng found favor with King Cheng of Zhou, hence his title Zhai Gao Lang.

sentences.zh: 皋狼生衡父，衡父生造父。

translations.literal: Gao Lang gave birth to Heng Fu, Heng Fu gave birth to Zao Fu.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Lang sired Heng Fu, who sired Zao Fu.

sentences.zh: 造父以善御幸於周繆王，得驥、溫驪、驊騮、騄耳之駟，西巡狩，樂而忘歸。

translations.literal: Zao Fu with good driving favored by Zhou Mu Wang, obtained Ji, Wen Li, Hua Liu, Luo Er team of horses. West inspected hunted, pleased forgot to return.
translations.idiomatic: Zao Fu won King Mu of Zhou's favor through his driving skill. He received the team of horses: Ji, Wen Li, Hua Liu, and Luo Er. They toured the western regions inspecting and hunting, and the king was so delighted he forgot to return home.

sentences.zh: 徐偃王作亂，造父為繆王御，長驅歸周，一日千里以救亂。

translations.literal: Xu Yan Wang made rebellion, Zao Fu for Mu Wang drove chariot, long drove returned to Zhou, one day thousand li to save chaos.
translations.idiomatic: When King Yan of Xu rebelled, Zao Fu drove King Mu's chariot. He raced back to Zhou, covering a thousand li in a single day to quell the uprising.

sentences.zh: 繆王以趙城封造父，造父族由此為趙氏。

translations.literal: Mu Wang with Zhao city enfeoffed Zao Fu. Zao Fu clan from this became Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: King Mu enfeoffed Zao Fu with Zhao city. From this time, Zao Fu's lineage became known as the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 自蜚廉生季勝已下五世至造父，別居趙。

translations.literal: From Fei Lian sired Ji Sheng downward five generations to Zao Fu, separately resided in Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: From Fei Lian's son Ji Sheng onward, five generations down to Zao Fu lived apart in Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙衰其後也。

translations.literal: Zhao Shuai their descendant.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuai was among their descendants.

sentences.zh: 惡來革者，蜚廉子也，蚤死。

translations.literal: E Lai Ge, Fei Lian's son, died early.
translations.idiomatic: E Lai Ge was also Fei Lian's son, but died young.

sentences.zh: 有子曰女防。

translations.literal: Had son called Nu Fang.
translations.idiomatic: He had a son named Nu Fang.

sentences.zh: 女防生旁皋，旁皋生太幾，太幾生大駱，大駱生非子。

translations.literal: Nu Fang gave birth to Pang Gao, Pang Gao gave birth to Tai Ji, Tai Ji gave birth to Da Luo, Da Luo gave birth to Fei Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Nu Fang sired Pang Gao, who sired Tai Ji, who sired Da Luo, who sired Fei Zi.

sentences.zh: 以造父之寵，皆蒙趙城，姓趙氏。

translations.literal: With Zao Fu's favor, all received Zhao city portions, surname Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: Thanks to Zao Fu's favor, they all received portions of Zhao city and took the surname Zhao.

translations.literal: His great-grandson was named Zhong Hao. He was among the western Rong and guarded the western frontier. He gave birth to Fei Lian. Fei Lian gave birth to E Lai. E Lai was strong, Fei Lian was good at running. Father and son both served King Zhou of Yin with their abilities. When King Wu of Zhou attacked King Zhou, he also killed E Lai. At this time, Fei Lian surveyed the north for King Zhou. He returned with nothing to report. He made an altar at Mount Huo Tai and prayed for guidance. He got a stone coffin with the inscription: 'Heaven commanded Chu Fu not to participate in Yin's chaos. It grants you this stone coffin to glorify your clan.' He died and was buried at Mount Huo Tai. Fei Lian had another son named Ji Sheng. Ji Sheng gave birth to Meng Zeng. Meng Zeng was favored by King Cheng of Zhou. He was called Zhai Gao Lang. Gao Lang gave birth to Heng Fu. Heng Fu gave birth to Zao Fu. Zao Fu, with his good driving, was favored by King Mu of Zhou. He got the team of Ji, Wenli, Hualiu, and Luoe. They went west on inspection, became so pleased they forgot to return. King Yan of Xu made rebellion. Zao Fu drove for King Mu, rushing back to Zhou, covering a thousand li in one day to save the situation. King Mu enfeoffed Zao Fu with Zhao city. Zao Fu's clan from this became the Zhao clan. From Fei Lian's birth of Ji Sheng, five generations down to Zao Fu, they separately resided in Zhao. Zhao Shuai was his descendant. E Lai Ge was also Fei Lian's son. He died early. He had a son named Nü Fang. Nü Fang gave birth to Pang Gao. Pang Gao gave birth to Tai Ji. Tai Ji gave birth to Da Luo. Da Luo gave birth to Fei Zi. With Zao Fu's favor, they all received Zhao city and took the surname Zhao.

sentences.zh: 非子居犬丘，好馬及畜，善養息之。

translations.literal: Fei Zi resided Quan Qiu, loved horses and livestock, good at raising breeding them.
translations.idiomatic: Fei Zi lived at Quan Qiu. He loved horses and cattle, and excelled at breeding and raising them.

sentences.zh: 犬丘人言之周孝王，孝王召使主馬于汧渭之閒，馬大蕃息。

translations.literal: Quan Qiu people spoke of it to Zhou Xiao Wang. Xiao Wang summoned made manage horses between Qian Wei rivers, horses greatly multiplied.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Quan Qiu informed King Xiao of Zhou. King Xiao summoned him to manage the horse herds between the Qian and Wei rivers, where the horses multiplied greatly.

sentences.zh: 孝王欲以為大駱適嗣。

translations.literal: Xiao Wang wished to make him Da Luo proper heir.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiao wished to make him Da Luo's legitimate successor.

sentences.zh: 申侯之女為大駱妻，生子成為適。

translations.literal: Shen Hou's daughter was Da Luo's wife, gave birth to son Cheng became proper heir.
translations.idiomatic: But Lord Shen's daughter was Da Luo's wife and bore him a son named Cheng, who became the legitimate heir.

sentences.zh: 申侯乃言孝王曰：「昔我先酈山之女，為戎胥軒妻，生中潏，以親故歸周，保西垂，西垂以其故和睦。

translations.literal: Shen Hou then spoke to Xiao Wang said: 'Formerly my ancestor Li Mountain's daughter, was Rong Xu Xuan's wife, gave birth to Zhong Hao, because kinship returned to Zhou, guarded western frontier, western frontier because of this harmonious.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Shen then spoke to King Xiao: 'Formerly my ancestor's daughter from Mount Li was married to the Rong chieftain Xu Xuan and bore Zhong Hao. Because of this kinship, he returned to Zhou and defended the western frontier, bringing harmony to the region.'

sentences.zh: 今我復與大駱妻，生適子成。

translations.literal: Now I again gave daughter to Da Luo as wife, gave birth to proper son Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: Now I have again given my daughter in marriage to Da Luo, and she has borne the legitimate son Cheng.

sentences.zh: 申駱重婚，西戎皆服，所以為王。

translations.literal: Shen Luo double marriage, western Rong all submit. Therefore serve as king.
translations.idiomatic: Through the double marriage alliance between Shen and Luo, all western Rong submit. This is why you serve as king.

sentences.zh: 王其圖之。」

translations.literal: King should plan it.'
translations.idiomatic: Your Majesty should consider this.'

sentences.zh: 於是孝王曰：「昔伯翳為舜主畜，畜多息，故有土，賜姓嬴。

translations.literal: Then Xiao Wang said: 'Formerly Bai Yi for Shun managed livestock, livestock greatly multiplied, therefore had land, bestowed surname Ying.
translations.idiomatic: Then King Xiao said: 'Formerly Bai Yi managed livestock for Shun, and the herds multiplied greatly. Therefore he received land and was granted the surname Ying.

sentences.zh: 今其後世亦為朕息馬，朕其分土為附庸。」

translations.literal: Now his descendants also for I multiply horses, I will divide land as fief.'
translations.idiomatic: Now his descendants also breed horses for me. I shall grant him land as a fief.'

sentences.zh: 邑之秦，使復續嬴氏祀，號曰秦嬴。

translations.literal: Enfeoffed at Qin, made continue Ying clan sacrifices, titled Qin Ying.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed him at Qin, had him resume the Ying clan sacrifices, and titled him Qin Ying.

sentences.zh: 亦不廢申侯之女子為駱適者，以和西戎。

translations.literal: Also not discarded Shen Hou's daughter as Da Luo proper wife, to harmonize western Rong.
translations.idiomatic: He also did not set aside Lord Shen's daughter as Da Luo's proper wife, in order to maintain peace with the western Rong.

translations.literal: Fei Zi resided at Quanqiu. He liked horses and livestock, and was good at raising and multiplying them. The people of Quanqiu spoke of it to King Xiao of Zhou. King Xiao summoned him to manage the horses between the Qian and Wei rivers. The horses greatly multiplied. King Xiao wished to make him Da Luo's proper heir. Shen Hou's daughter became Da Luo's wife and gave birth to a son named Cheng as the proper heir. Shen Hou then spoke to King Xiao and said: 'Formerly my ancestor's Li Shan daughter became the wife of Rong Xuxuan and gave birth to Zhong Hao. Because of kinship, he returned to Zhou and guarded the western frontier. The western frontier was harmonious because of this. Now I again give my daughter to Da Luo as wife, and she gives birth to the proper son Cheng. With the double marriage between Shen and Luo, the western Rong all submit. This is why we serve the king. Your majesty should consider this.' Thus King Xiao said: 'Formerly Bo Yi managed livestock for Shun. The livestock greatly multiplied, so he was given land and granted the surname Ying. Now their descendants also multiply horses for me. I will divide land as a fief for them.' He enfeoffed him at Qin, had him continue the Ying clan sacrifices, and titled him Qin Ying. He also did not discard Shen Hou's daughter as Luo's proper wife, to harmonize with the western Rong.

sentences.zh: 秦嬴生秦侯。

translations.literal: Qin Ying gave birth to Qin Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Ying sired Qin Hou.

sentences.zh: 秦侯立十年，卒。

translations.literal: Qin Hou established ten years, died.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Hou ruled for ten years, then passed away.

sentences.zh: 生公伯。

translations.literal: Gave birth to Gong Bo.
translations.idiomatic: He sired Gong Bo.

sentences.zh: 公伯立三年，卒。

translations.literal: Gong Bo established three years, died.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Bo ruled for three years, then passed away.

sentences.zh: 生秦仲。

translations.literal: Gave birth to Qin Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: He sired Qin Zhong.

translations.literal: Qin Ying gave birth to Qin Hou. Qin Hou was established for ten years and died. He gave birth to Gong Bo. Gong Bo was established for three years and died. He gave birth to Qin Zhong.

sentences.zh: 秦仲立三年，周厲王無道，諸侯或叛之。

translations.literal: Qin Zhong established three years. Zhou Li Wang tyrannical, feudal lords some rebelled against him.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Zhong ruled for three years. King Li of Zhou was tyrannical, and some feudal lords rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 西戎反王室，滅犬丘大駱之族。

translations.literal: Western Rong rebelled against royal house, extinguished Quan Qiu Da Luo clan.
translations.idiomatic: The western Rong rebelled against the royal Zhou house and annihilated the Quan Qiu Da Luo lineage.

sentences.zh: 周宣王即位，乃以秦仲為大夫，誅西戎。

translations.literal: Zhou Xuan Wang ascended throne, then made Qin Zhong grand master, executed western Rong.
translations.idiomatic: When King Xuan of Zhou took the throne, he appointed Qin Zhong as grand master to punish the western Rong.

sentences.zh: 西戎殺秦仲。

translations.literal: Western Rong killed Qin Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: The western Rong assassinated Qin Zhong.

sentences.zh: 秦仲立二十三年，死於戎。

translations.literal: Qin Zhong established twenty-three years, died among Rong.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Zhong ruled for twenty-three years and died fighting the Rong.

sentences.zh: 有子五人，其長者曰莊公。

translations.literal: Had sons five people, his eldest called Zhuang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He had five sons, the eldest named Zhuang Gong.

sentences.zh: 周宣王乃召莊公昆弟五人，與兵七千人，使伐西戎，破之。

translations.literal: Zhou Xuan Wang then summoned Zhuang Gong and his four brothers, gave them seven thousand troops, and sent them to attack the western Rong, where they defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan of Zhou summoned Zhuang Gong and his four brothers, equipped them with seven thousand troops, and dispatched them to conquer the western Rong - which they did.

sentences.zh: 於是復予秦仲後，及其先大駱地犬丘并有之，為西垂大夫。

translations.literal: So he again granted Qin Zhong's descendants the lands, including their ancestor Da Luo's territory at Quan Qiu, and made him the grand master of the western frontier.
translations.idiomatic: Thus he restored Qin Zhong's descendants to their lands, including their ancestor Da Luo's territory at Quan Qiu, and appointed him grand master of the western marches.

translations.literal: Qin Zhong was established for three years. King Li of Zhou was without the Way. Some feudal lords rebelled against him. The western Rong rebelled against the royal house and extinguished the Quanqiu Da Luo clan. King Xuan of Zhou took the throne. He made Qin Zhong a grand master to execute the western Rong. The western Rong killed Qin Zhong. Qin Zhong was established for twenty-three years and died among the Rong. He had five sons. His eldest was called Zhuang Gong. King Xuan of Zhou then summoned Zhuang Gong and his four brothers, gave them seven thousand troops, and had them attack the western Rong. They broke them. Thus he again gave to Qin Zhong's descendants, and they together possessed their ancestor Da Luo's land of Quanqiu, as grand master of the western frontier.

sentences.zh: 莊公居其故西犬丘，生子三人，其長男世父。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong resided in his former territory at western Quan Qiu. He had three sons, and the eldest was named Shi Fu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Gong settled in his ancestral territory at western Quan Qiu. He fathered three sons, the eldest named Shi Fu.

sentences.zh: 世父曰：「戎殺我大父仲，我非殺戎王則不敢入邑。」

translations.literal: Shi Fu said: 'Rong killed my grandfather Zhong, I not kill Rong king then dare not enter city.'
translations.idiomatic: Shi Fu declared: 'The Rong killed my grandfather Zhong. I will not enter the city unless I kill the Rong king.'

sentences.zh: 遂將擊戎，讓其弟襄公。

translations.literal: Then led to attack Rong, yielded to his younger brother Xiang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He then set out to attack the Rong, but yielded the position to his younger brother Xiang Gong.

sentences.zh: 襄公為太子。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong became crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Gong became the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 莊公立四十四年，卒，太子襄公代立。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong established forty-four years, died. Crown prince Xiang Gong succeeded to throne.
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Gong ruled for forty-four years and died. The crown prince Xiang Gong succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 襄公元年，以女弟繆嬴為豐王妻。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong first year, with younger sister Mu Ying as Feng Wang's wife.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiang Gong's first year, he married his younger sister Mu Ying to King Feng.

sentences.zh: 襄公二年，戎圍犬丘，（世父）世父擊之，為戎人所虜。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong second year, Rong surrounded Quan Qiu. Shi Fu attacked them, was captured by Rong people.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiang Gong's second year, the Rong besieged Quan Qiu. Shi Fu attacked them but was captured by the Rong.

sentences.zh: 歲餘，復歸世父。

translations.literal: More than year, then returned Shi Fu.
translations.idiomatic: After more than a year, Shi Fu returned.

sentences.zh: 七年春，周幽王用褒姒廢太子，立褒姒子為適，數欺諸侯，諸侯叛之。

translations.literal: Seventh year spring, Zhou You Wang used Bao Si discarded crown prince, established Bao Si's son as proper heir. Frequently humiliated feudal lords, feudal lords rebelled against him.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of the seventh year, King You of Zhou, under Bao Si's influence, deposed the crown prince and made Bao Si's son the legitimate heir. He frequently humiliated the feudal lords, who rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 西戎犬戎與申侯伐周，殺幽王酈山下。

translations.literal: Western Rong Dog Rong with Shen Hou attacked Zhou, killed You Wang below Li Mountain.
translations.idiomatic: The western Rong and Dog Rong, together with Lord Shen, attacked Zhou and killed King You below Mount Li.

sentences.zh: 而秦襄公將兵救周，戰甚力，有功。

translations.literal: And Qin Xiang Gong led troops rescued Zhou, battled extremely forceful, had merit.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Xiang Gong led troops to rescue Zhou, fighting with great force and achieving merit.

sentences.zh: 周避犬戎難，東徙雒邑，襄公以兵送周平王。

translations.literal: Zhou avoided Dog Rong calamity, east moved Luo city, Xiang Gong with troops escorted Zhou Ping Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou fled the Dog Rong invasion, moving east to Luo city. Xiang Gong escorted King Ping of Zhou with his troops.

sentences.zh: 平王封襄公為諸侯，賜之岐以西之地。

translations.literal: Ping Wang enfeoffed Xiang Gong as feudal lord, granted him lands west of Qi.
translations.idiomatic: King Ping enfeoffed Xiang Gong as a feudal lord and granted him all lands west of Qi.

sentences.zh: 曰：「戎無道，侵奪我岐、豐之地，秦能攻逐戎，即有其地。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Rong unrighteous, invaded seized my Qi, Feng lands. Qin able attack expel Rong, then have their lands.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'The Rong are unrighteous. They invaded and seized my lands at Qi and Feng. If Qin can attack and expel the Rong, then Qin may keep those lands.'

sentences.zh: 與誓，封爵之。

translations.literal: With him swore oath, enfeoffed bestowed title upon him.
translations.idiomatic: He swore an oath with him and bestowed the title of enfeoffment.

sentences.zh: 襄公於是始國，與諸侯通使聘享之禮，乃用騮駒、黃牛、羝羊各三，祠上帝西畤。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong then began establishing state, with feudal lords exchanged envoys and ritual visits. Then used sorrel colt, yellow ox, ram each three, sacrificed to Supreme Lord at western altar.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Gong thus began establishing his state. He exchanged envoys and conducted ritual visits with the other feudal lords. He used three sorrel colts, three yellow oxen, and three rams to sacrifice to the Supreme Lord at the western altar.

sentences.zh: 十二年，伐戎而至岐，卒。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, attacked Rong and reached Qi, died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he attacked the Rong and reached Qi, where he died.

sentences.zh: 生文公。

translations.literal: Gave birth to Wen Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He sired Wen Gong.

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong resided at his former western Quanqiu. He had three sons. His eldest son was Shi Fu. Shi Fu said: 'The Rong killed my grandfather Zhong. I will not dare enter the city unless I kill the Rong king.' He then would attack the Rong but yielded to his younger brother Xiang Gong. Xiang Gong became the crown prince. Zhuang Gong was established for forty-four years. He died. Crown prince Xiang Gong succeeded him. In Xiang Gong's first year, he gave his younger sister Mu Ying as wife to the king of Feng. In Xiang Gong's second year, the Rong surrounded Quanqiu. Shi Fu attacked them but was captured by the Rong people. After more than a year, Shi Fu returned again. In spring of the seventh year, King You of Zhou used Bao Si to depose the crown prince and establish Bao Si's son as the proper heir. He repeatedly deceived the feudal lords. The feudal lords rebelled against him. The western Rong Quanrong, together with Shen Hou, attacked Zhou and killed King You below Mount Li. But Duke Xiang of Qin led troops to save Zhou. He fought very hard and had merit. Zhou avoided the Quanrong difficulty and moved east to Luoyi. Xiang Gong escorted King Ping of Zhou with his troops. King Ping enfeoffed Xiang Gong as a feudal lord and granted him the lands west of Mount Qi. He said: 'The Rong are without the Way. They have invaded and seized my Qi and Feng lands. If Qin can attack and expel the Rong, then Qin will have their lands.' They made an oath and enfeoffed him with nobility. Xiang Gong thus began his state. He communicated with the feudal lords through envoys and marriage and hosting rites. He then used three liu colts, three yellow oxen, and three rams to sacrifice to Heaven at the western altar. In the twelfth year, he attacked the Rong and reached Mount Qi, then died. He gave birth to Wen Gong.

sentences.zh: 文公元年，居西垂宮。

translations.literal: Wen Gong first year, resided western marches palace.
translations.idiomatic: In Wen Gong's first year, he resided in the western marches palace.

sentences.zh: 三年，文公以兵七百人東獵。

translations.literal: Third year, Wen Gong with troops seven hundred east hunted.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Wen Gong went east hunting with seven hundred troops.

sentences.zh: 四年，至汧渭之會。

translations.literal: Fourth year, reached Qian Wei confluence.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, he reached the confluence of the Qian and Wei rivers.

sentences.zh: 曰：「昔周邑我先秦嬴於此，後卒獲為諸侯。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Formerly Zhou settled my ancestor Qin Ying here, later finally obtained feudal lordship.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Formerly Zhou settled my ancestor Qin Ying here. Later he finally obtained feudal lordship.'

sentences.zh: 乃卜居之，占曰吉，即營邑之。

translations.literal: Then divined about residing there, omen said auspicious, then built settlement there.
translations.idiomatic: He then divined about settling there. The omen was favorable, so he built a settlement.

sentences.zh: 十年，初為鄜畤，用三牢。

translations.literal: Tenth year, first made Fu altar, used three sets of sacrificial animals.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, he first established the Fu altar, using three sets of sacrificial animals.

sentences.zh: 十三年，初有史以紀事，民多化者。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, first had scribe to record events, people many civilized ones.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, he first appointed a scribe to record events. Many people became civilized.

sentences.zh: 十六年，文公以兵伐戎，戎敗走。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Wen Gong with troops attacked Rong, Rong defeated fled.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Wen Gong attacked the Rong with his troops. The Rong were defeated and fled.

sentences.zh: 於是文公遂收周餘民有之，地至岐，岐以東獻之周。

translations.literal: Then Wen Gong then gathered Zhou remaining people possessed them, lands reached Qi, Qi eastward offered to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Then Wen Gong gathered the remaining Zhou people and took possession of them. The lands reached Qi. He offered the lands east of Qi to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 十九年，得陳寶。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, obtained Chen treasure.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, he obtained the Chen treasure.

sentences.zh: 二十年，法初有三族之罪。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, law first had three clans punishment.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, the law first established the punishment of three clans.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，伐南山大梓，豐大特。

translations.literal: Twenty-seventh year, attacked southern mountain large catalpa, Feng great unicorn.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, he attacked the large catalpa of the southern mountain and Feng's great unicorn.

sentences.zh: 四十八年，文公太子卒，賜謚為竫公。

translations.literal: Forty-eighth year, Wen Gong crown prince died, granted posthumous title Yue Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-eighth year, Wen Gong's crown prince died and was granted the posthumous title Yue Gong.

sentences.zh: 竫公之長子為太子，是文公孫也。

translations.literal: Yue Gong's eldest son became crown prince, this Wen Gong's grandson.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Gong's eldest son became the crown prince - he was Wen Gong's grandson.

sentences.zh: 五十年，文公卒，葬西山。

translations.literal: Fiftieth year, Wen Gong died, buried western mountain.
translations.idiomatic: In the fiftieth year, Wen Gong died and was buried in the western mountain.

sentences.zh: 竫公子立，是為寧公。

translations.literal: Yue Gong's son ascended throne, this called Ning Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Gong's son ascended the throne and was called Ning Gong.

translations.literal: In Wen Gong's first year, he resided at the western frontier palace. In the third year, Wen Gong went east hunting with seven hundred troops. In the fourth year, he reached the confluence of the Qian and Wei rivers. He said: 'Formerly Zhou enfeoffed my ancestor Qin Ying here. Afterwards he finally obtained the status of feudal lord.' He then divined about residing there. The omen was auspicious. He immediately built a city there. In the tenth year, he initially made the Fu altar, using three sets of sacrificial animals. In the thirteenth year, he initially had scribes to record affairs. Many people became civilized. In the sixteenth year, Wen Gong attacked the Rong with troops. The Rong were defeated and fled. Thus Wen Gong then gathered the Zhou remnant people and possessed them. The land went to Mount Qi. He offered what was east of Mount Qi to Zhou. In the nineteenth year, he obtained the Chen treasure. In the twentieth year, the law initially had the crime of the three clans. In the twenty-seventh year, he attacked the great catalpa of South Mountain and had abundant special offerings. In the forty-eighth year, Wen Gong's crown prince died. He was granted the posthumous title of Ruo Gong. Ruo Gong's eldest son became the crown prince. He was also Wen Gong's grandson. In the fiftieth year, Wen Gong died. He was buried at West Mountain. Ruo Gong's son was established. He was Ning Gong.

sentences.zh: 寧公二年，公徙居平陽。

translations.literal: Ning Gong second year, duke moved residence to Ping Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In Ning Gong's second year, the duke moved his residence to Ping Yang.

sentences.zh: 遣兵伐蕩社。

translations.literal: Dispatched troops attacked Dang She.
translations.idiomatic: He dispatched troops to attack Dang She.

sentences.zh: 三年，與亳戰，亳王奔戎，遂滅蕩社。

translations.literal: Third year, with Bo battled, Bo king fled to Rong, then extinguished Dang She.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, he battled with Bo. The king of Bo fled to the Rong, and Dang She was extinguished.

sentences.zh: 四年，魯公子翬弒其君隱公。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Lu nobleman Hui assassinated his lord Yin Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Lu nobleman Hui assassinated his lord Duke Yin.

sentences.zh: 十二年，伐蕩氏，取之。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, attacked Dang clan, took it.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he attacked the Dang clan and conquered it.

sentences.zh: 寧公生十歲立，立十二年卒，葬西山。

translations.literal: Ning Gong born ten years old ascended throne, ruled twelve years died, buried western mountain.
translations.idiomatic: Ning Gong ascended the throne at age ten. He ruled for twelve years and died, buried in the western mountain.

sentences.zh: 生子三人，長男武公為太子。

translations.literal: Gave birth to sons three, eldest male Wu Gong became crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: He had three sons. The eldest, Wu Gong, became the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 武公弟德公，同母魯姬子。

translations.literal: Wu Gong younger brother De Gong, same mother Lu Ji son.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Gong's younger brother was De Gong, both sons of Lady Lu Ji.

sentences.zh: 生出子。

translations.literal: Gave birth to Chu Zi.
translations.idiomatic: He sired Chu Zi.

sentences.zh: 寧公卒，大庶長弗忌、威壘、三父廢太子而立出子為君。

translations.literal: Ning Gong died. Grand minister Fu Ji, Wei Lei, San Fu deposed crown prince and established Chu Zi as lord.
translations.idiomatic: When Ning Gong died, Grand Minister Fu Ji, Wei Lei, and San Fu deposed the crown prince and established Chu Zi as lord.

sentences.zh: 出子六年，三父等復共令人賊殺出子。

translations.literal: Chu Zi sixth year, San Fu etc. again had people assassinate Chu Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In Chu Zi's sixth year, San Fu and the others again had Chu Zi assassinated.

sentences.zh: 出子生五歲立，立六年卒。

translations.literal: Chu Zi born five years old ascended throne, ruled six years died.
translations.idiomatic: Chu Zi ascended the throne at age five. He ruled for six years and died.

sentences.zh: 三父等乃復立故太子武公。

translations.literal: San Fu etc. then again established former crown prince Wu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: San Fu and the others then re-established the former crown prince Wu Gong.

translations.literal: In Ning Gong's second year, the duke moved and resided at Pingyang. He sent troops to attack Dangshe. In the third year, he fought with Bo. The king of Bo fled to the Rong. He then extinguished Dangshe. In the fourth year, Gong Zi Hui of Lu assassinated their ruler Duke Yin. In the twelfth year, he attacked the Dang clan and took it. Ning Gong was established at age ten. He was established for twelve years and died. He was buried at West Mountain. He had three sons. His eldest son Wu Gong became the crown prince. Wu Gong's younger brother was De Gong. They had the same mother, Lu Ji. She gave birth to Chu Zi. Ning Gong died. The grand minister Fu Ji, Wei Lei, and San Fu deposed the crown prince and established Chu Zi as ruler. In Chu Zi's sixth year, San Fu and the others again together had someone assassinate and kill Chu Zi. Chu Zi was established at age five. He was established for six years and died. San Fu and the others then again established the former crown prince Wu Gong.

sentences.zh: 武公元年，伐彭戲氏，至于華山下，居平陽封宮。

translations.literal: Wu Gong first year, attacked Peng Xi clan, reached below Hua Mountain, resided Ping Yang Feng palace.
translations.idiomatic: In Wu Gong's first year, he attacked the Peng Xi clan, reaching below Mount Hua. He resided at Ping Yang Feng palace.

sentences.zh: 三年，誅三父等而夷三族，以其殺出子也。

translations.literal: Third year, executed San Fu etc. and exterminated three clans, because they killed Chu Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, he executed San Fu and the others and exterminated their three clans, because they had killed Chu Zi.

sentences.zh: 鄭高渠瞇殺其君昭公。

translations.literal: Zheng Gao Qu Mi killed his lord Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Qu Mi of Zheng killed his lord Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 十年，伐邽、冀戎，初縣之。

translations.literal: Tenth year, attacked Gui, Ji Rong, first made counties of them.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, he attacked the Gui and Ji Rong, establishing them as the first counties.

sentences.zh: 十一年，初縣杜、鄭。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, first made counties Du, Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, he established Du and Zheng as counties.

sentences.zh: 滅小虢。

translations.literal: Extinguished little Guo.
translations.idiomatic: He extinguished the minor state of Guo.

translations.literal: In Wu Gong's first year, he attacked the Pengxi clan and reached below Mount Hua. He resided at the Feng palace in Pingyang. In the third year, he executed San Fu and the others and exterminated their three clans, because they had killed Chu Zi. Gao Qu Mi of Zheng killed their ruler Duke Zhao. In the tenth year, he attacked the Rong of Gui and Ji, and initially made them counties. In the eleventh year, he initially made Du and Zheng into counties. He extinguished small Guo.

sentences.zh: 十三年，齊人管至父、連稱等殺其君襄公而立公孫無知。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Qi people Guan Zhi Fu, Lian Cheng etc. killed their lord Xiang Gong and established Gong Sun Wu Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Guan Zhi Fu, Lian Cheng and others from Qi killed their lord Duke Xiang and established Gong Sun Wu Zhi.

sentences.zh: 晉滅霍、魏、耿。

translations.literal: Jin extinguished Huo, Wei, Geng.
translations.idiomatic: Jin extinguished Huo, Wei, and Geng.

sentences.zh: 齊雍廩殺無知、管至父等而立齊桓公。

translations.literal: Qi Yong Lin killed Wu Zhi, Guan Zhi Fu etc. and established Qi Huan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Yong Lin of Qi killed Wu Zhi and Guan Zhi Fu and the others, establishing Duke Huan of Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊、晉為彊國。

translations.literal: Qi, Jin became strong states.
translations.idiomatic: Qi and Jin became powerful states.

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Guan Zhi Fu, Lian Cheng, and others of Qi killed their ruler Duke Xiang and established Gong Sun Wu Zhi. Jin extinguished Huo, Wei, and Geng. Yong Lin of Qi killed Wu Zhi and Guan Zhi Fu and the others, and established Duke Huan of Qi. Qi and Jin became strong states.

sentences.zh: 十九年，晉曲沃始為晉侯。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, Jin Qu Wo first became Jin hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Qu Wo of Jin first became the Marquis of Jin.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公伯於鄄。

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong hegemon at Quan.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi acted as hegemon at Quan.

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Quwo of Jin began as Jin Hou. Duke Huan of Qi was Bo at Juan.

sentences.zh: 二十年，武公卒，葬雍平陽。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, Wu Gong died, buried Yong Ping Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Wu Gong died and was buried at Yong Ping Yang.

sentences.zh: 初以人從死，從死者六十六人。

translations.literal: First with people followed death, followers in death sixty-six people.
translations.idiomatic: This was the first time people were sacrificed to follow him in death - sixty-six people.

sentences.zh: 有子一人，名曰白，白不立，封平陽。

translations.literal: Had son one person, named Bai, Bai not established, enfeoffed Ping Yang.
translations.idiomatic: He had one son, named Bai. Bai was not established as heir; he was enfeoffed at Ping Yang.

sentences.zh: 立其弟德公。

translations.literal: Established his younger brother De Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He established his younger brother De Gong.

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Wu Gong died. He was buried at Yong Pingyang. Initially people followed him in death. Those who followed in death were sixty-six people. He had one son named Bai. Bai was not established. He was enfeoffed at Pingyang. His younger brother De Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 德公元年，初居雍城大鄭宮。

translations.literal: De Gong first year, first resided Yong city great Zheng palace.
translations.idiomatic: In De Gong's first year, he first resided in the great Zheng palace in Yong city.

sentences.zh: 以犧三百牢祠鄜畤。

translations.literal: With sacrificial oxen three hundred sets sacrificed at Fu altar.
translations.idiomatic: He used three hundred sets of sacrificial oxen to sacrifice at the Fu altar.

sentences.zh: 卜居雍。

translations.literal: Divined about residing in Yong.
translations.idiomatic: He divined about settling in Yong.

sentences.zh: 後子孫飲馬於河。

translations.literal: Later descendants watered horses at Yellow River.
translations.idiomatic: Later descendants would water their horses at the Yellow River.

sentences.zh: 梁伯、芮伯來朝。

translations.literal: Liang Bo, Rui Bo came to court.
translations.idiomatic: The Marquis of Liang and Marquis of Rui came to pay court.

sentences.zh: 二年，初伏，以狗御蠱。

translations.literal: Second year, first dog sacrifice, used dogs to ward off witchcraft.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, he first performed the dog sacrifice, using dogs to ward off witchcraft.

sentences.zh: 德公生三十三歲而立，立二年卒。

translations.literal: De Gong born thirty-three years then ascended throne, ruled two years died.
translations.idiomatic: De Gong was born and at thirty-three ascended the throne. He ruled for two years and died.

sentences.zh: 生子三人：長子宣公，中子成公，少子穆公。

translations.literal: Gave birth to sons three: eldest son Xuan Gong, middle son Cheng Gong, youngest son Mu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He had three sons: the eldest Xuan Gong, the middle son Cheng Gong, and the youngest Mu Gong.

sentences.zh: 長子宣公立。

translations.literal: Eldest son Xuan Gong ascended throne.
translations.idiomatic: The eldest son Xuan Gong ascended the throne.

translations.literal: In De Gong's first year, he initially resided at the great Zheng palace in Yong city. He sacrificed three hundred victims at the Fu altar. He divined about residing at Yong. Later descendants would drink their horses at the river. The Bo of Liang and the Bo of Rui came to court. In the second year, he initially performed the fu sacrifice, using dogs to drive away gu. De Gong was established at age thirty-three. He was established for two years and died. He had three sons: the eldest Xuan Gong, the middle Cheng Gong, the youngest Mu Gong. The eldest son Xuan Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 宣公元年，衛、燕伐周，出惠王，立王子穨。

translations.literal: Xuan Gong first year, Wei, Yan attacked Zhou, expelled Hui Wang, established Wang Zi Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In Xuan Gong's first year, Wei and Yan attacked Zhou, expelled King Hui, and established Prince Wei.

sentences.zh: 三年，鄭伯、虢叔殺子穨而入惠王。

translations.literal: Third year, Zheng Bo, Guo Shu killed Zi Wei and reinstated Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, the Marquis of Zheng and Lord Guo killed Zi Wei and reinstated King Hui.

sentences.zh: 四年，作密畤。

translations.literal: Fourth year, established Mi altar.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, he established the Mi altar.

sentences.zh: 與晉戰河陽，勝之。

translations.literal: With Jin battled at He Yang, defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: He battled Jin at He Yang and defeated them.

sentences.zh: 十二年，宣公卒。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Xuan Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Xuan Gong died.

sentences.zh: 生子九人，莫立，立其弟成公。

translations.literal: Gave birth to sons nine people, none established, established his younger brother Cheng Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He had nine sons, but none were established as heir. He established his younger brother Cheng Gong instead.

translations.literal: In Xuan Gong's first year, Wei and Yan attacked Zhou, expelled King Hui, and established Prince Sui. In the third year, the Bo of Zheng and Guo Shu killed Zi Sui and entered King Hui. In the fourth year, he made the Mi altar. He fought with Jin at Heyang and defeated them. In the twelfth year, Xuan Gong died. He had nine sons. None were established. His younger brother Cheng Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 成公元年，梁伯、芮伯來朝。

translations.literal: Cheng Gong first year, Liang Bo, Rui Bo came to court.
translations.idiomatic: In Cheng Gong's first year, the Marquis of Liang and Marquis of Rui came to pay court.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公伐山戎，次于孤竹。

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong attacked Shan Rong, camped at Gu Zhu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi attacked the Shan Rong and camped at Gu Zhu.

translations.literal: In Cheng Gong's first year, the Bo of Liang and the Bo of Rui came to court. Duke Huan of Qi attacked the Shanrong and halted at Guzhu.

sentences.zh: 成公立四年卒。

translations.literal: Cheng Gong established four years died.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Gong ruled for four years and died.

sentences.zh: 子七人，莫立，立其弟繆公。

translations.literal: Sons seven people, none established, established his younger brother Mu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He had seven sons, but none were established as heir. He established his younger brother Mu Gong instead.

translations.literal: Cheng Gong was established for four years and died. He had seven sons. None were established. His younger brother Mu Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 繆公任好元年，自將伐茅津，勝之。

translations.literal: Mu Gong Ren Hao first year, personally led attacked Mao Jin, defeated it.
translations.idiomatic: In Mu Gong Ren Hao's first year, he personally led an attack on Mao Jin and defeated it.

sentences.zh: 四年，迎婦於晉，晉太子申生姊也。

translations.literal: Fourth year, welcomed bride from Jin, Jin crown prince Shen Sheng's elder sister.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, he welcomed a bride from Jin - the elder sister of Jin's crown prince Shen Sheng.

sentences.zh: 其歲，齊桓公伐楚，至邵陵。

translations.literal: That year, Qi Huan Gong attacked Chu, reached Shao Ling.
translations.idiomatic: That same year, Duke Huan of Qi attacked Chu and reached Shao Ling.

translations.literal: In Mu Gong Ren Hao's first year, he personally led an attack on Maojin and defeated them. In the fourth year, he welcomed a wife from Jin. She was also the sister of Jin's crown prince Shen Sheng. That year, Duke Huan of Qi attacked Chu and reached Shaoling.

sentences.zh: 五年，晉獻公滅虞、虢，虜虞君與其大夫百里傒，以璧馬賂於虞故也。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Jin Xian Gong extinguished Yu, Guo, captured Yu lord and his grand master Bai Li Xi, because of jade disc horse bribe to Yu reason.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Duke Xian of Jin extinguished Yu and Guo. He captured the lord of Yu and his grand master Bai Li Xi, because of the jade disc and horse bribe given to Yu.

sentences.zh: 既虜百里傒，以為秦繆公夫人媵於秦。

translations.literal: Already captured Bai Li Xi, made Qin Mu Gong's wife sent to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Having captured Bai Li Xi, he made him the wife of Duke Mu of Qin and sent her to Qin.

sentences.zh: 百里傒亡秦走宛，楚鄙人執之。

translations.literal: Bai Li Xi fled Qin went to Wan, Chu border people captured him.
translations.idiomatic: Bai Li Xi fled from Qin to Wan, where Chu border guards captured him.

sentences.zh: 繆公聞百里傒賢，欲重贖之，恐楚人不與，乃使人謂楚曰：「吾媵臣百里傒在焉，請以五羖羊皮贖之。」

translations.literal: Mu Gong heard Bai Li Xi worthy, wished heavily ransom him, feared Chu people not give, then sent person told Chu said: 'My attendant minister Bai Li Xi there is, please with five black ram skins ransom him.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu heard that Bai Li Xi was worthy and wished to ransom him heavily. Fearing Chu would not give him up, he sent someone to tell Chu: 'My attendant minister Bai Li Xi is there. Please ransom him with five black ram skins.'

sentences.zh: 楚人遂許與之。

translations.literal: Chu people then permitted gave to him.
translations.idiomatic: Chu then permitted giving him up.

sentences.zh: 當是時，百里傒年已七十餘。

translations.literal: At this time, Bai Li Xi age already seventy remainder.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Bai Li Xi was already over seventy years old.

sentences.zh: 繆公釋其囚，與語國事。

translations.literal: Mu Gong released his prisoner, with him discussed state affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu released him from prison and discussed state affairs with him.

sentences.zh: 謝曰：「臣亡國之臣，何足問！」

translations.literal: Declined said: 'I minister of ruined state, what worthy ask!'
translations.idiomatic: He declined, saying: 'I am a minister of a ruined state. What worth is there in asking me!'

sentences.zh: 繆公曰：「虞君不用子，故亡，非子罪也。」

translations.literal: Mu Gong said: 'Yu lord not used you, therefore perished, not your crime.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu said: 'The lord of Yu did not employ you, so the state perished. It was not your fault.'

sentences.zh: 固問，語三日，繆公大說，授之國政，號曰五羖大夫。

translations.literal: Insistently asked, spoke three days, Mu Gong greatly pleased, entrusted him state government, titled Five Black Ram grand master.
translations.idiomatic: He insisted on asking, and they spoke for three days. Duke Mu was greatly pleased and entrusted him with governing the state, titling him the Five Black Ram Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 百里傒讓曰：「臣不及臣友蹇叔，蹇叔賢而世莫知。

translations.literal: Bai Li Xi declined said: 'I not equal my friend Jian Shu, Jian Shu worthy but world none know.
translations.idiomatic: Bai Li Xi declined, saying: 'I am not equal to my friend Jian Shu. Jian Shu is worthy, but the world does not know it.

sentences.zh: 臣常游困於齊而乞食铚人，蹇叔收臣。

translations.literal: I often traveled impoverished in Qi and begged food from Zhi people, Jian Shu took in me.
translations.idiomatic: I often traveled impoverished in Qi and begged for food among the people of Zhi. Jian Shu took me in.'

sentences.zh: 臣因而欲事齊君無知，蹇叔止臣，臣得脫齊難，遂之周。

translations.literal: I therefore wished to serve Qi lord Wu Zhi, Jian Shu stopped me, I obtained escape Qi calamity, then went to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: I therefore wished to serve Lord Wu Zhi of Qi. Jian Shu stopped me, so I escaped Qi's calamity and went to Zhou.'

sentences.zh: 周王子穨好牛，臣以養牛干之。

translations.literal: Zhou Wang Zi Wei loved oxen, I with raising oxen sought him.
translations.idiomatic: Prince Wei of Zhou loved oxen. I sought him out through raising oxen.'

sentences.zh: 及穨欲用臣，蹇叔止臣，臣去，得不誅。

translations.literal: When Wei wished to employ me, Jian Shu stopped me, I left, obtained not executed.
translations.idiomatic: When Wei wished to employ me, Jian Shu stopped me. I left and was not executed.'

sentences.zh: 事虞君，蹇叔止臣。

translations.literal: Served Yu lord, Jian Shu stopped me.
translations.idiomatic: I served the lord of Yu, but Jian Shu stopped me.'

sentences.zh: 臣知虞君不用臣，臣誠私利祿爵，且留。

translations.literal: I knew Yu lord would not employ me, I truly privately benefited salary rank, and stayed.
translations.idiomatic: I knew the lord of Yu would not employ me, so I truly stayed for private benefit of salary and rank.'

sentences.zh: 再用其言，得脫，一不用，及虞君難：是以知其賢。」

translations.literal: Twice used his words, obtained escape, once not used, encountered Yu lord calamity: therefore know his worthiness.'
translations.idiomatic: Twice I used his words and escaped. Once I did not use them, and encountered the lord of Yu's calamity. This is how I know his worthiness.'

sentences.zh: 於是繆公使人厚幣迎蹇叔，以為上大夫。

translations.literal: Then Mu Gong sent people thick gifts welcomed Jian Shu, made him senior grand master.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu then sent people with generous gifts to welcome Jian Shu and made him a senior grand master.

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Duke Xian of Jin extinguished Yu and Guo, captured the Yu ruler and his grand master Baili Xi, because of the jade and horse bribe to Yu. Having captured Baili Xi, he made him an attendant to Qin Mu Gong's lady. Baili Xi fled Qin and went to Wan. A Chu border person seized him. Mu Gong heard Baili Xi was worthy and wished to heavily ransom him. He feared the Chu people would not give him, so he had someone tell Chu: 'My attendant minister Baili Xi is there. Please ransom him with five black sheep skins.' . The Chu people then permitted and gave him. At this time, Baili Xi was already over seventy years old. Mu Gong released his prisoner and spoke with him about state affairs. He declined and said: 'I am a minister of a perished state. What am I worth asking!' Mu Gong said: 'The Yu ruler did not use you, therefore perished. It was not your crime.' He insisted on asking. They spoke for three days. Mu Gong was greatly pleased and granted him state government, titling him the Five Black Sheep Grand Master. Baili Xi declined and said: 'I am not equal to my friend Jianshu. Jianshu is worthy but the world does not know him. I often wandered destitute in Qi and begged food from the people of Zhi. Jianshu took me in. Therefore I wished to serve the Qi ruler Wu Zhi. Jianshu stopped me. I escaped the Qi disaster and went to Zhou. Prince Zi Sui of Zhou liked oxen. I sought him by raising oxen. When Zi Sui wished to use me, Jianshu stopped me. I left and escaped execution. I served the Yu ruler. Jianshu stopped me. I knew the Yu ruler would not use me. I truly stayed for private benefit of salary and rank. Twice I used his words and escaped. Once I did not use them and met with the Yu ruler's disaster. This is why I know his worthiness.' Thus Mu Gong sent someone with rich gifts to welcome Jianshu and made him an upper grand master.

sentences.zh: 秋，繆公自將伐晉，戰於河曲。

translations.literal: Autumn, Mu Gong personally led attacked Jin, battled at He Qu.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, Duke Mu personally led an attack on Jin and battled at He Qu.

sentences.zh: 晉驪姬作亂，太子申生死新城，重耳、夷吾出奔。

translations.literal: Jin Li Ji made rebellion, crown prince Shen Sheng died Xin City, Chong Er, Yi Wu fled.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ji caused rebellion in Jin. Crown prince Shen Sheng died in Xin City. Chong Er and Yi Wu fled.

translations.literal: In autumn, Mu Gong personally led an attack on Jin and fought at Hequ. Li Ji of Jin made rebellion. Crown prince Shen Sheng died at Xin Cheng. Chong'er and Yiwu fled.

sentences.zh: 九年，齊桓公會諸侯於葵丘。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Qi Huan Gong assembled feudal lords at Kui Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Duke Huan of Qi assembled the feudal lords at Kui Qiu.

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Duke Huan of Qi assembled the feudal lords at Kuiqiu.

sentences.zh: 晉獻公卒。

translations.literal: Jin Xian Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian of Jin died.

sentences.zh: 立驪姬子奚齊，其臣里克殺奚齊。

translations.literal: Established Li Ji's son Xi Qi, his minister Li Ke killed Xi Qi.
translations.idiomatic: He established Li Ji's son Xi Qi, but his minister Li Ke assassinated Xi Qi.

sentences.zh: 荀息立卓子，克又殺卓子及荀息。

translations.literal: Xun Xi established Zhuo Zi, Ke again killed Zhuo Zi and Xun Xi.
translations.idiomatic: Xun Xi established Zhuo Zi, but Li Ke again assassinated Zhuo Zi and Xun Xi.

sentences.zh: 夷吾使人請秦，求入晉。

translations.literal: Yi Wu sent people requested Qin, sought enter Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Wu sent people to request Qin and seek to enter Jin.

sentences.zh: 於是繆公許之，使百里傒將兵送夷吾。

translations.literal: Then Mu Gong permitted it, made Bai Li Xi lead troops escorted Yi Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu then permitted it and had Bai Li Xi lead troops to escort Yi Wu.

sentences.zh: 夷吾謂曰：「誠得立，請割晉之河西八城與秦。」

translations.literal: Yi Wu told him said: 'Truly obtain established, please divide Jin's eight cities west of river to Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: Yi Wu told him: 'If I truly gain the throne, I shall cede Jin's eight cities west of the river to Qin.'

sentences.zh: 及至，已立，而使丕鄭謝秦，背約不與河西城，而殺裏克。

translations.literal: When arrived, already established, then made Pi Zheng apologize to Qin, broke agreement not give river west cities, and killed Li Ke.
translations.idiomatic: When he arrived and was established, he had Pi Zheng apologize to Qin, broke the agreement and did not give the cities west of the river, and killed Li Ke.

sentences.zh: 丕鄭聞之，恐，因與繆公謀曰：「晉人不欲夷吾，實欲重耳。

translations.literal: Pi Zheng heard it, feared, therefore with Mu Gong plotted said: 'Jin people not want Yi Wu, truly want Chong Er.
translations.idiomatic: Pi Zheng heard this and feared. He plotted with Duke Mu, saying: 'The Jin people do not want Yi Wu. They truly want Chong Er.

sentences.zh: 今背秦約而殺裏克，皆呂甥、郤芮之計也。

translations.literal: Now broke Qin agreement and killed Li Ke, all Lü Sheng, Xi Rui's plan.'
translations.idiomatic: Now they broke the agreement with Qin and killed Li Ke. All of this was the plan of Lü Sheng and Xi Rui.'

sentences.zh: 願君以利急召呂、郤，呂、郤至，則更入重耳便。」

translations.literal: Wish lord with profit urgently summon Lü, Xi, Lü, Xi arrive, then change enter Chong Er convenient.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish your lordship would urgently summon Lü and Xi with profit. When Lü and Xi arrive, then changing to install Chong Er will be convenient.'

sentences.zh: 繆公許之，使人與丕鄭歸，召呂、郤。

translations.literal: Mu Gong permitted it, made people with Pi Zheng return, summoned Lü, Xi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu permitted it and had people return with Pi Zheng to summon Lü and Xi.

sentences.zh: 呂、郤等疑丕鄭有閒，乃言夷吾殺丕鄭。

translations.literal: Lü, Xi etc. suspected Pi Zheng had treachery, then said Yi Wu kill Pi Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: Lü and Xi suspected Pi Zheng of treachery and had Yi Wu kill Pi Zheng.

sentences.zh: 丕鄭子丕豹奔秦，說繆公曰：「晉君無道，百姓不親，可伐也。」

translations.literal: Pi Zheng's son Pi Bao fled to Qin, persuaded Mu Gong said: 'Jin lord tyrannical, common people not close, can attack.'
translations.idiomatic: Pi Zheng's son Pi Bao fled to Qin and persuaded Duke Mu, saying: 'The Jin lord is tyrannical. The people are not close to him. We can attack.'

sentences.zh: 繆公曰：「百姓茍不便，何故能誅其大臣？

translations.literal: Mu Gong said: 'Common people if not convenient, why could execute their grand ministers?
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu said: 'If the common people were not convenient, why could he execute his grand ministers?

sentences.zh: 能誅其大臣，此其調也。」

translations.literal: Able execute their grand ministers, this their harmony.'
translations.idiomatic: Being able to execute his grand ministers shows he has their harmony.'

sentences.zh: 不聽，而陰用豹。

translations.literal: Not listened, but secretly employed Bao.
translations.idiomatic: He did not listen, but secretly employed Bao.

translations.literal: Duke Xian of Jin died. They established Li Ji's son Xi Qi. His minister Li Ke killed Xi Qi. Xun Xi established Zhuo Zi. Ke again killed Zhuo Zi and Xun Xi. Yiwu sent someone to request Qin, seeking to enter Jin. Thus Mu Gong permitted it and had Baili Xi lead troops to send Yiwu. Yiwu told him: 'If I truly get established, please cut off eight cities west of the river from Jin and give them to Qin.' When he arrived and was already established, he had Pi Zheng thank Qin. He broke the promise and did not give the cities west of the river. He killed Li Ke. Pi Zheng heard this and feared. Therefore he plotted with Mu Gong and said: 'The Jin people do not want Yiwu. They truly want Chong'er. Now breaking the Qin promise and killing Li Ke was all the strategy of Lü Sheng and Xi Rui.' I wish you would urgently summon Lü and Xi with benefits. When Lü and Xi arrive, then changing to enter Chong'er would be convenient.' Mu Gong permitted it and sent someone to return with Pi Zheng to summon Lü and Xi. Lü, Xi, and others suspected Pi Zheng had a rift. They then said that Yiwu killed Pi Zheng. Pi Zheng's son Pi Bao fled to Qin and persuaded Mu Gong saying: 'The Jin ruler has no way. The common people are not close to him. We can attack.' Mu Gong said: 'If the common people were not convenient, why would they be able to execute their grand ministers? Being able to execute their grand ministers shows their harmony.' He did not listen but secretly used Bao.

sentences.zh: 十二年，齊管仲、隰朋死。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Qi Guan Zhong, Xi Peng died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Guan Zhong and Xi Peng of Qi died.

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Guan Zhong and Xi Peng of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 晉旱，來請粟。

translations.literal: Jin drought, came requested grain.
translations.idiomatic: Jin suffered drought and came requesting grain.

sentences.zh: 丕豹說繆公勿與，因其饑而伐之。

translations.literal: Pi Bao persuaded Mu Gong not give, because their hunger attacked them.
translations.idiomatic: Pi Bao persuaded Duke Mu not to give it, and to attack them while they were hungry.

sentences.zh: 繆公問公孫支，支曰：「饑穰更事耳，不可不與。」

translations.literal: Mu Gong asked Gong Sun Zhi, Zhi said: 'Hunger abundance alternating matters, cannot not give.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu asked Gong Sun Zhi, who said: 'Hunger and abundance are alternating matters. We cannot not give.'

sentences.zh: 問百里傒，傒曰：「夷吾得罪於君，其百姓何罪？」

translations.literal: Asked Bai Li Xi, Xi said: 'Yi Wu offended lord, his common people what crime?'
translations.idiomatic: He asked Bai Li Xi, who said: 'Yi Wu offended his lord. What crime have his common people committed?'

sentences.zh: 於是用百里傒、公孫支言，卒與之粟。

translations.literal: Then used Bai Li Xi, Gong Sun Zhi words, finally gave them grain.
translations.idiomatic: He then followed Bai Li Xi and Gong Sun Zhi's words and finally gave them grain.

sentences.zh: 以船漕車轉，自雍相望至絳。

translations.literal: With boats transported cart conveyed, from Yong mutually visible to Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: They transported it by boat and cart, visible from Yong all the way to Jiang.

translations.literal: Jin had drought and came to request grain. Pi Bao persuaded Mu Gong not to give it, but to attack them because of their hunger. Mu Gong asked Gong Sun Zhi. Zhi said: 'Hunger and abundance are alternating matters. We cannot not give.' He asked Baili Xi. Xi said: 'Yiwu offended the ruler. What crime did his common people commit?' Thus he used the words of Baili Xi and Gong Sun Zhi and finally gave them grain. They transported it by boat and cart. From Yong they could see each other all the way to Jiang.

sentences.zh: 十四年，秦饑，請粟於晉。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, Qin famine, requested grain from Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Qin suffered famine and requested grain from Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉君謀之群臣。

translations.literal: Jin lord consulted his ministers.
translations.idiomatic: The lord of Jin consulted his ministers about it.

sentences.zh: 虢射曰：「因其饑伐之，可有大功。」

translations.literal: Guo She said: 'Because their hunger attack them, can have great merit.'
translations.idiomatic: Guo She said: 'Attack them because of their hunger. We can achieve great merit.'

sentences.zh: 晉君從之。

translations.literal: Jin lord followed it.
translations.idiomatic: The lord of Jin followed this advice.

sentences.zh: 十五年，興兵將攻秦。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, raised troops will attack Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, he raised troops to attack Qin.

sentences.zh: 繆公發兵，使丕豹將，自往擊之。

translations.literal: Mu Gong dispatched troops, made Pi Bao lead, personally went attacked them.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu dispatched troops, had Pi Bao lead them, and personally went to attack.

sentences.zh: 九月壬戌，與晉惠公夷吾合戰於韓地。

translations.literal: Ninth month Ren Xu day, with Jin Hui Gong Yi Wu joined battle at Han lands.
translations.idiomatic: On the Ren Xu day of the ninth month, he joined battle with Duke Hui of Jin (Yi Wu) on Han lands.

sentences.zh: 晉君棄其軍，與秦爭利，還而馬騺。

translations.literal: Jin lord abandoned his army, with Qin contended for advantage, returned but horse weary.
translations.idiomatic: The lord of Jin abandoned his army and contended with Qin for advantage. On returning, his horse was weary.

sentences.zh: 繆公與麾下馳追之，不能得晉君，反為晉軍所圍。

translations.literal: Mu Gong with banner below galloped pursued him, could not obtain Jin lord, instead by Jin army surrounded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu galloped after him with his banner men, but could not capture the lord of Jin. Instead, he was surrounded by the Jin army.

sentences.zh: 晉擊繆公，繆公傷。

translations.literal: Jin attacked Mu Gong, Mu Gong wounded.
translations.idiomatic: Jin attacked Duke Mu, wounding him.

sentences.zh: 於是岐下食善馬者三百人馳冒晉軍，晉軍解圍，遂脫繆公而反生得晉君。

translations.literal: Then Qi below ate fine horses three hundred people galloped braved Jin army, Jin army broke siege, then rescued Mu Gong and instead captured alive Jin lord.
translations.idiomatic: Then three hundred men from below Qi who ate fine horses galloped and braved the Jin army. The Jin army broke the siege, rescuing Duke Mu and instead capturing the lord of Jin alive.

sentences.zh: 初，繆公亡善馬，岐下野人共得而食之者三百餘人，吏逐得，欲法之。

translations.literal: Initially, Mu Gong lost fine horses, Qi below rustic people together obtained and ate them three hundred remainder people, officials pursued obtained, wished to punish them.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Duke Mu had lost some fine horses. Three hundred or so rustic people from below Qi had found and eaten them. Officials pursued and caught them, intending to punish them.

sentences.zh: 繆公曰：「君子不以畜產害人。

translations.literal: Mu Gong said: 'Nobleman not with livestock harm people.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu said: 'A nobleman does not harm people over livestock.

sentences.zh: 吾聞食善馬肉不飲酒，傷人。」

translations.literal: I heard eat fine horse meat not drink wine, harms people.'
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that eating fine horse meat without drinking wine harms people.'

sentences.zh: 乃皆賜酒而赦之。

translations.literal: Then all bestowed wine and pardoned them.
translations.idiomatic: He then bestowed wine upon all of them and pardoned them.

sentences.zh: 三百人者聞秦擊晉，皆求從，從而見繆公窘，亦皆推鋒爭死，以報食馬之德。

translations.literal: Three hundred people heard Qin attacked Jin, all sought to follow, followed and saw Mu Gong distressed, also all pushed spear contended death, to repay eating horse kindness.
translations.idiomatic: When these three hundred men heard Qin was attacking Jin, they all sought to follow. They followed and saw Duke Mu in distress, so they all pushed forward with spears, contending to die, to repay the kindness of eating the horses.

sentences.zh: 於是繆公虜晉君以歸，令於國，齊宿，吾將以晉君祠上帝。

translations.literal: Then Mu Gong captured Jin lord returned, ordered in state, Qi rested, I will with Jin lord sacrifice Supreme Lord.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu then captured the lord of Jin and returned. He ordered preparations in the state and rested at Qi, intending to sacrifice the lord of Jin to the Supreme Lord.

sentences.zh: 周天子聞之，曰「晉我同姓」，為請晉君。

translations.literal: Zhou Son of Heaven heard it, said 'Jin I same surname', for requested Jin lord.
translations.idiomatic: When the Zhou Son of Heaven heard this, he said: 'Jin is of the same surname as I.' He interceded for the lord of Jin.

sentences.zh: 夷吾姊亦為繆公夫人，夫人聞之，乃衰绖跣，曰：「妾兄弟不能相救，以辱君命。」

translations.literal: Yi Wu elder sister also was Mu Gong wife, wife heard it, then mourning clothes hemp sandals barefoot, said: 'Concubine brothers cannot mutually save, with disgrace lord command.'
translations.idiomatic: Yi Wu's elder sister was also Duke Mu's wife. When the wife heard this, she donned mourning clothes and hemp sandals, going barefoot, saying: 'My brothers cannot save each other. This disgraces your lordship's command.'

sentences.zh: 繆公曰：「我得晉君以為功，今天子為請，夫人是憂。」

translations.literal: Mu Gong said: 'I obtained Jin lord as merit, now Son of Heaven for requests, wife this worries.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu said: 'I obtained the lord of Jin as merit, but now the Son of Heaven intercedes for him. This worries my wife.'

sentences.zh: 乃與晉君盟，許歸之，更舍上舍，而饋之七牢。

translations.literal: Then with Jin lord allied, permitted return him, changed lodged upper lodging, and presented him seven sets of sacrificial animals.
translations.idiomatic: He then made an alliance with the lord of Jin and permitted his return. He changed his lodging to the upper quarters and presented him with seven sets of sacrificial animals.

sentences.zh: 十一月，歸晉君夷吾，夷吾獻其河西地，使太子圉為質於秦。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, returned Jin lord Yi Wu, Yi Wu offered his river west lands, made crown prince Yu as hostage in Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, he returned Duke Yi Wu of Jin. Yi Wu offered his lands west of the river and sent his crown prince Yu as hostage in Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦妻子圉以宗女。

translations.literal: Qin married wife to Yu with clan daughter.
translations.idiomatic: Qin married a daughter of the clan to Yu as wife.

sentences.zh: 是時秦地東至河。

translations.literal: At this time Qin lands east reached Yellow River.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Qin's lands extended east to the Yellow River.

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Qin had famine and requested grain from Jin. The Jin ruler consulted his ministers. Guo She said: 'Because of their hunger we can attack them. We can have great merit.' The Jin ruler followed it. In the fifteenth year, they raised troops to attack Qin. Mu Gong sent troops and had Pi Bao lead them. He personally went to strike them. On the Renxu day of the ninth month, they joined battle with Duke Hui of Jin, Yiwu, at Han land. The Jin ruler abandoned his army and contended with Qin for advantage. On returning, his horse stumbled. Mu Gong galloped after him with his banner men. He could not get the Jin ruler and was instead surrounded by the Jin army. Jin struck Mu Gong. Mu Gong was wounded. Thus the three hundred men who ate the good horses below Mount Qi galloped and braved the Jin army. The Jin army broke the siege. They freed Mu Gong and instead captured the Jin ruler alive. Initially, Mu Gong lost a good horse. Over three hundred wild men below Mount Qi together got it and ate it. Officials pursued and got them, wishing to punish them. Mu Gong said: 'A gentleman does not harm people with livestock. I have heard that eating good horse meat without drinking wine harms people.' He then granted wine to all and pardoned them. The three hundred men heard Qin was striking Jin. They all sought to follow. When they followed and saw Mu Gong in distress, they all pushed forward with spears and contended to die, to repay the virtue of the horse eating. Thus Mu Gong captured the Jin ruler and returned. He ordered in the state to prepare lodging. 'I will sacrifice the Jin ruler to Heaven.' The Zhou Son of Heaven heard it and said 'Jin is of my same surname.' He requested the Jin ruler. Yiwu's sister was also Mu Gong's lady. The lady heard it and put on mourning garments with hemp shoes barefoot, saying: 'My brothers cannot save each other. This disgraces the ruler's command.' Mu Gong said: 'I got the Jin ruler as merit. Now the Son of Heaven requests him. The lady worries about this.' He then allied with the Jin ruler and permitted returning him. He changed his lodging to an upper lodge and fed him seven sets of sacrificial animals. In the eleventh month, he returned the Jin ruler Yiwu. Yiwu offered his land west of the river and had Crown Prince Yu be a hostage in Qin. Qin married Yu to a clan daughter. At this time, Qin land extended east to the river.

sentences.zh: 十八年，齊桓公卒。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, Qi Huan Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Duke Huan of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 二十年，秦滅梁、芮。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, Qin extinguished Liang, Rui.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Qin extinguished Liang and Rui.

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Duke Huan of Qi died. In the twentieth year, Qin extinguished Liang and Rui.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，晉公子圉聞晉君病，曰：「梁，我母家也，而秦滅之。

translations.literal: Twenty-second year, Jin nobleman Yu heard Jin lord ill, said: 'Liang, my maternal family, but Qin extinguished it.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Jin nobleman Yu heard the lord of Jin was ill and said: 'Liang is my maternal family, but Qin extinguished it.

sentences.zh: 我兄弟多，即君百歲後，秦必留我，而晉輕，亦更立他子。」

translations.literal: My brothers many, when lord hundred years later, Qin must detain me, and Jin lightly, also change establish other son.'
translations.idiomatic: I have many brothers. When the lord passes away, Qin will surely detain me while Jin considers me lightly and establishes another son.'

sentences.zh: 子圉乃亡歸晉。

translations.literal: Zi Yu then fled returned to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Yu then fled back to Jin.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，晉惠公卒，子圉立為君。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, Jin Hui Gong died, Zi Yu established as lord.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Duke Hui of Jin died, and Zi Yu was established as lord.

sentences.zh: 秦怨圉亡去，乃迎晉公子重耳於楚，而妻以故子圉妻。

translations.literal: Qin resented Yu fled away, then welcomed Jin nobleman Chong Er from Chu, and married to him former Zi Yu wife.
translations.idiomatic: Qin resented that Yu had fled away. They then welcomed Jin nobleman Chong Er from Chu and married Yu's former wife to him.

sentences.zh: 重耳初謝，後乃受。

translations.literal: Chong Er initially declined, later then accepted.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er initially declined, but later accepted.

sentences.zh: 繆公益禮厚遇之。

translations.literal: Mu Gong still more rites thickly treated him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu treated him with even greater ceremony and generosity.

sentences.zh: 二十四年春，秦使人告晉大臣，欲入重耳。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year spring, Qin sent people informed Jin ministers, wished enter Chong Er.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of the twenty-fourth year, Qin sent people to inform Jin's ministers of their desire to install Chong Er.

sentences.zh: 晉許之，於是使人送重耳。

translations.literal: Jin permitted it, then sent people escorted Chong Er.
translations.idiomatic: Jin permitted it, and then sent people to escort Chong Er.

sentences.zh: 二月，重耳立為晉君，是為文公。

translations.literal: Second month, Chong Er established as Jin lord, this Wen Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month, Chong Er was established as lord of Jin, becoming Wen Gong.

sentences.zh: 文公使人殺子圉。

translations.literal: Wen Gong sent people killed Zi Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Gong sent people to kill Zi Yu.

sentences.zh: 子圉是為懷公。

translations.literal: Zi Yu this Hui Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Yu became Hui Gong.

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, the Jin noble Yu heard the Jin ruler was ill and said: 'Liang is my mother's family, and Qin has extinguished it. I have many brothers. When the ruler dies, Qin will surely detain me, and Jin will think lightly of me and establish another son.' Zi Yu then fled back to Jin. In the twenty-third year, Duke Hui of Jin died. Zi Yu was established as ruler. Qin resented Yu fleeing away, so they welcomed the Jin noble Chong'er from Chu and married him to Yu's former wife. Chong'er initially declined, but later accepted. Mu Gong moreover treated him with great courtesy and generosity. In spring of the twenty-fourth year, Qin sent someone to inform the Jin ministers, wishing to install Chong'er. Jin permitted it, so they sent someone to escort Chong'er. In the second month, Chong'er was established as Jin ruler. He was Wen Gong. Wen Gong had someone kill Zi Yu. Zi Yu was Huai Gong.

sentences.zh: 其秋，周襄王弟帶以翟伐王，王出居鄭。

translations.literal: That autumn, Zhou Xiang Wang younger brother Dai with Di attacked wang, wang went out resided Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: That autumn, King Xiang of Zhou's younger brother Dai attacked the king with the Di barbarians. The king went out and resided in Zheng.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，周王使人告難於晉、秦。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, Zhou wang sent people informed calamity to Jin, Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, the Zhou king sent people to inform Jin and Qin of the calamity.

sentences.zh: 秦繆公將兵助晉文公入襄王，殺王弟帶。

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong led troops assisted Jin Wen Gong entered Xiang Wang, killed wang younger brother Dai.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu of Qin led troops to assist Duke Wen of Jin in reinstalling King Xiang and killed the king's younger brother Dai.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，晉文公敗楚於城濮。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, Jin Wen Gong defeated Chu at Cheng Pu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Wen of Jin defeated Chu at Cheng Pu.

sentences.zh: 三十年，繆公助晉文公圍鄭。

translations.literal: Thirtieth year, Mu Gong assisted Jin Wen Gong besieged Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Duke Mu assisted Duke Wen of Jin in besieging Zheng.

sentences.zh: 鄭使人言繆公曰：「亡鄭厚晉，於晉而得矣，而秦未有利。

translations.literal: Zheng sent people spoke Mu Gong said: 'Perished Zheng thickly Jin, at Jin obtained, but Qin not yet beneficial.
translations.idiomatic: Zheng sent people to speak to Duke Mu, saying: 'Perished Zheng favors Jin greatly. We will be obtained through Jin, but Qin has not yet benefited.

sentences.zh: 晉之彊，秦之憂也。」

translations.literal: Jin strong, Qin worry.'
translations.idiomatic: Jin's strength is Qin's worry.'

sentences.zh: 繆公乃罷兵歸。

translations.literal: Mu Gong then disbanded troops returned.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu then disbanded his troops and returned.

sentences.zh: 晉亦罷。

translations.literal: Jin also disbanded.
translations.idiomatic: Jin also disbanded.

sentences.zh: 三十二年冬，晉文公卒。

translations.literal: Thirty-second year winter, Jin Wen Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In winter of the thirty-second year, Duke Wen of Jin died.

translations.literal: That autumn, King Xiang's younger brother Dai attacked the king with the Di. The king went out and resided in Zheng. In the twenty-fifth year, the Zhou king sent someone to inform Jin and Qin of the distress. Duke Mu of Qin led troops to assist Duke Wen of Jin in restoring King Xiang and killed the king's younger brother Dai. In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Wen of Jin defeated Chu at Chengpu. In the thirtieth year, Mu Gong assisted Duke Wen of Jin in surrounding Zheng. Zheng sent someone to speak to Mu Gong saying: 'If Zheng perishes it will strengthen Jin. You will obtain benefit from Jin, but Qin will not yet benefit. Jin's strength is Qin's worry.' Mu Gong then dismissed his troops and returned. Jin also dismissed their troops. In winter of the thirty-second year, Duke Wen of Jin died.

sentences.zh: 鄭人有賣鄭於秦曰：「我主其城門，鄭可襲也。」
