translations.literal: Zheng person had betrayed Zheng to Qin said: 'I control its city gate, Zheng can be raided.'
translations.idiomatic: A man from Zheng had betrayed Zheng to Qin, saying: 'I control its city gate. Zheng can be raided.'

sentences.zh: 繆公問蹇叔、百里傒，對曰：「徑數國千里而襲人，希有得利者。

translations.literal: Mu Gong asked Jian Shu, Bai Li Xi, replied said: 'Directly several states thousand li raid people, rarely have obtain profit ones.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu asked Jian Shu and Bai Li Xi, who replied: 'To directly raid people across several states and a thousand li is rare to obtain profit.

sentences.zh: 且人賣鄭，庸知我國人不有以我情告鄭者乎？

translations.literal: Moreover person betrays Zheng, how know my state people not have with my situation inform Zheng ones?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, this person betrays Zheng. How do we know our own people haven't informed Zheng of our plans?

sentences.zh: 不可。」

translations.literal: Cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: It cannot be done.'

sentences.zh: 繆公曰：「子不知也，吾已決矣。」

translations.literal: Mu Gong said: 'You not know, I already decided.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu said: 'You do not know. I have already decided.'

sentences.zh: 遂發兵，使百里傒子孟明視，蹇叔子西乞術及白乙丙將兵。

translations.literal: Then dispatched troops, made Bai Li Xi son Meng Ming Shi, Jian Shu son Xi Qi Shu and Bai Yi Bing lead troops.
translations.idiomatic: He then dispatched troops, having Bai Li Xi's son Meng Ming Shi, Jian Shu's son Xi Qi Shu, and Bai Yi Bing lead the troops.

sentences.zh: 行日，百里傒、蹇叔二人哭之。

translations.literal: March day, Bai Li Xi, Jian Shu two people wept for it.
translations.idiomatic: On the day of departure, Bai Li Xi and Jian Shu wept for it.

sentences.zh: 繆公聞，怒曰：「孤發兵而子沮哭吾軍，何也？」

translations.literal: Mu Gong heard, angry said: 'I dispatch troops but you discourage weep my army, why?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu heard this and angrily said: 'I dispatch troops, but you discourage and weep for my army. Why?'

sentences.zh: 二老曰：「臣非敢沮君軍。

translations.literal: Two elders said: 'I not dare discourage lord army.
translations.idiomatic: The two elders said: 'We do not dare discourage your lordship's army.

sentences.zh: 軍行，臣子與往；

translations.literal: Army goes, I sons with go;
translations.idiomatic: The army goes, and our sons go with it;

sentences.zh: 臣老，遲還恐不相見，故哭耳。」

translations.literal: I old, late return fear not mutually see, therefore weep.'
translations.idiomatic: We are old and fear we will not see each other again if the return is delayed, so we weep.'

sentences.zh: 二老退，謂其子曰：「汝軍即敗，必於殽阨矣。」

translations.literal: Two elders retreated, told their sons said: 'Your army if defeated, must at Xiao Ai.'
translations.idiomatic: The two elders retreated and told their sons: 'If your army is defeated, it will be at Xiao Pass.'

sentences.zh: 三十三年春，秦兵遂東，更晉地，過周北門。

translations.literal: Thirty-third year spring, Qin troops then east, passed through Jin lands, passed Zhou north gate.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of the thirty-third year, Qin troops went east, passed through Jin lands, and passed Zhou's north gate.

sentences.zh: 周王孫滿曰：「秦師無禮，不敗何待！」

translations.literal: Zhou wang grandson Man said: 'Qin troops no ritual, not defeated what wait!'
translations.idiomatic: Zhou's royal grandson Man said: 'The Qin troops are without ritual. What else awaits but defeat!'

sentences.zh: 兵至滑，鄭販賣賈人弦高，持十二牛將賣之周，見秦兵，恐死虜，因獻其牛，曰：「聞大國將誅鄭，鄭君謹修守御備，使臣以牛十二勞軍士。」

translations.literal: Troops reached Hua, Zheng merchant trader Xian Gao, holding twelve oxen about to sell to Zhou, saw Qin troops, feared death captivity, therefore offered his oxen, said: 'Heard great state will punish Zheng, Zheng lord carefully prepares defense preparations, sent I with twelve oxen reward army soldiers.'
translations.idiomatic: The troops reached Hua. Zheng merchant Xian Gao, carrying twelve oxen to sell in Zhou, saw the Qin troops and feared death or capture. He therefore offered his oxen, saying: 'I heard the great state intends to punish Zheng. The lord of Zheng has carefully prepared his defenses. He sent me with twelve oxen to reward the army soldiers.'

sentences.zh: 秦三將軍相謂曰：「將襲鄭，鄭今已覺之，往無及已。」

translations.literal: Qin three generals mutually said: 'Will raid Zheng, Zheng now already aware of it, go no reach already.'
translations.idiomatic: The three Qin generals said to each other: 'We were going to raid Zheng, but Zheng is now already aware of it. Going would be pointless.'

sentences.zh: 滅滑。

translations.literal: Extinguished Hua.
translations.idiomatic: They extinguished Hua.

sentences.zh: 滑，晉之邊邑也。

translations.literal: Hua, Jin's border city.
translations.idiomatic: Hua was Jin's border city.

translations.literal: A Zheng person sold Zheng to Qin saying: 'I control its city gate. Zheng can be raided.' Mu Gong asked Jianshu and Baili Xi. They replied: 'Going through several states for a thousand li to raid someone - rarely do such ventures obtain benefit. Moreover, someone is selling Zheng. How do we know our own people haven't informed Zheng of our plans? Cannot.' Mu Gong said: 'You don't understand. I have already decided.' He then sent troops, having Baili Xi's son Meng Mingshi, Jianshu's son Xi Qishu, and Bai Yibing lead the troops. On the day of departure, Baili Xi and Jianshu wept for them. Mu Gong heard and angrily said: 'I am sending troops and you obstruct and weep for my army. Why?' The two elders said: 'We do not dare obstruct your army. When the army goes, our sons go with it; We are old and fear we will not see each other again if they return late, so we weep.' The two elders withdrew and told their sons: 'Your army will be defeated, and it will be at the Xiao defile.' In spring of the thirty-third year, the Qin troops went east, passing through Jin territory and the north gate of Zhou. Zhou's royal grandson Man said: 'The Qin army has no ritual. What are they waiting for if not defeat!' The troops reached Hua. The Zheng merchant Xian Gao, holding twelve oxen to sell to Zhou, saw the Qin troops. Fearing death or capture, he offered his oxen and said: 'I have heard the great state will punish Zheng. The Zheng ruler has carefully prepared defenses. He sent me with twelve oxen to reward the army soldiers.' The three Qin generals told each other: 'We were going to raid Zheng, but Zheng is already aware. Going now would be pointless.' They extinguished Hua. Hua was a border city of Jin.

sentences.zh: 當是時，晉文公喪尚未葬。

translations.literal: At this time, Jin Wen Gong funeral not yet buried.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Duke Wen of Jin's funeral had not yet taken place.

sentences.zh: 太子襄公怒曰：「秦侮我孤，因喪破我滑。」

translations.literal: Crown prince Xiang Gong angry said: 'Qin insults I orphan, because funeral broke my Hua.'
translations.idiomatic: Crown prince Xiang Gong angrily said: 'Qin insults me, an orphan, and because of the funeral broke my Hua.'

sentences.zh: 遂墨衰绖，發兵遮秦兵於殽，擊之，大破秦軍，無一人得脫者。

translations.literal: Then black mourning clothes hemp sandals, dispatched troops blocked Qin troops at Xiao, attacked them, greatly broke Qin army, none one obtained escape.
translations.idiomatic: He then donned black mourning clothes and hemp sandals, dispatched troops to block the Qin army at Xiao Pass, attacked them, and utterly defeated the Qin army. Not a single man escaped.

sentences.zh: 虜秦三將以歸。

translations.literal: Captured Qin three generals returned.
translations.idiomatic: He captured the three Qin generals and returned.

sentences.zh: 文公夫人，秦女也，為秦三囚將請曰：「繆公之怨此三人入於骨髓，願令此三人歸，令我君得自快烹之。」

translations.literal: Wen Gong wife, Qin woman, for Qin three captive generals requested said: 'Mu Gong's resentment these three people entered marrow, wish make these three people return, make my lord obtain personally pleasure boil them.'
translations.idiomatic: Wen Gong's wife was a Qin woman. She interceded for the three captive Qin generals, saying: 'Duke Mu's resentment of these three men goes to the bone marrow. I wish to have these three men returned so that my lord may personally take pleasure in boiling them.'

sentences.zh: 晉君許之，歸秦三將。

translations.literal: Jin lord permitted it, returned Qin three generals.
translations.idiomatic: The lord of Jin permitted it and returned the three Qin generals.

sentences.zh: 三將至，繆公素服郊迎，向三人哭曰：「孤以不用百里傒、蹇叔言以辱三子，三子何罪乎？

translations.literal: Three generals arrived, Mu Gong plain clothes suburb welcomed, toward three people wept said: 'I because not used Bai Li Xi, Jian Shu words to humiliate three sons, three sons what crime?
translations.idiomatic: When the three generals arrived, Duke Mu, in plain clothes, went to the suburbs to welcome them. He wept toward the three men, saying: 'Because I did not use Bai Li Xi and Jian Shu's words, I have humiliated you three. What crime have you three committed?

sentences.zh: 子其悉心雪恥，毋怠。」

translations.literal: You must whole heart wash shame, not neglect.'
translations.idiomatic: You must devote yourselves completely to washing away this shame. Do not be neglectful.'

sentences.zh: 遂復三人官秩如故，愈益厚之。

translations.literal: Then restored three people official ranks as before, even more increased thickly treated them.
translations.idiomatic: He then restored their official ranks as before and treated them even more generously.

translations.literal: At this time, Duke Wen of Jin's funeral had not yet taken place. Crown Prince Xiang Gong angrily said: 'Qin insults my orphaned state and broke my Hua during mourning.' He then donned black mourning garments with hemp cords and sent troops to block the Qin army at Xiao. They struck them and greatly defeated the Qin army. Not one person escaped. They captured the three Qin generals and returned. Duke Wen's lady, who was a Qin woman, pleaded for the three captive Qin generals: 'Mu Gong's resentment of these three has entered his bone marrow. I wish to have these three returned so my ruler can personally satisfy himself by boiling them.' The Jin ruler permitted it and returned the three Qin generals. When the three generals arrived, Mu Gong in plain clothes welcomed them in the suburbs. Facing the three, he wept and said: 'Because I did not use the words of Baili Xi and Jianshu, I have humiliated you three. What crime have you three committed? You must devote yourselves completely to washing away this shame. Do not be lax.' He then restored their official ranks as before and treated them even more generously.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，楚太子商臣弒其父成王代立。

translations.literal: Thirty-fourth year, Chu crown prince Shang Chen assassinated his father Cheng Wang replaced ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fourth year, Chu's crown prince Shang Chen assassinated his father King Cheng and replaced him on the throne.

translations.literal: In the thirty-fourth year, Chu's crown prince Shang Chen assassinated his father King Cheng and replaced him.

sentences.zh: 繆公於是復使孟明視等將兵伐晉，戰于彭衙。

translations.literal: Mu Gong then again made Meng Ming Shi etc. lead troops attacked Jin, battled at Peng Ya.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu then again had Meng Ming Shi and the others lead troops to attack Jin, battling at Peng Ya.

sentences.zh: 秦不利，引兵歸。

translations.literal: Qin unfavorable, led troops returned.
translations.idiomatic: Qin was at a disadvantage and withdrew its troops.

translations.literal: Mu Gong thus again had Meng Mingshi and others lead troops to attack Jin. They fought at Pengya. Qin was unfavorable and led their troops back.

sentences.zh: 戎王使由余於秦。

translations.literal: Rong wang sent You Yu to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: The Rong king sent You Yu to Qin.

sentences.zh: 由余，其先晉人也，亡入戎，能晉言。

translations.literal: You Yu, his ancestors Jin people, fled entered Rong, able Jin speech.
translations.idiomatic: You Yu's ancestors were Jin people. He fled to the Rong and could speak Jin language.

sentences.zh: 聞繆公賢，故使由余觀秦。

translations.literal: Heard Mu Gong worthy, therefore sent You Yu observe Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Having heard that Duke Mu was worthy, he therefore sent You Yu to observe Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦繆公示以宮室、積聚。

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong showed with palaces, accumulations.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu of Qin showed him the palaces and granaries.

sentences.zh: 由余曰：「使鬼為之，則勞神矣。

translations.literal: You Yu said: 'Make ghosts do it, then tire spirits.
translations.idiomatic: You Yu said: 'If ghosts did it, it would tire the spirits.

sentences.zh: 使人為之，亦苦民矣。」

translations.literal: Make people do it, also bitter people.'
translations.idiomatic: If people did it, it would embitter the people.'

sentences.zh: 繆公怪之，問曰：「中國以詩書禮樂法度為政，然尚時亂，今戎夷無此，何以為治，不亦難乎？」

translations.literal: Mu Gong was surprised by it, asked said: 'Central states with poetry books ritual music law measures govern, yet still sometimes chaotic, now Rong Yi without this, what with govern, not also difficult?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu was surprised by this and asked: 'The central states govern with poetry, books, ritual, music, and laws, yet they still sometimes fall into chaos. Now the Rong and Yi have none of this. How do they govern? Is it not difficult?'

sentences.zh: 由余笑曰：「此乃中國所以亂也。

translations.literal: You Yu laughed said: 'This namely central states so chaotic.
translations.idiomatic: You Yu laughed and said: 'This is exactly why the central states fall into chaos.

sentences.zh: 夫自上聖黃帝作為禮樂法度，身以先之，僅以小治。

translations.literal: Indeed since upper sage Huang Di made ritual music law measures, body with first them, barely with small governance.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, since the supreme sage Huang Di created ritual, music, and laws, and led by example himself, it barely achieved minor governance.

sentences.zh: 及其後世，日以驕淫。

translations.literal: Reached their later generations, daily with arrogance licentiousness.
translations.idiomatic: By their later generations, they daily became arrogant and licentious.

sentences.zh: 阻法度之威，以責督於下，下罷極則以仁義怨望於上，上下交爭怨而相篡弒，至於滅宗，皆以此類也。

translations.literal: Blocked law measures awe, with demand supervise at below, below tired extreme then with benevolence righteousness resentment look at above, upper lower mutually contended resented and mutually usurped assassinated, reached extinguished clan, all with this category.
translations.idiomatic: They relied on the awe of laws and measures to demand and supervise those below. When those below became utterly exhausted, they resented those above with benevolence and righteousness. Upper and lower mutually contended and resented each other, leading to usurpation and assassination, even to the extinction of clans. All of this comes from this category.

sentences.zh: 夫戎夷不然。

translations.literal: Indeed Rong Yi not so.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, the Rong and Yi are not like this.

sentences.zh: 上含淳德以遇其下，下懷忠信以事其上，一國之政猶一身之治，不知所以治，此真聖人之治也。」

translations.literal: Above contained pure virtue to treat their below, below cherished loyalty faith to serve their above, one state's governance like one body's governance, not know so govern, this true sage person's governance.'
translations.idiomatic: Those above contain pure virtue to treat those below, those below cherish loyalty and faith to serve those above. One state's governance is like one body's governance. They do not know how they govern. This is truly the governance of sage persons.'

sentences.zh: 於是繆公退而問內史廖曰：「孤聞鄰國有聖人，敵國之憂也。

translations.literal: Then Mu Gong retreated asked inner scribe Liao said: 'I heard neighboring state has sage person, enemy state's worry.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu then retired and asked Inner Scribe Liao: 'I have heard that a neighboring state having a sage person is an enemy state's worry.

sentences.zh: 今由余賢，寡人之害，將奈之何？」

translations.literal: Now You Yu worthy, my harm, will how do it?'
translations.idiomatic: Now You Yu is worthy. He is my harm. What shall I do?'

sentences.zh: 內史廖曰：「戎王處辟匿，未聞中國之聲。

translations.literal: Inner scribe Liao said: 'Rong wang dwells remote hidden, not heard central states sound.
translations.idiomatic: Inner Scribe Liao said: 'The Rong king dwells in remote seclusion and has not heard the sounds of the central states.

sentences.zh: 君試遺其女樂，以奪其志；

translations.literal: Lord try send his female musicians, with seize his will;
translations.idiomatic: Your lordship should try sending him female musicians to seize his will;

sentences.zh: 為由余請，以疏其閒；

translations.literal: For You Yu request, with loosen his relations;
translations.idiomatic: Make requests for You Yu to loosen his relations;

sentences.zh: 留而莫遣，以失其期。

translations.literal: Detain not send, with miss his time.
translations.idiomatic: Detain him and do not send him back, to make him miss his deadline.

sentences.zh: 戎王怪之，必疑由余。

translations.literal: Rong wang will be surprised by it, must suspect You Yu.
translations.idiomatic: The Rong king will be surprised by this and must suspect You Yu.

sentences.zh: 君臣有閒，乃可虜也。

translations.literal: Lord minister have separation, then can capture.
translations.idiomatic: If lord and minister become estranged, then we can capture him.

sentences.zh: 且戎王好樂，必怠於政。」

translations.literal: Moreover Rong wang loves music, must neglect politics.'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, the Rong king loves music and must neglect his governance.'

sentences.zh: 繆公曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Mu Gong said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 因與由余曲席而坐，傳器而食，問其地形與其兵勢盡察，而後令內史廖以女樂二八遺戎王。

translations.literal: Therefore with You Yu curved mat sat, passed vessels ate, asked his terrain and his troop situation completely examined, then ordered inner scribe Liao with female musicians sixteen sent Rong wang.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore he sat with You Yu on curved mats, passed vessels and ate together. He asked about the terrain and troop dispositions, completely examining them. Then he ordered Inner Scribe Liao to send sixteen female musicians to the Rong king.

sentences.zh: 戎王受而說之，終年不還。

translations.literal: Rong wang received pleased with them, whole year not returned.
translations.idiomatic: The Rong king received them and was delighted. He did not return for a whole year.

sentences.zh: 於是秦乃歸由余。

translations.literal: Then Qin then returned You Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Then Qin returned You Yu.

sentences.zh: 由余數諫不聽，繆公又數使人閒要由余，由余遂去降秦。

translations.literal: You Yu repeatedly admonished not listened, Mu Gong again repeatedly sent people secretly enticed You Yu, You Yu then left surrendered Qin.
translations.idiomatic: You Yu repeatedly admonished but was not listened to. Duke Mu again repeatedly sent people to secretly entice You Yu. You Yu then left and surrendered to Qin.

sentences.zh: 繆公以客禮禮之，問伐戎之形。

translations.literal: Mu Gong with guest ritual treated him, asked attack Rong shape.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu treated him with guest rituals and asked about the strategy for attacking the Rong.

translations.literal: The Rong king sent You Yu to Qin. You Yu's ancestors were Jin people. He fled and entered the Rong, and could speak the Jin language. Having heard Mu Gong was worthy, he therefore sent You Yu to observe Qin. Qin Mu Gong showed him the palaces and accumulations. You Yu said: 'If ghosts made it, then it would labor the spirits. If people made it, it would also embitter the people.' Mu Gong was astonished and asked: 'China uses poetry, books, ritual, music, and laws to govern, yet there is still occasional chaos. Now the Rong and Yi have none of this. What do they govern with? Is it not difficult?' You Yu laughed and said: 'This is precisely why China is chaotic. Since the supreme sage Yellow Emperor created ritual, music, and laws, and led by example himself, he barely achieved a small measure of order. When it came to his later generations, they became increasingly arrogant and licentious. They blocked the authority of the laws and used them to demand and supervise from below. When the lower people became utterly exhausted, they resented and hoped for benevolence and righteousness from above. Ruler and subject mutually contended and resented each other, leading to usurpation and assassination, even to the extinction of clans. All of this is of this category. The Rong and Yi are not like this. The superiors contain pure virtue in treating their inferiors. The inferiors cherish loyalty and faith in serving their superiors. A state's government is like governing one body. They don't know how they govern - this is truly the governance of sages.' Thus Mu Gong withdrew and asked Inner Scribe Liao: 'I have heard that neighboring states having sages is the worry of enemy states. Now You Yu is worthy. He is my harm. What shall I do?' Inner Scribe Liao said: 'The Rong king dwells in remote seclusion and has not heard the sounds of China. Your majesty should try sending him female musicians to seize his will; make requests for You Yu to loosen the space between them; detain him and not send him back, to make him miss his deadline. The Rong king will find it strange and must suspect You Yu. When there is space between ruler and minister, then we can capture him. Moreover, the Rong king likes music and must neglect his governance.' Mu Gong said: 'Good.' Therefore he sat with You Yu on curved mats and ate by passing vessels. He asked about the terrain and troop dispositions and examined everything. Then he commanded Inner Scribe Liao to send sixteen female musicians to the Rong king. The Rong king received them and was pleased. He did not return for a whole year. Thus Qin then returned You Yu. You Yu admonished several times but was not listened to. Mu Gong again several times had people secretly intercept You Yu. You Yu then left and surrendered to Qin. Mu Gong treated him with guest rituals and asked about the form of attacking the Rong.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，繆公復益厚孟明等，使將兵伐晉，渡河焚船，大敗晉人，取王官及鄗，以報殽之役。

translations.literal: Thirty-sixth year, Mu Gong again increased thickness Meng Ming etc., made lead troops attacked Jin, crossed river burned boats, greatly defeated Jin people, took Wang Guan and Hao, to repay Xiao campaign.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Mu again treated Meng Ming and the others even more generously. He had them lead troops to attack Jin, cross the river and burn the boats. They greatly defeated the Jin people, taking Wang Guan and Hao, to repay the Xiao campaign.

sentences.zh: 晉人皆城守不敢出。

translations.literal: Jin people all walled defended dared not go out.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people all defended their cities and dared not come out.

sentences.zh: 於是繆公乃自茅津渡河，封殽中尸，為發喪，哭之三日。

translations.literal: Then Mu Gong then from Mao Jin crossed river, buried Xiao middle corpses, for conducted mourning, wept them three days.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu then crossed the river from Mao Jin, buried the corpses in Xiao, conducted mourning, and wept for them three days.

sentences.zh: 乃誓於軍曰：「嗟士卒！

translations.literal: Then swore in army said: 'Alas soldiers!
translations.idiomatic: He then swore an oath in the army, saying: 'Alas, soldiers!

sentences.zh: 聽無譁，余誓告汝。

translations.literal: Listen no noise, I swear tell you.
translations.idiomatic: Listen without making noise. I swear and tell you.

sentences.zh: 古之人謀黃髪番番，則無所過。」

translations.literal: Ancient people planned yellow hair repeatedly, then nothing wrong.'
translations.idiomatic: The ancient people planned with yellow hair repeatedly, then there were no mistakes.'

sentences.zh: 以申思不用蹇叔、百里傒之謀，故作此誓，令後世以記余過。

translations.literal: With declare thought not used Jian Shu, Bai Li Xi plans, therefore made this oath, make later generations with record my mistakes.
translations.idiomatic: To declare my regret for not using Jian Shu and Bai Li Xi's plans, I therefore made this oath so that later generations may remember my mistakes.

sentences.zh: 君子聞之，皆為垂涕，曰：「嗟乎！

translations.literal: Noblemen heard it, all became shedding tears, said: 'Alas!
translations.idiomatic: When noblemen heard this, they all shed tears, saying: 'Alas!

sentences.zh: 秦繆公之與人周也，卒得孟明之慶。」

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong with people thorough, finally obtained Meng Ming blessing.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu of Qin was thorough with people, and finally obtained Meng Ming's blessing.'

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Mu Gong again treated Meng Ming and the others even more generously. He had them lead troops to attack Jin. They crossed the river and burned their boats. They greatly defeated the Jin people, taking Wangguan and Gao, to repay the Xiao campaign. The Jin people all defended their cities and dared not come out. Thus Mu Gong then crossed the river from Maojin. He buried the corpses in Xiao and held mourning. He wept for them for three days. He then swore to the army saying: 'Alas, soldiers! Listen without noise. I swear and tell you. Ancient people consulted the white-haired elders repeatedly, then there was nothing wrong.' To declare my regret at not using the plans of Jianshu and Baili Xi, I therefore made this oath, so that later generations will record my mistake. The gentlemen who heard it all shed tears and said: 'Alas! Duke Mu of Qin was thorough with people. In the end he got Meng Ming's blessing.'

sentences.zh: 三十七年，秦用由余謀伐戎王，益國十二，開地千里，遂霸西戎。

translations.literal: Thirty-seventh year, Qin used You Yu plan attacked Rong wang, increased states twelve, opened land thousand li, then hegemoned western Rong.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, Qin used You Yu's plan to attack the Rong king. They increased their territory by twelve states, opened a thousand li of land, and thus became hegemon of the western Rong.

sentences.zh: 天子使召公過賀繆公以金鼓。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven made Zhao Gong Guo congratulate Mu Gong with gold drums.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven sent Zhao Gong Guo to congratulate Duke Mu with gold drums.

sentences.zh: 三十九年，繆公卒，葬雍。

translations.literal: Thirty-ninth year, Mu Gong died, buried Yong.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-ninth year, Duke Mu died and was buried in Yong.

sentences.zh: 從死者百七十七人，秦之良臣子輿氏三人名曰奄息、仲行、鍼虎，亦在從死之中。

translations.literal: Followers in death one hundred seventy-seven people, Qin's good ministers Zi Yu clan three people named Yan Xi, Zhong Xing, Zhen Hu, also in followers in death among.
translations.idiomatic: One hundred seventy-seven people followed him in death. Among Qin's good ministers, three from the Zi Yu clan named Yan Xi, Zhong Xing, and Zhen Hu were also among those who followed in death.

sentences.zh: 秦人哀之，為作歌黃鳥之詩。

translations.literal: Qin people grieved him, for made song Yellow Bird poem.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin people grieved for him and composed the song 'Yellow Bird'.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：「秦繆公廣地益國，東服彊晉，西霸戎夷，然不為諸侯盟主，亦宜哉。

translations.literal: Nobleman said: 'Qin Mu Gong broadened land increased state, east submitted strong Jin, west hegemoned Rong Yi, yet not became feudal lords alliance leader, also fitting.
translations.idiomatic: The nobleman said: 'Duke Mu of Qin broadened his lands and increased his state. He submitted the strong Jin to the east and became hegemon of the Rong and Yi to the west. Yet he did not become the alliance leader of the feudal lords. This is also fitting.

sentences.zh: 死而棄民，收其良臣而從死。

translations.literal: Died and abandoned people, gathered his good ministers and followed death.
translations.idiomatic: He died and abandoned his people, but gathered his good ministers to follow him in death.

sentences.zh: 且先王崩，尚猶遺德垂法，況奪之善人良臣百姓所哀者乎？

translations.literal: Moreover former king collapsed, still yet left virtue hung laws, moreover took away good people good ministers common people grieved ones?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, when former kings passed away, they still left behind virtue and established laws. How much more so when taking away good people and worthy ministers whom the common people grieve for?

sentences.zh: 是以知秦不能復東征也。」

translations.literal: Therefore know Qin cannot again east campaign.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore we know Qin cannot campaign east again.'

sentences.zh: 繆公子四十人，其太子嵤代立，是為康公。

translations.literal: Mu Gong sons forty people, his crown prince Chong succeeded ascended throne, this Kang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu had forty sons. His crown prince Chong succeeded to the throne and was called Kang Gong.

translations.literal: In the thirty-seventh year, Qin used You Yu's plan to attack the Rong king. They increased their states by twelve and opened up a thousand li of land. They then became hegemon of the Western Rong. The Son of Heaven sent Shao Gong Guo to congratulate Mu Gong with gold drums. In the thirty-ninth year, Mu Gong died. He was buried at Yong. There were one hundred seventy-seven followers in death. Three good ministers of Qin from the Zi Yu clan named Yanxi, Zhongxing, and Zhenhui were also among those who followed in death. The Qin people mourned them and made the song of the Yellow Bird poem. The gentlemen said: 'Duke Mu of Qin broadened his lands and increased his state. He subjugated strong Jin in the east and became hegemon of the Rong and Yi in the west. Yet he did not become the alliance leader of the feudal lords. This was also fitting. He died and abandoned his people, taking their good ministers to follow him in death. Moreover, when former kings passed away, they still left virtue and established laws. How much more so should we not take the good people and worthy ministers whom the common people mourned?' This is why we know Qin cannot campaign east again.' Mu Gong had forty sons. His crown prince Gong succeeded him. He was Kang Gong.

sentences.zh: 康公元年。

translations.literal: Kang Gong first year.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Gong's first year.

sentences.zh: 往歲繆公之卒，晉襄公亦卒；

translations.literal: Previous year Mu Gong died, Jin Xiang Gong also died;
translations.idiomatic: In the previous year, Duke Mu died, and Duke Xiang of Jin also died;

sentences.zh: 襄公之弟名雍，秦出也，在秦。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong younger brother named Yong, Qin birth, in Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang's younger brother named Yong was born of a Qin mother and was in Qin.

sentences.zh: 晉趙盾欲立之，使隨會來迎雍，秦以兵送至令狐。

translations.literal: Jin Zhao Dun wished establish him, made Sui Hui come welcome Yong, Qin with troops escorted to Ling Hu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun of Jin wished to establish him. He sent Sui Hui to welcome Yong, and Qin escorted him with troops to Ling Hu.

sentences.zh: 晉立襄公子而反擊秦師，秦師敗，隨會來奔。

translations.literal: Jin established Xiang Gong son and instead attacked Qin troops, Qin troops defeated, Sui Hui came fled.
translations.idiomatic: Jin established Duke Xiang's son instead and attacked the Qin troops. The Qin troops were defeated, and Sui Hui came fleeing.

sentences.zh: 二年，秦伐晉，取武城，報令狐之役。

translations.literal: Second year, Qin attacked Jin, took Wu Cheng, repaid Ling Hu campaign.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Qin attacked Jin, took Wu Cheng, to repay the Ling Hu campaign.

sentences.zh: 四年，晉伐秦，取少梁。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Jin attacked Qin, took Shao Liang.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Jin attacked Qin and took Shao Liang.

sentences.zh: 六年，秦伐晉，取羈馬。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Qin attacked Jin, took Ji Ma.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Qin attacked Jin and took Ji Ma.

sentences.zh: 戰於河曲，大敗晉軍。

translations.literal: Battled at He Qu, greatly defeated Jin army.
translations.idiomatic: They battled at He Qu and greatly defeated the Jin army.

sentences.zh: 晉人患隨會在秦為亂，乃使魏讎餘詳反，合謀會，詐而得會，會遂歸晉。

translations.literal: Jin people worried Sui Hui in Qin made chaos, then made Wei Chou Yu pretended rebel, united plotted Hui, deceived and obtained Hui, Hui then returned Jin.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people worried that Sui Hui in Qin would cause chaos. They had Wei Chou Yu pretend to rebel, unite in plotting with Hui, deceive and obtain Hui, and Hui then returned to Jin.

sentences.zh: 康公立十二年卒，子共公立。

translations.literal: Kang Gong established twelve years died, son Gong Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: Kang Gong ruled for twelve years and died. His son Gong Gong was established.

translations.literal: In Kang Gong's first year. In the previous year when Mu Gong died, Duke Xiang of Jin also died; Xiang Gong's younger brother named Yong was born of Qin and was in Qin. Zhao Dun of Jin wished to establish him and sent Sui Hui to welcome Yong. Qin sent troops to escort him to Linghu. Jin established Xiang Gong's son instead and attacked the Qin troops. The Qin troops were defeated. Sui Hui fled to Qin. In the second year, Qin attacked Jin and took Wucheng, to repay the Linghu campaign. In the fourth year, Jin attacked Qin and took Shaoliang. In the sixth year, Qin attacked Jin and took Jima. They fought at Hequ and greatly defeated the Jin army. The Jin people worried that Sui Hui in Qin would cause chaos, so they had Wei Chouyu feign defection. They united to plot against Hui, deceived and got him. Hui then returned to Jin. Kang Gong was established for twelve years and died. His son Gong Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 共公二年，晉趙穿弒其君靈公。

translations.literal: Gong Gong second year, Jin Zhao Chuan assassinated his lord Ling Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In Gong Gong's second year, Zhao Chuan of Jin assassinated his lord Duke Ling.

sentences.zh: 三年，楚莊王彊，北兵至雒，問周鼎。

translations.literal: Third year, Chu Zhuang Wang strong, north troops reached Luo, asked Zhou tripod.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, King Zhuang of Chu was strong. He marched north with troops to Luo and inquired about the Zhou tripod.

sentences.zh: 共公立五年卒，子桓公立。

translations.literal: Gong Gong established five years died, son Huan Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Gong ruled for five years and died. His son Huan Gong was established.

translations.literal: In Gong Gong's second year, Zhao Chuan of Jin assassinated their ruler Duke Ling. In the third year, King Zhuang of Chu was strong. He sent troops north to Luo and asked about the Zhou ding. Gong Gong was established for five years and died. His son Huan Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 桓公三年，晉敗我一將。

translations.literal: Huan Gong third year, Jin defeated our one general.
translations.idiomatic: In Huan Gong's third year, Jin defeated one of our generals.

sentences.zh: 十年，楚莊王服鄭，北敗晉兵於河上。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Chu Zhuang Wang submitted Zheng, north defeated Jin troops on Yellow River.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, King Zhuang of Chu brought Zheng into submission and defeated Jin troops north of the Yellow River.

sentences.zh: 當是之時，楚霸，為會盟合諸侯。

translations.literal: At this time, Chu hegemoned, made alliances gathered feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Chu was hegemon and held alliances gathering the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，晉厲公初立，與秦桓公夾河而盟。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, Jin Li Gong newly established, with Qin Huan Gong flanked river allied.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Li of Jin was newly established. He made an alliance with Duke Huan of Qin flanking the river.

sentences.zh: 歸而秦倍盟，與翟合謀擊晉。

translations.literal: Returned and Qin doubled alliance, with Di united plotted attacked Jin.
translations.idiomatic: They returned and Qin violated the alliance, uniting with the Di to plot against Jin.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，晉率諸侯伐秦，秦軍敗走，追至涇而還。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year, Jin led feudal lords attacked Qin, Qin army defeated fled, pursued to Jing then returned.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Jin led the feudal lords to attack Qin. The Qin army was defeated and fled. They pursued to the Jing and then returned.

sentences.zh: 桓公立二十七年卒，子景公立。

translations.literal: Huan Gong established twenty-seven years died, son Jing Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Gong ruled for twenty-seven years and died. His son Jing Gong was established.

translations.literal: In Huan Gong's third year, Jin defeated one of our generals. In the tenth year, King Zhuang of Chu subjugated Zheng and defeated Jin troops north at the river. At this time, Chu was hegemon and assembled and allied the feudal lords. In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Li of Jin was initially established and allied with Duke Huan of Qin across the river. Upon returning, Qin broke the alliance and united with the Di to plot against Jin. In the twenty-sixth year, Jin led the feudal lords to attack Qin. The Qin army was defeated and fled. They pursued to the Jing and returned. Huan Gong was established for twenty-seven years and died. His son Jing Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 景公四年，晉欒書弒其君厲公。

translations.literal: Jing Gong fourth year, Jin Luan Shu assassinated his lord Li Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In Jing Gong's fourth year, Luan Shu of Jin assassinated his lord Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 十五年，救鄭，敗晉兵於櫟。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, rescued Zheng, defeated Jin troops at Li.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, they rescued Zheng and defeated Jin troops at Li.

sentences.zh: 是時晉悼公為盟主。

translations.literal: This time Jin Dao Gong was alliance leader.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Duke Dao of Jin was the alliance leader.

sentences.zh: 十八年，晉悼公彊，數會諸侯，率以伐秦，敗秦軍。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, Jin Dao Gong strong, repeatedly assembled feudal lords, led to attack Qin, defeated Qin army.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Duke Dao of Jin was strong. He repeatedly assembled the feudal lords and led them to attack Qin, defeating the Qin army.

sentences.zh: 秦軍走，晉兵追之，遂渡涇，至棫林而還。

translations.literal: Qin army fled, Jin troops pursued them, then crossed Jing, reached Yu Lin then returned.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin army fled. The Jin troops pursued them, then crossed the Jing, reached Yu Lin, and returned.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，景公如晉，與平公盟，已而背之。

translations.literal: Twenty-seventh year, Jing Gong went to Jin, with Ping Gong allied, then betrayed it.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Duke Jing went to Jin and made an alliance with Duke Ping, then betrayed it.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，楚公子圍弒其君而自立，是為靈王。

translations.literal: Thirty-sixth year, Chu nobleman Wei assassinated his lord self established, this Ling Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, Chu's nobleman Wei assassinated his lord and established himself, becoming King Ling.

sentences.zh: 景公母弟後子鍼有寵，景公母弟富，或譖之，恐誅，乃奔晉，車重千乘。

translations.literal: Jing Gong mother younger brother Hou Zi Zhen had favor, Jing Gong mother younger brother Fu, someone slandered him, feared execution, then fled Jin, chariots heavy thousand chariots.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing's younger maternal brother Hou Zi Zhen was favored. Duke Jing's younger maternal brother Fu was wealthy. Someone slandered him. Fearing execution, he fled to Jin with a thousand chariots of possessions.

sentences.zh: 晉平公曰：「后子富如此，何以自亡？」

translations.literal: Jin Ping Gong said: 'Hou Zi rich like this, why self perished?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ping of Jin said: 'Hou Zi is rich like this. Why did he cause his own ruin?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「秦公無道，畏誅，欲待其後世乃歸。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Qin gong without way, feared execution, wished wait his later generations then return.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'The lord of Qin is without the Way. I feared execution. I wish to wait for his later generations and then return.'

sentences.zh: 三十九年，楚靈王彊，會諸侯於申，為盟主，殺齊慶封。

translations.literal: Thirty-ninth year, Chu Ling Wang strong, assembled feudal lords at Shen, became alliance leader, killed Qi Qing Feng.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-ninth year, King Ling of Chu was strong. He assembled the feudal lords at Shen, became the alliance leader, and killed Qing Feng of Qi.

sentences.zh: 景公立四十年卒，子哀公立。

translations.literal: Jing Gong established forty years died, son Ai Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Gong ruled for forty years and died. His son Ai Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 后子復來歸秦。

translations.literal: Hou Zi again came returned Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Hou Zi came back and returned to Qin.

translations.literal: In Jing Gong's fourth year, Luan Shu of Jin assassinated their ruler Duke Li. In the fifteenth year, they rescued Zheng and defeated Jin troops at Yue. At this time, Duke Dao of Jin was the alliance leader. In the eighteenth year, Duke Dao of Jin was strong. He assembled the feudal lords several times and led them to attack Qin, defeating the Qin army. The Qin army fled. The Jin troops pursued them, then crossed the Jing, reached Yulin, and returned. In the twenty-seventh year, Jing Gong went to Jin and allied with Duke Ping, then broke the alliance. In the thirty-sixth year, Gong Zi Wei of Chu assassinated their ruler and established himself. He was King Ling. Jing Gong's younger maternal brother Hou Zi Zhen was favored. Jing Gong's younger maternal brother was rich. Someone slandered him. Fearing execution, he fled to Jin with a thousand chariots and heavy baggage. Duke Ping of Jin said: 'Hou Zi is rich like this. Why would he destroy himself?' He replied: 'The Qin ruler has no way. I fear execution. I wish to wait for his later generations then return.' In the thirty-ninth year, King Ling of Chu was strong. He assembled the feudal lords at Shen, became alliance leader, and killed Qing Feng of Qi. Jing Gong was established for forty years and died. His son Ai Gong was established. Hou Zi again came back to Qin.

sentences.zh: 哀公八年，楚公子棄疾弒靈王而自立，是為平王。

translations.literal: Ai Gong eighth year, Chu nobleman Qi Ji assassinated Ling Wang self established, this Ping Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In Ai Gong's eighth year, Chu's nobleman Qi Ji assassinated King Ling and established himself, becoming King Ping.

sentences.zh: 十一年，楚平王來求秦女為太子建妻。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Chu Ping Wang came sought Qin woman as crown prince Jian wife.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, King Ping of Chu came to seek a Qin woman as wife for crown prince Jian.

sentences.zh: 至國，女好而自娶之。

translations.literal: Arrived state, woman beautiful and self married her.
translations.idiomatic: When he arrived at the state, the woman was beautiful and he married her himself.

sentences.zh: 十五年，楚平王欲誅建，建亡；

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, Chu Ping Wang wished execute Jian, Jian fled;
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, King Ping of Chu wished to execute Jian. Jian fled;

sentences.zh: 伍子胥奔吳。

translations.literal: Wu Zi Xu fled Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Zi Xu fled to Wu.

sentences.zh: 晉公室卑而六卿彊，欲內相攻，是以久秦晉不相攻。

translations.literal: Jin ducal house low and six ministers strong, wished internally mutually attacked, therefore long Qin Jin not mutually attacked.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin ducal house was weak while the six ministers were strong. They wished to attack each other internally, which is why Qin and Jin did not attack each other for a long time.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，吳王闔閭與伍子胥伐楚，楚王亡奔隨，吳遂入郢。

translations.literal: Thirty-first year, Wu wang He Lu with Wu Zi Xu attacked Chu, Chu wang fled ran Sui, Wu then entered Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, King He Lu of Wu and Wu Zi Xu attacked Chu. The Chu king fled to Sui, and Wu then entered Ying.

sentences.zh: 楚大夫申包胥來告急，七日不食，日夜哭泣。

translations.literal: Chu grand master Shen Bao Xu came reported urgent, seven days not ate, day night wept.
translations.idiomatic: Chu's grand master Shen Bao Xu came to report the emergency. He did not eat for seven days, weeping day and night.

sentences.zh: 於是秦乃發五百乘救楚，敗吳師。

translations.literal: Then Qin then dispatched five hundred chariots rescued Chu, defeated Wu troops.
translations.idiomatic: Qin then dispatched five hundred chariots to rescue Chu and defeated the Wu troops.

sentences.zh: 吳師歸，楚昭王乃得復入郢。

translations.literal: Wu troops returned, Chu Zhao Wang then obtained again entered Ying.
translations.idiomatic: The Wu troops returned, and King Zhao of Chu was then able to re-enter Ying.

sentences.zh: 哀公立三十六年卒。

translations.literal: Ai Gong established thirty-six years died.
translations.idiomatic: Ai Gong ruled for thirty-six years and died.

sentences.zh: 太子夷公，夷公蚤死，不得立，立夷公子，是為惠公。

translations.literal: Crown prince Yi Gong, Yi Gong early died, not obtained established, established Yi Gong son, this Hui Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Crown prince Yi Gong died early and could not be established. They established Yi Gong's son, who was called Hui Gong.

translations.literal: In Ai Gong's eighth year, Gong Zi Qi Ji of Chu assassinated King Ling and established himself. He was King Ping. In the eleventh year, King Ping of Chu came to request a Qin woman as wife for Crown Prince Jian. When he arrived in the state, the woman was beautiful and he married her himself. In the fifteenth year, King Ping of Chu wished to execute Jian. Jian fled; Wu Zi Xu fled to Wu. The Jin ducal house was weak and the six ministers were strong. They wished to attack each other internally. This is why Qin and Jin long did not attack each other. In the thirty-first year, King He Lu of Wu with Wu Zi Xu attacked Chu. The Chu king fled to Sui. Wu then entered Ying. The Chu grand master Shen Bao Xu came to report the urgency. He did not eat for seven days and wept day and night. Thus Qin then sent five hundred chariots to rescue Chu and defeated the Wu troops. The Wu troops returned. King Zhao of Chu then was able to re-enter Ying. Ai Gong was established for thirty-six years and died. The crown prince was Yi Gong. Yi Gong died early and could not be established. They established Yi Gong's son. He was Hui Gong.

sentences.zh: 惠公元年，孔子行魯相事。

translations.literal: Hui Gong first year, Confucius acted Lu chancellor matters.
translations.idiomatic: In Hui Gong's first year, Confucius acted as chancellor of Lu.

sentences.zh: 五年，晉卿中行、范氏反晉，晉使智氏、趙簡子攻之，范、中行氏亡奔齊。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Jin ministers Zhong Xing, Fan clan rebelled Jin, Jin made Zhi clan, Zhao Jian Zi attacked them, Fan, Zhong Xing clan fled ran Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Jin's ministers Zhong Xing and the Fan clan rebelled against Jin. Jin sent the Zhi clan and Zhao Jian Zi to attack them. The Fan and Zhong Xing clans fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 惠公立十年卒，子悼公立。

translations.literal: Hui Gong established ten years died, son Dao Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: Hui Gong ruled for ten years and died. His son Dao Gong was established.

translations.literal: In Hui Gong's first year, Confucius carried out the chancellor's affairs in Lu. In the fifth year, the Jin ministers Zhong Xing and Fan clans rebelled against Jin. Jin had the Zhi clan and Zhao Jian Zi attack them. The Fan and Zhong Xing clans fled to Qi. Hui Gong was established for ten years and died. His son Dao Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 悼公二年，齊臣田乞弒其君孺子，立其兄陽生，是為悼公。

translations.literal: Dao Gong second year, Qi minister Tian Qi assassinated his lord Ru Zi, established his brother Yang Sheng, this Dao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In Dao Gong's second year, Qi's minister Tian Qi assassinated his lord Ru Zi and established his brother Yang Sheng, who was called Dao Gong.

sentences.zh: 六年，吳敗齊師。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Wu defeated Qi troops.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Wu defeated the Qi troops.

sentences.zh: 齊人弒悼公，立其子簡公。

translations.literal: Qi people assassinated Dao Gong, established his son Jian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi people assassinated Dao Gong and established his son Jian Gong.

sentences.zh: 九年，晉定公與吳王夫差盟，爭長於黃池，卒先吳。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Jin Ding Gong with Wu wang Fu Chai allied, contended precedence at Huang Chi, finally yielded to Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Duke Ding of Jin made an alliance with King Fu Chai of Wu. They contended for precedence at Huang Chi, and Jin finally yielded to Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳彊，陵中國。

translations.literal: Wu strong, overawed central states.
translations.idiomatic: Wu was strong and overawed the central states.

sentences.zh: 十二年，齊田常弒簡公，立其弟平公，常相之。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Qi Tian Chang assassinated Jian Gong, established his younger brother Ping Gong, Chang became chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Tian Chang of Qi assassinated Jian Gong and established his younger brother Ping Gong. Chang became his chancellor.

sentences.zh: 十三年，楚滅陳。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Chu extinguished Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Chu extinguished Chen.

sentences.zh: 秦悼公立十四年卒，子厲共公立。

translations.literal: Qin Dao Gong established fourteen years died, son Li Gong Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Dao Gong ruled for fourteen years and died. His son Li Gong Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 孔子以悼公十二年卒。

translations.literal: Confucius in Dao Gong twelfth year died.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius died in Dao Gong's twelfth year.

translations.literal: In Dao Gong's second year, the Qi minister Tian Qi assassinated their ruler Ru Zi and established his brother Yang Sheng. He was Duke Dao. In the sixth year, Wu defeated the Qi troops. The Qi people assassinated Duke Dao and established his son Duke Jian. In the ninth year, Duke Ding of Jin allied with King Fu Chai of Wu. They contended for seniority at Huangchi, and finally yielded to Wu. Wu was strong and overawed the central states. In the twelfth year, Tian Chang of Qi assassinated Duke Jian and established his brother Duke Ping. Chang became chancellor. In the thirteenth year, Chu extinguished Chen. Qin Dao Gong was established for fourteen years and died. His son Duke Li Gong was established. Confucius died in Dao Gong's twelfth year.

sentences.zh: 厲共公二年，蜀人來賂。

translations.literal: Li Gong Gong second year, Shu people came bribed.
translations.idiomatic: In Li Gong Gong's second year, the Shu people came with bribes.

sentences.zh: 十六年，塹河旁。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, dug moats Yellow River side.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, they dug moats along the Yellow River.

sentences.zh: 以兵二萬伐大荔，取其王城。

translations.literal: With troops twenty thousand attacked Da Li, took its wang city.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Da Li with twenty thousand troops and took its royal city.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，初縣頻陽。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, first established county Pin Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, they first established the county of Pin Yang.

sentences.zh: 晉取武成。

translations.literal: Jin took Wu Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: Jin took Wu Cheng.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，晉亂，殺智伯，分其國與趙、韓、魏。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, Jin chaos, killed Zhi Bo, divided his state with Zhao, Han, Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Jin fell into chaos. They killed Zhi Bo and divided his state among Zhao, Han, and Wei.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，智開與邑人來奔。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, Zhi Kai with city people came fled.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Zhi Kai and the city people came fleeing.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，伐義渠，虜其王。

translations.literal: Thirty-third year, attacked Yi Qu, captured its wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, they attacked Yi Qu and captured its king.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，日食。

translations.literal: Thirty-fourth year, solar eclipse.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fourth year, there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: 厲共公卒，子躁公立。

translations.literal: Li Gong Gong died, son Zhao Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: Li Gong Gong died, and his son Zhao Gong was established.

translations.literal: In Duke Li Gong's second year, the Shu people came with bribes. In the sixteenth year, they built moats along the river. They attacked Dali with twenty thousand troops and took its royal city. In the twenty-first year, they initially made Pinyang a county. Jin took Wucheng. In the twenty-fourth year, Jin had chaos. They killed Zhi Bo and divided his state among Zhao, Han, and Wei. In the twenty-fifth year, Zhi Kai came fleeing with the town people. In the thirty-third year, they attacked Yiqu and captured their king. In the thirty-fourth year, there was a solar eclipse. Duke Li Gong died. His son Duke Zao was established.

sentences.zh: 躁公二年，南鄭反。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong second year, Nan Zheng rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: In Zhao Gong's second year, Nan Zheng rebelled.

sentences.zh: 十三年，義渠來伐，至渭南。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Yi Qu came attacked, reached Wei south.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Yi Qu came to attack and reached south of the Wei.

sentences.zh: 十四年，躁公卒，立其弟懷公。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, Zhao Gong died, established his younger brother Huai Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Zhao Gong died, and they established his younger brother Huai Gong.

translations.literal: In Zao Gong's second year, Nanzheng rebelled. In the thirteenth year, Yiqu came to attack and reached south of the Wei. In the fourteenth year, Zao Gong died. They established his younger brother Duke Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷公四年，庶長朝與大臣圍懷公，懷公自殺。

translations.literal: Huai Gong fourth year, Shu Zhang Zhao with ministers surrounded Huai Gong, Huai Gong committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: In Huai Gong's fourth year, Shu Zhang Zhao and the ministers surrounded Huai Gong. Huai Gong committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 懷公太子曰昭子，蚤死，大臣乃立太子昭子之子，是為靈公。

translations.literal: Huai Gong crown prince called Zhao Zi, early died, ministers then established crown prince Zhao Zi son, this Ling Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Huai Gong's crown prince was called Zhao Zi. He died early, so the ministers established Zhao Zi's son, who was called Ling Gong.

sentences.zh: 靈公，懷公孫也。

translations.literal: Ling Gong, Huai Gong grandson.
translations.idiomatic: Ling Gong was Huai Gong's grandson.

translations.literal: In Huai Gong's fourth year, Shu Zhang Zhao and the grand ministers surrounded Huai Gong. Huai Gong committed suicide. Huai Gong's crown prince was called Zhao Zi. He died early. The grand ministers then established Zhao Zi's son. He was Ling Gong. Ling Gong was Huai Gong's grandson.

sentences.zh: 靈公六年，晉城少梁，秦擊之。

translations.literal: Ling Gong sixth year, Jin walled Shao Liang, Qin attacked it.
translations.idiomatic: In Ling Gong's sixth year, Jin fortified Shao Liang, and Qin attacked it.

sentences.zh: 十三年，城籍姑。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, walled Ji Gu.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, they walled Ji Gu.

sentences.zh: 靈公卒，子獻公不得立，立靈公季父悼子，是為簡公。

translations.literal: Ling Gong died, son Xian Gong not obtained established, established Ling Gong younger uncle Dao Zi, this Jian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Ling Gong died. His son Xian Gong could not be established, so they established Ling Gong's younger uncle Dao Zi, who was called Jian Gong.

sentences.zh: 簡公，昭子之弟而懷公子也。

translations.literal: Jian Gong, Zhao Zi younger brother and Huai Gong son.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Gong was Zhao Zi's younger brother and Huai Gong's son.

translations.literal: In Ling Gong's sixth year, Jin walled Shaoliang. Qin struck it. In the thirteenth year, they walled Jigu. Ling Gong died. His son Xian Gong could not be established. They established Ling Gong's younger uncle Dao Zi. He was Jian Gong. Jian Gong was Zhao Zi's younger brother and Huai Gong's son.

sentences.zh: 簡公六年，令吏初帶劍。

translations.literal: Jian Gong sixth year, ordered officials first wore swords.
translations.idiomatic: In Jian Gong's sixth year, he ordered officials to first wear swords.

sentences.zh: 塹洛。

translations.literal: Dug moats Luo.
translations.idiomatic: They dug moats at Luo.

sentences.zh: 城重泉。

translations.literal: Walled Chong Quan.
translations.idiomatic: They walled Chong Quan.

sentences.zh: 十六年卒，子惠公立。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year died, son Hui Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year he died, and his son Hui Gong was established.

translations.literal: In Jian Gong's sixth year, he commanded officials to initially wear swords. They built moats at Luo. They walled Chongquan. In the sixteenth year, he died. His son Hui Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 惠公十二年，子出子生。

translations.literal: Hui Gong twelfth year, son Chu Zi born.
translations.idiomatic: In Hui Gong's twelfth year, his son Chu Zi was born.

sentences.zh: 十三年，伐蜀，取南鄭。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, attacked Shu, took Nan Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, they attacked Shu and took Nan Zheng.

sentences.zh: 惠公卒，出子立。

translations.literal: Hui Gong died, Chu Zi established.
translations.idiomatic: Hui Gong died, and Chu Zi was established.

translations.literal: In Hui Gong's twelfth year, his son Chu Zi was born. In the thirteenth year, they attacked Shu and took Nanzheng. Hui Gong died. Chu Zi was established.

sentences.zh: 出子二年，庶長改迎靈公之子獻公于河西而立之。

translations.literal: Chu Zi second year, Shu Zhang Gai welcomed Ling Gong son Xian Gong at He west established him.
translations.idiomatic: In Chu Zi's second year, Shu Zhang Gai welcomed Ling Gong's son Xian Gong from west of the river and established him.

sentences.zh: 殺出子及其母，沈之淵旁。

translations.literal: Killed Chu Zi and his mother, drowned them beside the abyss.
translations.idiomatic: They killed Chu Zi and his mother, drowning them beside the abyss.

sentences.zh: 秦以往者數易君，君臣乖亂，故晉復彊，奪秦河西地。

translations.literal: Qin in past frequently changed lords, lord ministers discordant chaotic, therefore Jin again strong, took Qin He west lands.
translations.idiomatic: Qin had frequently changed lords in the past, with lords and ministers in discordant chaos, so Jin grew strong again and took Qin's lands west of the river.

translations.literal: In Chu Zi's second year, Shu Zhang Gai welcomed Ling Gong's son Xian Gong from west of the river and established him. They killed Chu Zi and his mother and sank them beside the abyss. Qin in the past frequently changed rulers. Ruler and minister were discordant and chaotic. Therefore Jin became strong again and took Qin's land west of the river.

sentences.zh: 獻公元年，止從死。

translations.literal: Xian Gong first year, stopped followers in death.
translations.idiomatic: In Xian Gong's first year, he stopped the practice of followers in death.

sentences.zh: 二年，城櫟陽。

translations.literal: Second year, walled Li Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, they walled Li Yang.

sentences.zh: 四年正月庚寅，孝公生。

translations.literal: Fourth year first month Geng Yin, Xiao Gong born.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, first month, Geng Yin day, Xiao Gong was born.

sentences.zh: 十一年，周太史儋見獻公曰：「周故與秦國合而別，別五百歲復合，合（七）十七歲而霸王出。」

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Zhou grand scribe Dan saw Xian Gong said: 'Zhou formerly with Qin state united then separated, separated five hundred years again united, united seventeen years then hegemon king emerges.'
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Zhou's grand scribe Dan saw Xian Gong and said: 'Zhou was formerly united with Qin and then separated. Separated for five hundred years they will unite again. United for seventeen years and a hegemon king will emerge.'

sentences.zh: 十六年，桃冬花。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, peach winter flowered.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, peaches flowered in winter.

sentences.zh: 十八年，雨金櫟陽。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, rained gold Li Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, it rained gold at Li Yang.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，與晉戰於石門，斬首六萬，天子賀以黼黻。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, with Jin battled at Shi Men, beheaded sixty thousand, Son of Heaven congratulated with Fu Fu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, they battled with Jin at Shi Men, beheading sixty thousand. The Son of Heaven congratulated them with Fu Fu.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，與魏晉戰少梁，虜其將公孫痤。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, with Wei Jin battled Shao Liang, captured their general Gong Sun Kuo.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, they battled with Wei and Jin at Shao Liang, capturing their general Gong Sun Kuo.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，獻公卒，子孝公立，年已二十一歲矣。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, Xian Gong died, son Xiao Gong established, age already twenty-one years.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Xian Gong died, and his son Xiao Gong was established, already twenty-one years old.

translations.literal: In Xian Gong's first year, they stopped the practice of following in death. In the second year, they walled Yueyang. In the fourth year, first month, Gengyin day, Xiao Gong was born. In the eleventh year, Zhou's grand scribe Dan saw Xian Gong and said: 'Zhou formerly united with Qin state and then separated. Separated for five hundred years then united. United for seventeen years and a hegemon king will emerge.' In the sixteenth year, peaches flowered in winter. In the eighteenth year, it rained gold at Yueyang. In the twenty-first year, they fought with Jin at Shimen and beheaded sixty thousand. The Son of Heaven congratulated them with fufu robes. In the twenty-third year, they fought with Wei and Jin at Shaoliang and captured their general Gong Sun Kuo. In the twenty-fourth year, Xian Gong died. His son Xiao Gong was established. He was already twenty-one years old.

sentences.zh: 孝公元年，河山以東彊國六，與齊威、楚宣、魏惠、燕悼、韓哀、趙成侯并。

translations.literal: Xiao Gong first year, He Shan east strong states six, with Qi Wei, Chu Xuan, Wei Hui, Yan Dao, Han Ai, Zhao Cheng Hou equal.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiao Gong's first year, there were six strong states east of the He and Shan mountains, equal to Qi Wei, Chu Xuan, Wei Hui, Yan Dao, Han Ai, and Zhao Cheng Hou.

sentences.zh: 淮泗之閒小國十餘。

translations.literal: Huai Si between small states ten remaining.
translations.idiomatic: Between the Huai and Si rivers there were more than ten small states.

sentences.zh: 楚、魏與秦接界。

translations.literal: Chu, Wei with Qin bordered.
translations.idiomatic: Chu and Wei bordered Qin.

sentences.zh: 魏筑長城，自鄭濱洛以北，有上郡。

translations.literal: Wei built long wall, from Zheng reached Luo north, had Shang Jun.
translations.idiomatic: Wei built a long wall, from Zheng reaching north to the Luo, and had Shang Jun.

sentences.zh: 楚自漢中，南有巴、黔中。

translations.literal: Chu from Han middle, south had Ba, Qian middle.
translations.idiomatic: Chu, from Han middle southward, had Ba and Qian middle.

sentences.zh: 周室微，諸侯力政，爭相併。

translations.literal: Zhou house weak, feudal lords force governed, contended mutually annexed.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou house was weak. The feudal lords governed by force and contended to annex each other.

sentences.zh: 秦僻在雍州，不與中國諸侯之會盟，夷翟遇之。

translations.literal: Qin remote in Yong Zhou, not with central states feudal lords alliance met, Yi Di treated it.
translations.idiomatic: Qin was remote in Yong Zhou, did not participate in the alliance meetings of the central states' feudal lords, and the Yi and Di treated it as such.

sentences.zh: 孝公於是布惠，振孤寡，招戰士，明功賞。

translations.literal: Xiao Gong then spread favor, aided orphans widows, recruited warriors, clarified merit rewards.
translations.idiomatic: Xiao Gong then spread favor, aided orphans and widows, recruited warriors, and clarified merit and rewards.

sentences.zh: 下令國中曰：「昔我繆公自岐雍之閒，修德行武，東平晉亂，以河為界，西霸戎翟，廣地千里，天子致伯，諸侯畢賀，為後世開業，甚光美。

translations.literal: Ordered state middle said: 'Formerly my Mu Gong from Qi Yong between, cultivated virtue practiced martial, east pacified Jin chaos, with He as boundary, west hegemoned Rong Di, broadened land thousand li, Son of Heaven conferred hegemony, feudal lords all congratulated, for later generations opened enterprise, very glorious beautiful.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered throughout the state: 'Formerly my Duke Mu, from between Qi and Yong, cultivated virtue and practiced martial affairs. He pacified Jin's chaos to the east, using the river as boundary. He became hegemon of the Rong and Di to the west, broadening the land by a thousand li. The Son of Heaven conferred hegemony on him, and all the feudal lords congratulated him. He opened enterprises for later generations, which was very glorious and beautiful.

sentences.zh: 會往者厲、躁、簡公、出子之不寧，國家內憂，未遑外事，三晉攻奪我先君河西地，諸侯卑秦、醜莫大焉。

translations.literal: Coincidentally past Li, Zhao, Jian Gong, Chu Zi unrest, state internal worries, not leisure external affairs, three Jin attacked took my former lords He west lands, feudal lords belittled Qin, shame nothing greater.
translations.idiomatic: Coincidentally, in the past there was unrest with Li, Zhao, Jian Gong, and Chu Zi. The state had internal worries and no leisure for external affairs. The three Jin attacked and took my former lords' lands west of the river. The feudal lords belittled Qin - there was no greater shame.

sentences.zh: 獻公即位，鎮撫邊境，徙治櫟陽，且欲東伐，復繆公之故地，修繆公之政令。

translations.literal: Xian Gong ascended throne, pacified soothed borders, moved capital Li Yang, moreover wished east attack, recover Mu Gong old lands, repair Mu Gong government orders.
translations.idiomatic: When Xian Gong ascended the throne, he pacified and soothed the borders, moved the capital to Li Yang, and moreover wished to attack east to recover Duke Mu's old lands and repair Duke Mu's government orders.

sentences.zh: 寡人思念先君之意，常痛於心。

translations.literal: I think remember former lords intention, constantly pained in heart.
translations.idiomatic: I constantly think of and remember my former lords' intentions, and it constantly pains my heart.

sentences.zh: 賓客群臣有能出奇計彊秦者，吾且尊官，與之分土。」

translations.literal: Guests ministers able produce extraordinary plans strengthen Qin, I moreover honor offices, with them divide land.'
translations.idiomatic: If any guests or ministers can produce extraordinary plans to strengthen Qin, I will moreover honor them with offices and divide land with them.'

sentences.zh: 於是乃出兵東圍陜城，西斬戎之獂王。

translations.literal: Then then dispatched troops east surrounded Xia Cheng, west beheaded Rong Huang Wang.
translations.idiomatic: He then dispatched troops to surround Xia Cheng to the east and beheaded the Rong's Huang Wang to the west.

translations.literal: In Xiao Gong's first year, east of the rivers and mountains there were six strong states, equal to Qi Wei, Chu Xuan, Wei Hui, Yan Dao, Han Ai, and Zhao Cheng Hou. Between the Huai and Si there were over ten small states. Chu and Wei adjoined borders with Qin. Wei built the long wall, from Zheng along the Luo to the north, and had Shang commandery. Chu from Hanzhong south had Ba and Qianzhong. The Zhou house was weak. The feudal lords governed by force and contended to annex each other. Qin was remote in Yong province and did not participate in the assemblies and alliances of the central states' feudal lords. The Yi and Di treated it as such. Xiao Gong thus spread favors, aided orphans and widows, recruited warriors, and clarified merit and rewards. He issued an order in the state saying: 'Formerly our Mu Gong from between Qi and Yong cultivated virtue and practiced martial affairs. He pacified Jin chaos in the east with the river as boundary. He hegemoned the Rong and Di in the west and broadened the land by a thousand li. The Son of Heaven conferred the title of Bo. All the feudal lords congratulated him. He opened the enterprise for later generations. It was very glorious and beautiful. Encountering the unrest of the previous Li, Zao, Jian Gong, and Chu Zi, the state had internal worries and no leisure for external affairs. The three Jin attacked and seized our former rulers' land west of the river. The feudal lords belittled Qin. There was no greater shame. Xian Gong ascended the throne, pacified and stabilized the borders, moved the capital to Yueyang, and wished to attack east to recover Mu Gong's former land and repair Mu Gong's government orders. I think of the former rulers' intentions and am constantly pained in my heart. Any guest or minister who can produce extraordinary plans to strengthen Qin, I will moreover honor his office and divide land with him.' Thus he then sent troops to surround Xia city in the east and beheaded the Rong's Lian Wang in the west.

sentences.zh: 衛鞅聞是令下，西入秦，因景監求見孝公。

translations.literal: Wei Yang heard this order issued, west entered Qin, through Jing Jian sought audience Xiao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Yang heard this order issued and entered Qin from the west. Through Jing Jian he sought an audience with Xiao Gong.

translations.literal: Wei Yang heard this order issued and went west into Qin. Through Jing Jian he sought to see Duke Xiao.

sentences.zh: 二年，天子致胙。

translations.literal: Second year, Son of Heaven presented sacrificial meat.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, the Son of Heaven presented sacrificial meat.

translations.literal: In the second year, the Son of Heaven sent zhou.

sentences.zh: 三年，衛鞅說孝公變法修刑，內務耕稼，外勸戰死之賞罰，孝公善之。

translations.literal: Third year, Wei Yang persuaded Xiao Gong change laws repair punishments, internally encourage farming, externally urge battle death rewards punishments, Xiao Gong approved it.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Wei Yang persuaded Xiao Gong to change the laws and repair the punishments. Internally to encourage farming, externally to urge rewards and punishments for battle and death. Xiao Gong approved it.

sentences.zh: 甘龍、杜摯等弗然，相與爭之。

translations.literal: Gan Long, Du Zhi etc. not agreed, mutually contended it.
translations.idiomatic: Gan Long, Du Zhi, and others did not agree and mutually contended against it.

sentences.zh: 卒用鞅法，百姓苦之；

translations.literal: Finally used Yang laws, common people suffered it;
translations.idiomatic: Finally they used Yang's laws, and the common people suffered from them;

sentences.zh: 居三年，百姓便之。

translations.literal: Resided three years, common people convenient to them.
translations.idiomatic: After three years, the common people found them convenient.

sentences.zh: 乃拜鞅為左庶長。

translations.literal: Then appointed Yang as left Shu Zhang.
translations.idiomatic: He then appointed Yang as Left Shu Zhang.

sentences.zh: 其事在商君語中。

translations.literal: His matters in Shang Jun biography middle.
translations.idiomatic: His matters are in the biography of the Shang Jun.

translations.literal: In the third year, Wei Yang persuaded Duke Xiao to change the laws and repair the punishments: internally attend to farming, externally encourage rewards and punishments for battle and death. Duke Xiao approved it. Gan Long, Du Zhi, and others did not approve and mutually contended against it. They finally used Yang's laws. The common people suffered from them; After three years, the common people found it convenient. He then appointed Yang as Left Shu Zhang. Its affairs are among the words of the Shang Jun.

sentences.zh: 七年，與魏惠王會杜平。

translations.literal: Seventh year, with Wei Hui Wang met Du Ping.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, he met with King Hui of Wei at Du Ping.

sentences.zh: 八年，與魏戰元裏，有功。

translations.literal: Eighth year, with Wei battled Yuan Li, had merit.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, they battled with Wei at Yuan Li and had merit.

sentences.zh: 十年，衛鞅為大良造，將兵圍魏安邑，降之。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Wei Yang became great good maker, led troops surrounded Wei An Yi, surrendered it.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Wei Yang became Great Good Maker, led troops to surround Wei's An Yi, and surrendered it.

sentences.zh: 十二年，作為咸陽，筑冀闕，秦徙都之。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, made Xian Yang, built Ji Que, Qin moved capital it.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, they made Xian Yang, built Ji Que, and Qin moved its capital there.

sentences.zh: 并諸小鄉聚，集為大縣，縣一令，四十一縣。

translations.literal: Combined various small townships gathered, assembled as large counties, county one magistrate, forty-one counties.
translations.idiomatic: They combined the various small townships and gatherings into large counties, each county with one magistrate, making forty-one counties.

sentences.zh: 為田開阡陌。

translations.literal: For fields opened Qian Mo.
translations.idiomatic: For the fields they opened Qian Mo.

sentences.zh: 東地渡洛。

translations.literal: East lands crossed Luo.
translations.idiomatic: The eastern lands crossed the Luo.

sentences.zh: 十四年，初為賦。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, first made taxes.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, they first made taxes.

sentences.zh: 十九年，天子致伯。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, Son of Heaven conferred hegemony.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, the Son of Heaven conferred hegemony.

sentences.zh: 二十年，諸侯畢賀。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, feudal lords all congratulated.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, all the feudal lords congratulated him.

sentences.zh: 秦使公子少官率師會諸侯逢澤，朝天子。

translations.literal: Qin made nobleman Shao Guan lead troops assembled feudal lords Feng Ze, audience Son of Heaven.
translations.idiomatic: Qin had nobleman Shao Guan lead troops to assemble the feudal lords at Feng Ze for an audience with the Son of Heaven.

translations.literal: In the seventh year, he met with King Hui of Wei at Du Ping. In the eighth year, he fought with Wei at Yuan Li and had merit. In the tenth year, Wei Yang became Da Liang Zao. He led troops and surrounded Wei's Anyi, causing it to surrender. In the twelfth year, he made Xianyang, built the Ji Que, and Qin moved its capital there. He merged the various small townships and gatherings into large counties, each county with one ling, making forty-one counties. For the fields he opened the qian and mo. The eastern lands crossed the Luo. In the fourteenth year, they initially made fu. In the nineteenth year, the Son of Heaven conferred the title of Bo. In the twentieth year, all the feudal lords congratulated. Qin had Gong Zi Shao Guan lead troops to assemble the feudal lords at Feng Ze and court the Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，齊敗魏馬陵。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, Qi defeated Wei Ma Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Qi defeated Wei at Ma Ling.

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Qi defeated Wei at Ma Ling.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，衛鞅擊魏，虜魏公子卬。

translations.literal: Twenty-second year, Wei Yang attacked Wei, captured Wei nobleman Ang.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Wei Yang attacked Wei and captured Wei's nobleman Ang.

sentences.zh: 封鞅為列侯，號商君。

translations.literal: Enfeoffed Yang as lie hou, titled Shang Jun.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed Yang as a lie hou and titled him Shang Jun.

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Wei Yang struck Wei and captured Gong Zi Ang of Wei. He enfeoffed Yang as Lie Hou, titled him Shang Jun.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，與晉戰雁門，虜其將魏錯。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, with Jin battled Yan Men, captured their general Wei Cuo.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, they battled with Jin at Yan Men and captured their general Wei Cuo.

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, he fought with Jin at Yan Men and captured their general Wei Cuo.

sentences.zh: 孝公卒，子惠文君立。

translations.literal: Xiao Gong died, son Hui Wen Jun established.
translations.idiomatic: Xiao Gong died, and his son Hui Wen Jun was established.

sentences.zh: 是歲，誅衛鞅。

translations.literal: This year, executed Wei Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, they executed Wei Yang.

sentences.zh: 鞅之初為秦施法，法不行，太子犯禁。

translations.literal: Yang initially for Qin applied laws, laws not carried out, crown prince violated prohibitions.
translations.idiomatic: When Yang first applied laws for Qin, the laws were not carried out, and the crown prince violated the prohibitions.

sentences.zh: 鞅曰：「法之不行，自於貴戚。

translations.literal: Yang said: 'Laws not carried out, from noble relatives.
translations.idiomatic: Yang said: 'The laws are not carried out because of the noble relatives.

sentences.zh: 君必欲行法，先於太子。

translations.literal: Lord must wish carry out laws, first at crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: If your lordship must carry out the laws, start with the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 太子不可黥，黥其傅師。」

translations.literal: Crown prince cannot tattoo, tattoo his tutor master.'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince cannot be tattooed, so tattoo his tutor master.'

sentences.zh: 於是法大用，秦人治。

translations.literal: Then laws greatly used, Qin people governed.
translations.idiomatic: Then the laws were greatly used, and the Qin people were governed.

sentences.zh: 及孝公卒，太子立，宗室多怨鞅，鞅亡，因以為反，而卒車裂以徇秦國。

translations.literal: Reached Xiao Gong died, crown prince established, clan residence many resented Yang, Yang fled, therefore regarded as rebellion, and finally chariot tore to make example Qin state.
translations.idiomatic: When Xiao Gong died and the crown prince was established, many in the clan residence resented Yang. Yang fled, so they regarded him as rebellious, and finally chariot-tore him to make an example throughout the Qin state.

translations.literal: Duke Xiao died. His son Lord Hui Wen was established. This year, they executed Wei Yang. When Yang initially implemented laws for Qin, the laws were not carried out. The crown prince violated the prohibitions. Yang said: 'The laws are not carried out because of the noble relatives. If you, ruler, must want to carry out the laws, start with the crown prince. The crown prince cannot be qinged. Qing his fu shi.' Thus the laws were greatly used. The Qin people were governed. When Duke Xiao died and the crown prince was established, the clan members greatly resented Yang. Yang fled. They therefore considered it rebellion and finally cart-tore him to warn the Qin state.

sentences.zh: 惠文君元年，楚、韓、趙、蜀人來朝。

translations.literal: Hui Wen Jun first year, Chu, Han, Zhao, Shu people came audience.
translations.idiomatic: In Hui Wen Jun's first year, people from Chu, Han, Zhao, and Shu came for audience.

sentences.zh: 二年，天子賀。

translations.literal: Second year, Son of Heaven congratulated.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, the Son of Heaven congratulated.

sentences.zh: 三年，王冠。

translations.literal: Third year, wang crowned.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, the wang was crowned.

sentences.zh: 四年，天子致文武胙。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Son of Heaven presented civil martial sacrificial meat.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, the Son of Heaven presented civil and martial sacrificial meat.

sentences.zh: 齊、魏為王。

translations.literal: Qi, Wei became wang.
translations.idiomatic: Qi and Wei became wang.

translations.literal: In Lord Hui Wen's first year, the people of Chu, Han, Zhao, and Shu came to court. In the second year, the Son of Heaven congratulated. In the third year, the king was crowned. In the fourth year, the Son of Heaven sent wen wu zhou. Qi and Wei became kings.

sentences.zh: 五年，陰晉人犀首為大良造。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Yin Jin person Xi Shou became great good maker.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Xi Shou of Yin Jin became great good maker.

sentences.zh: 六年，魏納陰晉，陰晉更名寧秦。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Wei took Yin Jin, Yin Jin changed name Ning Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Wei took Yin Jin, and Yin Jin changed its name to Ning Qin.

sentences.zh: 七年，公子卬與魏戰，虜其將龍賈，斬首八萬。

translations.literal: Seventh year, nobleman Ang with Wei battled, captured their general Long Jia, beheaded eighty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, nobleman Ang battled with Wei, captured their general Long Jia, and beheaded eighty thousand.

sentences.zh: 八年，魏納河西地。

translations.literal: Eighth year, Wei took He west lands.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Wei took the lands west of the river.

sentences.zh: 九年，渡河，取汾陰、皮氏。

translations.literal: Ninth year, crossed river, took Fen Yin, Pi Shi.
