translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, they crossed the river and took Fen Yin and Pi Shi.

sentences.zh: 與魏王會應。

translations.literal: With Wei wang met Ying.
translations.idiomatic: He met with the Wei wang at Ying.

sentences.zh: 圍焦，降之。

translations.literal: Surrounded Jiao, surrendered it.
translations.idiomatic: They surrounded Jiao and surrendered it.

sentences.zh: 十年，張儀相秦。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Zhang Yi became chancellor Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Zhang Yi became chancellor of Qin.

sentences.zh: 魏納上郡十五縣。

translations.literal: Wei took Shang Jun fifteen counties.
translations.idiomatic: Wei took fifteen counties of Shang Jun.

sentences.zh: 十一年，縣義渠。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, established county Yi Qu.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, they established Yi Qu as a county.

sentences.zh: 歸魏焦、曲沃。

translations.literal: Returned Wei Jiao, Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: They returned Jiao and Qu Wo to Wei.

sentences.zh: 義渠君為臣。

translations.literal: Yi Qu lord became minister.
translations.idiomatic: The lord of Yi Qu became a minister.

sentences.zh: 更名少梁曰夏陽。

translations.literal: Changed name Shao Liang called Xia Yang.
translations.idiomatic: They changed the name of Shao Liang to Xia Yang.

sentences.zh: 十二年，初臘。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, first la sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, they first performed the la sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 十三年四月戊午，魏君為王，韓亦為王。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year fourth month Wu Wu, Wei lord became wang, Han also became wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, fourth month, Wu Wu day, the Wei lord became wang, and Han also became wang.

sentences.zh: 使張儀伐取陜，出其人與魏。

translations.literal: Made Zhang Yi attack took Xia, moved its people gave Wei.
translations.idiomatic: They had Zhang Yi attack and take Xia, and moved its people to give to Wei.

translations.literal: In the fifth year, the man from Yinjin Xi Shou became Da Liang Zao. In the sixth year, Wei accepted Yinjin. Yinjin changed its name to Ningqin. In the seventh year, Gong Zi Ang fought with Wei, captured their general Long Jia, and beheaded eighty thousand. In the eighth year, Wei ceded the land west of the river. In the ninth year, they crossed the river and took Fenying and Pishi. They met with the Wei king at Ying. They surrounded Jiao and it surrendered. In the tenth year, Zhang Yi became chancellor of Qin. Wei ceded fifteen counties of Shang commandery. In the eleventh year, they made Yiqu a county. They returned Jiao and Quwo to Wei. The Yi Qu ruler became a minister. They changed the name of Shaoliang to Xiayang. In the twelfth year, they initially performed the la sacrifice. In the thirteenth year, fourth month, Wuwu day, the Wei ruler became king. Han also became king. They had Zhang Yi attack and take Xia, then moved its people and gave them to Wei.

sentences.zh: 十四年，更為元年。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, changed to first year.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, they changed it to the first year.

sentences.zh: 二年，張儀與齊、楚大臣會齧桑。

translations.literal: Second year, Zhang Yi with Qi, Chu ministers met Nie Sang.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Zhang Yi met with ministers of Qi and Chu at Nie Sang.

sentences.zh: 三年，韓、魏太子來朝。

translations.literal: Third year, Han, Wei crown princes came audience.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, the crown princes of Han and Wei came for audience.

sentences.zh: 張儀相魏。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi became chancellor Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi became chancellor of Wei.

sentences.zh: 五年，王游至北河。

translations.literal: Fifth year, wang toured reached Bei He.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, the wang toured and reached the Bei River.

sentences.zh: 七年，樂池相秦。

translations.literal: Seventh year, Le Chi became chancellor Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Le Chi became chancellor of Qin.

sentences.zh: 韓、趙、魏、燕、齊帥匈奴共攻秦。

translations.literal: Han, Zhao, Wei, Yan, Qi led Xiongnu together attacked Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Han, Zhao, Wei, Yan, and Qi led the Xiongnu to together attack Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦使庶長疾與戰修魚，虜其將申差，敗趙公子渴、韓太子奐，斬首八萬二千。

translations.literal: Qin made Shu Zhang Ji with them battled Xiu Yu, captured their general Shen Chai, defeated Zhao nobleman Ke, Han crown prince Huan, beheaded eighty-two thousand.
translations.idiomatic: Qin had Shu Zhang Ji battle with them at Xiu Yu, captured their general Shen Chai, defeated Zhao's nobleman Ke and Han's crown prince Huan, and beheaded eighty-two thousand.

sentences.zh: 八年，張儀復相秦。

translations.literal: Eighth year, Zhang Yi again became chancellor Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Zhang Yi again became chancellor of Qin.

sentences.zh: 九年，司馬錯伐蜀，滅之。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Si Ma Cuo attacked Shu, extinguished it.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Si Ma Cuo attacked Shu and extinguished it.

sentences.zh: 伐取趙中都、西陽十年，韓太子蒼來質。

translations.literal: Attacked took Zhao Zhong Du, Xi Yang tenth year, Han crown prince Cang came hostage.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked and took Zhao's Zhong Du and Xi Yang. In the tenth year, Han's crown prince Cang came as hostage.

sentences.zh: 伐取韓石章。

translations.literal: Attacked took Han Shi Zhang.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked and took Han's Shi Zhang.

sentences.zh: 伐敗趙將泥。

translations.literal: Attacked defeated Zhao general Ni.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked and defeated Zhao's general Ni.

sentences.zh: 伐取義渠二十五城。

translations.literal: Attacked took Yi Qu twenty-five cities.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked and took twenty-five cities of Yi Qu.

sentences.zh: 十一年，摢裏疾攻魏焦，降之。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Nie Li Ji attacked Wei Jiao, surrendered it.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Nie Li Ji attacked Wei's Jiao and surrendered it.

sentences.zh: 敗韓岸門，斬首萬，其將犀首走。

translations.literal: Defeated Han An Men, beheaded ten thousand, their general Xi Shou fled.
translations.idiomatic: They defeated Han at An Men, beheaded ten thousand, and their general Xi Shou fled.

sentences.zh: 公子通封於蜀。

translations.literal: Nobleman Tong enfeoffed at Shu.
translations.idiomatic: Nobleman Tong was enfeoffed at Shu.

sentences.zh: 燕君讓其臣子之。

translations.literal: Yan lord yielded his minister son it.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan lord yielded it to his minister's son.

sentences.zh: 十二年，王與梁王會臨晉。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, wang with Liang wang met Lin Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, the wang met with the Liang wang at Lin Jin.

sentences.zh: 庶長疾攻趙，虜趙將莊。

translations.literal: Shu Zhang Ji attacked Zhao, captured Zhao general Zhuang.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Zhang Ji attacked Zhao and captured Zhao's general Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 張儀相楚。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi became chancellor Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi became chancellor of Chu.

sentences.zh: 十三年，庶長章擊楚於丹陽，虜其將屈丐，斬首八萬；

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Shu Zhang Zhang attacked Chu at Dan Yang, captured their general Qu Gai, beheaded eighty thousand;
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Shu Zhang Zhang attacked Chu at Dan Yang, captured their general Qu Gai, and beheaded eighty thousand;

sentences.zh: 又攻楚漢中，取地六百里，置漢中郡。

translations.literal: Again attacked Chu Han middle, took land six hundred li, established Han middle commandery.
translations.idiomatic: They again attacked Chu's Han middle, took six hundred li of land, and established Han middle commandery.

sentences.zh: 楚圍雍氏，秦使庶長疾助韓而東攻齊，到滿助魏攻燕。

translations.literal: Chu surrounded Yong Shi, Qin made Shu Zhang Ji assist Han east attack Qi, Dao Man assist Wei attack Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Chu surrounded Yong Shi. Qin had Shu Zhang Ji assist Han and attack Qi to the east, and Dao Man assist Wei and attack Yan.

sentences.zh: 十四年，伐楚，取召陵。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, attacked Chu, took Zhao Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, they attacked Chu and took Zhao Ling.

sentences.zh: 丹、犁臣，蜀相壯殺蜀侯來降。

translations.literal: Dan, Li became ministers, Shu chancellor Zhuang killed Shu hou came surrendered.
translations.idiomatic: Dan and Li became ministers. Shu's chancellor Zhuang killed the Shu hou and came to surrender.

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, they changed it to the first year. In the second year, Zhang Yi met with Qi and Chu ministers at Niesang. In the third year, the crown princes of Han and Wei came to court. Zhang Yi became chancellor of Wei. In the fifth year, the king toured to the northern river. In the seventh year, Le Chi became chancellor of Qin. Han, Zhao, Wei, Yan, and Qi led the Xiongnu and together attacked Qin. Qin had Shu Zhang Ji fight them at Xiuyu, captured their general Shen Chai, defeated Zhao's Gong Zi Ke and Han's crown prince Huan, and beheaded eighty-two thousand. In the eighth year, Zhang Yi again became chancellor of Qin. In the ninth year, Sima Cuo attacked Shu and extinguished it. They attacked and took Zhao's Zhongdu and Xiyang. In the tenth year, Han's crown prince Cang came as hostage. They attacked and took Han's Shizhang. They attacked and defeated Zhao's general Ni. They attacked and took twenty-five cities of Yiqu. In the eleventh year, Mang Li Ji attacked Wei's Jiao and it surrendered. They defeated Han at Anmen, beheaded ten thousand, and their general Xi Shou fled. Gong Zi Tong was enfeoffed in Shu. The Yan ruler yielded his minister Zi Zhi. In the twelfth year, the king met with the Liang king at Linjin. Shu Zhang Ji attacked Zhao and captured Zhao's general Zhuang. Zhang Yi became chancellor of Chu. In the thirteenth year, Shu Zhang Zhang struck Chu at Danyang, captured their general Qu Gai, and beheaded eighty thousand; They again attacked Chu's Hanzhong, took six hundred li of land, and established Hanzhong commandery. Chu surrounded Yongshi. Qin had Shu Zhang Ji assist Han and attack Qi to the east, and Dao Man assist Wei in attacking Yan. In the fourteenth year, they attacked Chu and took Zhaoling. Dan and Li became ministers. Shu's chancellor Zhuang killed the Shu hou and came to surrender.

sentences.zh: 惠王卒，子武王立。

translations.literal: Hui wang died, son Wu wang established.
translations.idiomatic: Hui wang died, and his son Wu wang was established.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏、齊、楚、越皆賓從。

translations.literal: Han, Wei, Qi, Chu, Yue all guest followed.
translations.idiomatic: Han, Wei, Qi, Chu, and Yue all followed as guests.

translations.literal: King Hui died. His son King Wu was established. Han, Wei, Qi, Chu, and Yue all followed as guests.

sentences.zh: 武王元年，與魏惠王會臨晉。

translations.literal: Wu wang first year, with Wei Hui wang met Lin Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In Wu wang's first year, he met with Wei's Hui wang at Lin Jin.

sentences.zh: 誅蜀相壯。

translations.literal: Executed Shu chancellor Zhuang.
translations.idiomatic: They executed Shu's chancellor Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 張儀、魏章皆東出之魏。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi, Wei Zhang all east went to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang all went east to Wei.

sentences.zh: 伐義渠、丹、犁。

translations.literal: Attacked Yi Qu, Dan, Li.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Yi Qu, Dan, and Li.

sentences.zh: 二年，初置丞相，摢裏疾、甘茂為左右丞相。

translations.literal: Second year, first established chancellor, Nie Li Ji, Gan Mao became left right chancellors.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, they first established the position of chancellor. Nie Li Ji and Gan Mao became the left and right chancellors.

sentences.zh: 張儀死於魏。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi died in Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi died in Wei.

sentences.zh: 三年，與韓襄王會臨晉外。

translations.literal: Third year, with Han Xiang wang met outside Lin Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, he met with Han's Xiang wang outside Lin Jin.

sentences.zh: 南公揭卒，摢裏疾相韓。

translations.literal: Nan Gong Jie died, Nie Li Ji became chancellor Han.
translations.idiomatic: Nan Gong Jie died, and Nie Li Ji became chancellor of Han.

sentences.zh: 武王謂甘茂曰：「寡人欲容車通三川，窺周室，死不恨矣。」

translations.literal: Wu wang told Gan Mao said: 'I wish chariot passage through San Chuan, spy Zhou house, die not regret.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu wang told Gan Mao: 'I wish for chariot passage through San Chuan to spy on the Zhou house. I will die without regret.'

sentences.zh: 其秋，使甘茂、庶長封伐宜陽。

translations.literal: That autumn, made Gan Mao, Shu Zhang Feng attack Yi Yang.
translations.idiomatic: That autumn, he had Gan Mao and Shu Zhang Feng attack Yi Yang.

sentences.zh: 四年，拔宜陽，斬首六萬。

translations.literal: Fourth year, pulled Yi Yang, beheaded sixty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, they pulled Yi Yang and beheaded sixty thousand.

sentences.zh: 涉河，城武遂。

translations.literal: Crossed river, walled Wu Sui.
translations.idiomatic: They crossed the river and walled Wu Sui.

sentences.zh: 魏太子來朝。

translations.literal: Wei crown prince came audience.
translations.idiomatic: The Wei crown prince came for audience.

sentences.zh: 武王有力好戲，力士任鄙、烏獲、孟說皆至大官。

translations.literal: Wu wang had strength loved games, strong men Ren Bi, Wu Huo, Meng Yue all reached great officials.
translations.idiomatic: Wu wang had strength and loved games. The strong men Ren Bi, Wu Huo, and Meng Yue all reached great official positions.

sentences.zh: 王與孟說舉鼎，絕臏。

translations.literal: Wang with Meng Yue lifted tripod, broke shin.
translations.idiomatic: The wang lifted the tripod with Meng Yue and broke his shin.

sentences.zh: 八月，武王死。

translations.literal: Eighth month, Wu wang died.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, Wu wang died.

sentences.zh: 族孟說。

translations.literal: Clan executed Meng Yue.
translations.idiomatic: They clan-executed Meng Yue.

sentences.zh: 武王取魏女為后，無子。

translations.literal: Wu wang took Wei woman as empress, had no sons.
translations.idiomatic: Wu wang took a Wei woman as empress, but had no sons.

sentences.zh: 立異母弟，是為昭襄王。

translations.literal: Established different mother younger brother, this Zhao Xiang wang.
translations.idiomatic: They established his different-mother younger brother, who was called Zhao Xiang wang.

sentences.zh: 昭襄母楚人，姓羋氏，號宣太后。

translations.literal: Zhao Xiang mother Chu person, surname Mi clan, titled Xuan empress dowager.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Xiang's mother was a Chu person, of the Mi clan, and titled Xuan Empress Dowager.

sentences.zh: 武王死時，昭襄王為質於燕，燕人送歸，得立。

translations.literal: Wu wang death time, Zhao Xiang wang was hostage in Yan, Yan people sent back, obtained established.
translations.idiomatic: When Wu wang died, Zhao Xiang wang was a hostage in Yan. The Yan people sent him back and he obtained establishment.

translations.literal: In King Wu's first year, he met with King Hui of Wei at Linjin. They executed Shu's chancellor Zhuang. Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang all went east to Wei. They attacked Yiqu, Dan, and Li. In the second year, they initially established the chancellor position, with Mang Li Ji and Gan Mao as left and right chancellors. Zhang Yi died in Wei. In the third year, he met with King Xiang of Han outside Linjin. Nan Gong Jie died. Mang Li Ji became chancellor of Han. King Wu told Gan Mao: 'I wish to have broad chariots pass through Sanchuan and peep at the Zhou chamber. I would die without regret.' That autumn, he had Gan Mao and Shu Zhang Feng attack Yiyang. In the fourth year, they pulled Yiyang and beheaded sixty thousand. They crossed the river and walled Wusui. The Wei crown prince came to court. King Wu had strength and liked play. The strong men Ren Bi, Wu Huo, and Meng Shuo all reached great official positions. The king lifted a ding with Meng Shuo and broke his kneecap. In the eighth month, King Wu died. They clanned Meng Shuo. King Wu took a Wei woman as queen. She had no sons. They established his different mother younger brother. He was King Zhao Xiang. King Zhao Xiang's mother was a Chu person of the Mi clan, titled Xuan Taihou. When King Wu died, King Zhao Xiang was a hostage in Yan. The Yan people sent him back and he got established.

sentences.zh: 昭襄王元年，嚴君疾為相。

translations.literal: Zhao Xiang wang first year, Yan Jun Ji became chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: In Zhao Xiang wang's first year, Yan Jun Ji became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 甘茂出之魏。

translations.literal: Gan Mao went out to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Gan Mao went out to Wei.

sentences.zh: 二年，彗星見。

translations.literal: Second year, comet appeared.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, a comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 庶長壯與大臣、諸侯、公子為逆，皆誅，及惠文后皆不得良死。

translations.literal: Shu Zhang Zhuang with ministers, feudal lords, noblemen rebelled, all executed, reached Hui Wen empress all not obtained good death.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Zhang Zhuang rebelled with ministers, feudal lords, and noblemen. They were all executed, and even the Hui Wen empress did not obtain a good death.

sentences.zh: 悼武王后出歸魏。

translations.literal: Dao Wu wang empress went out returned Wei.
translations.idiomatic: The Dao Wu wang's empress went out and returned to Wei.

sentences.zh: 三年，王冠。

translations.literal: Third year, wang crowned.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, the wang was crowned.

sentences.zh: 與楚王會黃棘，與楚上庸。

translations.literal: With Chu wang met Huang Ji, with Chu Shang Yong.
translations.idiomatic: He met with the Chu wang at Huang Ji, and with Chu at Shang Yong.

sentences.zh: 四年，取蒲阪。

translations.literal: Fourth year, took Pu Ban.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, they took Pu Ban.

sentences.zh: 彗星見。

translations.literal: Comet appeared.
translations.idiomatic: A comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 五年，魏王來朝應亭，復與魏蒲阪。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Wei wang came audience Ying Ting, again with Wei Pu Ban.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, the Wei wang came for audience at Ying Ting, and again with Wei at Pu Ban.

sentences.zh: 六年，蜀侯煇反，司馬錯定蜀。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Shu hou Hui rebelled, Si Ma Cuo pacified Shu.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Shu's hou Hui rebelled. Si Ma Cuo pacified Shu.

sentences.zh: 庶長奐伐楚，斬首二萬。

translations.literal: Shu Zhang Huan attacked Chu, beheaded twenty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Zhang Huan attacked Chu and beheaded twenty thousand.

sentences.zh: 涇陽君質於齊。

translations.literal: Jing Yang jun hostage in Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Yang jun was a hostage in Qi.

sentences.zh: 日食，晝晦。

translations.literal: Solar eclipse, daytime dark.
translations.idiomatic: There was a solar eclipse, and daytime was dark.

sentences.zh: 七年，拔新城。

translations.literal: Seventh year, pulled Xin Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, they pulled Xin Cheng.

sentences.zh: 摢裏子卒。

translations.literal: Nie Li Zi died.
translations.idiomatic: Nie Li Zi died.

sentences.zh: 八年，使將軍羋戎攻楚，取新市。

translations.literal: Eighth year, made general Mi Rong attack Chu, took Xin Shi.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, he had general Mi Rong attack Chu and take Xin Shi.

sentences.zh: 齊使章子，魏使公孫喜，韓使暴鳶共攻楚方城，取唐眛。

translations.literal: Qi made Zhang Zi, Wei made Gong Sun Xi, Han made Bao Yuan together attacked Chu Fang Cheng, took Tang Mian.
translations.idiomatic: Qi had Zhang Zi, Wei had Gong Sun Xi, and Han had Bao Yuan together attack Chu's Fang Cheng and take Tang Mian.

sentences.zh: 趙破中山，其君亡，竟死齊。

translations.literal: Zhao broke Zhong Shan, its lord fled, finally died Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao broke Zhong Shan. Its lord fled and finally died in Qi.

sentences.zh: 魏公子勁、韓公子長為諸侯。

translations.literal: Wei nobleman Jing, Han nobleman Chang became feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Wei nobleman Jing and Han nobleman Chang became feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 九年，孟嘗君薛文來相秦。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Meng Chang Jun Xue Wen came chancellor Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Meng Chang Jun Xue Wen came to be chancellor of Qin.

sentences.zh: 奐攻楚，取八城，殺其將景快。

translations.literal: Huan attacked Chu, took eight cities, killed their general Jing Kuai.
translations.idiomatic: Huan attacked Chu, took eight cities, and killed their general Jing Kuai.

sentences.zh: 十年，楚懷王入朝秦，秦留之。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Chu Huai wang entered audience Qin, Qin detained him.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Chu's Huai wang entered for audience with Qin, and Qin detained him.

sentences.zh: 薛文以金受免。

translations.literal: Xue Wen with gold received dismissal.
translations.idiomatic: Xue Wen received dismissal with gold.

sentences.zh: 樓緩為丞相。

translations.literal: Lou Huan became chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Lou Huan became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 十一年，齊、韓、魏、趙、宋、中山五國共攻秦，至鹽氏而還。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Qi, Han, Wei, Zhao, Song, Zhong Shan five states together attacked Qin, reached Yan Shi then returned.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Qi, Han, Wei, Zhao, Song, and Zhong Shan - five states - together attacked Qin. They reached Yan Shi and then returned.

sentences.zh: 秦與韓、魏河北及封陵以和。

translations.literal: Qin with Han, Wei He north and Feng Ling made peace.
translations.idiomatic: Qin made peace with Han and Wei at He north and Feng Ling.

sentences.zh: 彗星見。

translations.literal: Comet appeared.
translations.idiomatic: A comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 楚懷王走之趙，趙不受，還之秦，即死，歸葬。

translations.literal: Chu Huai wang fled to Zhao, Zhao not accepted, returned him Qin, immediately died, returned buried.
translations.idiomatic: Chu's Huai wang fled to Zhao, but Zhao did not accept him. They returned him to Qin, where he immediately died and was returned for burial.

sentences.zh: 十二年，樓緩免，穰侯魏冉為相。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Lou Huan dismissed, Rang hou Wei Ran became chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Lou Huan was dismissed, and Rang hou Wei Ran became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 予楚粟五萬石。

translations.literal: Gave Chu millet fifty thousand shi.
translations.idiomatic: They gave Chu fifty thousand shi of millet.

translations.literal: In King Zhao Xiang's first year, Yan Jun Ji became chancellor. Gan Mao went out to Wei. In the second year, a comet was seen. Shu Zhang Zhuang rebelled with grand ministers, feudal lords, and gong zi. They were all executed, and Queen Hui Wen also did not get a good death. Queen Dao Wu Wang went out and returned to Wei. In the third year, the king was crowned. He met with the Chu king at Huangji and ceded Shangyong to Chu. In the fourth year, they took Puban. A comet was seen. In the fifth year, the Wei king came to court at Yingting. They again gave Puban to Wei. In the sixth year, Shu hou Hui rebelled. Sima Cuo pacified Shu. Shu Zhang Huan attacked Chu and beheaded twenty thousand. Lord Jingyang was a hostage in Qi. There was a solar eclipse. The day was dark. In the seventh year, they pulled Xincheng. Mang Li Zi died. In the eighth year, they had General Mi Rong attack Chu and take Xinshi. Qi sent Zhang Zi, Wei sent Gong Sun Xi, Han sent Bao Yuan. They together attacked Chu's Fangcheng and took Tangmian. Zhao broke Zhongshan. Its ruler fled and finally died in Qi. Wei Gong Zi Jing and Han Gong Zi Chang became feudal lords. In the ninth year, Meng Chang Jun Xue Wen came to be chancellor of Qin. Huan attacked Chu, took eight cities, and killed their general Jing Kuai. In the tenth year, Chu's King Huai entered to court Qin. Qin detained him. Xue Wen was dismissed through bribery with gold. Lou Huan became chancellor. In the eleventh year, Qi, Han, Wei, Zhao, Song, and Zhongshan - five states together attacked Qin. They reached Yanshi and returned. Qin made peace with Han and Wei by giving them the land north of the Yellow River and Fengling. A comet was seen. Chu's King Huai fled to Zhao. Zhao did not accept him. They returned him to Qin, where he immediately died. His body was returned for burial. In the twelfth year, Lou Huan was dismissed. Rang Hou Wei Ran became chancellor. They gave Chu fifty thousand shi of grain.

sentences.zh: 十三年，向壽伐韓，取武始。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Xiang Shou attacked Han, took Wu Shi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Xiang Shou attacked Han and took Wu Shi.

sentences.zh: 左更白起攻新城。

translations.literal: Left geng Bai Qi attacked Xin Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: Left geng Bai Qi attacked Xin Cheng.

sentences.zh: 五大夫禮出亡奔魏。

translations.literal: Wu da fu Li went out fled ran Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Wu da fu Li went out, fled, and ran to Wei.

sentences.zh: 任鄙為漢中守。

translations.literal: Ren Bi became Han middle guard.
translations.idiomatic: Ren Bi became guard of Han middle.

sentences.zh: 十四年，左更白起攻韓、魏於伊闕，斬首二十四萬，虜公孫喜，拔五城。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, left geng Bai Qi attacked Han, Wei at Yi Que, beheaded two hundred forty thousand, captured Gong Sun Xi, pulled five cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, left geng Bai Qi attacked Han and Wei at Yi Que, beheading two hundred forty thousand, capturing Gong Sun Xi, and pulling five cities.

sentences.zh: 十五年，大良造白起攻魏，取垣，復予之。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, great good maker Bai Qi attacked Wei, took Yuan, again gave it.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, great good maker Bai Qi attacked Wei, took Yuan, and gave it back again.

sentences.zh: 攻楚，取宛。

translations.literal: Attacked Chu, took Wan.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Chu and took Wan.

sentences.zh: 十六年，左更錯取軹及鄧。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, left geng Cuo took Zhi and Deng.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, left geng Cuo took Zhi and Deng.

sentences.zh: 冉免，封公子市宛，公子悝鄧，魏冉陶，為諸侯。

translations.literal: Ran dismissed, enfeoffed nobleman Shi Wan, nobleman Kui Deng, Wei Ran Tao, became feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Ran was dismissed. They enfeoffed nobleman Shi at Wan, nobleman Kui at Deng, and Wei Ran at Tao, making them feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 十七年，城陽君入朝，及東周君來朝。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, Cheng Yang jun entered audience, and Dong Zhou jun came audience.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Cheng Yang jun entered for audience, and Dong Zhou jun came for audience.

sentences.zh: 秦以垣為蒲阪、皮氏。

translations.literal: Qin made Yuan Pu Ban, Pi Shi.
translations.idiomatic: Qin made Yuan into Pu Ban and Pi Shi.

sentences.zh: 王之宜陽。

translations.literal: Wang went Yi Yang.
translations.idiomatic: The wang went to Yi Yang.

sentences.zh: 十八年，錯攻垣、河雍，決橋取之。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, Cuo attacked Yuan, He Yong, broke bridge took it.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Cuo attacked Yuan and He Yong, broke the bridge and took it.

sentences.zh: 十九年，王為西帝，齊為東帝，皆復去之。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, wang became west emperor, Qi became east emperor, all again abandoned it.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, the wang became west emperor and Qi became east emperor, but they all abandoned these titles again.

sentences.zh: 呂禮來自歸。

translations.literal: Lu Li came self surrendered.
translations.idiomatic: Lu Li came and surrendered himself.

sentences.zh: 齊破宋，宋王在魏，死溫。

translations.literal: Qi broke Song, Song wang in Wei, died Wen.
translations.idiomatic: Qi broke Song. The Song wang was in Wei and died at Wen.

sentences.zh: 任鄙卒。

translations.literal: Ren Bi died.
translations.idiomatic: Ren Bi died.

sentences.zh: 二十年，王之漢中，又之上郡、北河。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, wang went Han middle, again went Shang Jun, Bei He.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, the wang went to Han middle, and again went to Shang Jun and Bei He.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，錯攻魏河內。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, Cuo attacked Wei He nei.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Cuo attacked Wei's He nei.

sentences.zh: 魏獻安邑，秦出其人，募徙河東賜爵，赦罪人遷之。

translations.literal: Wei offered An Yi, Qin moved its people, recruited migrated He dong granted nobility, pardoned criminals moved them.
translations.idiomatic: Wei offered An Yi. Qin moved its people out, recruited migrants to He dong and granted them nobility, and pardoned criminals and moved them there.

sentences.zh: 涇陽君封宛。

translations.literal: Jing Yang jun enfeoffed Wan.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Yang jun was enfeoffed at Wan.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，蒙武伐齊。

translations.literal: Twenty-second year, Meng Wu attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Meng Wu attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 河東為九縣。

translations.literal: He dong became nine counties.
translations.idiomatic: He dong became nine counties.

sentences.zh: 與楚王會宛。

translations.literal: With Chu wang met Wan.
translations.idiomatic: He met with the Chu wang at Wan.

sentences.zh: 與趙王會中陽。

translations.literal: With Zhao wang met Zhong Yang.
translations.idiomatic: He met with the Zhao wang at Zhong Yang.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，尉斯離與三晉、燕伐齊，破之濟西。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, Wei Si Li with three Jin, Yan attacked Qi, broke it Ji xi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Wei Si Li with the three Jin and Yan attacked Qi and broke them at Ji xi.

sentences.zh: 王與魏王會宜陽，與韓王會新城。

translations.literal: Wang with Wei wang met Yi Yang, with Han wang met Xin Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: The wang met with the Wei wang at Yi Yang and with the Han wang at Xin Cheng.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，與楚王會鄢，又會穰。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, with Chu wang met Yan, again met Rang.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, he met with the Chu wang at Yan and again met at Rang.

sentences.zh: 秦取魏安城，至大梁，燕、趙救之，秦軍去。

translations.literal: Qin took Wei An Cheng, reached Da Liang, Yan, Zhao rescued it, Qin army departed.
translations.idiomatic: Qin took Wei's An Cheng and reached Da Liang. Yan and Zhao rescued it, and the Qin army departed.

sentences.zh: 魏冉免相。

translations.literal: Wei Ran dismissed chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Ran was dismissed as chancellor.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，拔趙二城。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, pulled Zhao two cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, they pulled two cities from Zhao.

sentences.zh: 與韓王會新城，與魏王會新明邑。

translations.literal: With Han wang met Xin Cheng, with Wei wang met Xin Ming Yi.
translations.idiomatic: He met with the Han wang at Xin Cheng and with the Wei wang at Xin Ming Yi.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，赦罪人遷之穰。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year, pardoned criminals moved them Rang.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, they pardoned criminals and moved them to Rang.

sentences.zh: 侯冉復相。

translations.literal: Hou Ran again became chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Hou Ran again became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，錯攻楚。

translations.literal: Twenty-seventh year, Cuo attacked Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Cuo attacked Chu.

sentences.zh: 赦罪人遷之南陽。

translations.literal: Pardoned criminals moved them Nan Yang.
translations.idiomatic: They pardoned criminals and moved them to Nan Yang.

sentences.zh: 白起攻趙，取代光狼城。

translations.literal: Bai Qi attacked Zhao, took Dai Guang Lang city.
translations.idiomatic: Bai Qi attacked Zhao and took Dai Guang Lang city.

sentences.zh: 又使司馬錯發隴西，因蜀攻楚黔中，拔之。

translations.literal: Again made Si Ma Cuo dispatched Long xi, through Shu attacked Chu Qian zhong, pulled it.
translations.idiomatic: They again had Si Ma Cuo dispatch from Long xi, attack Chu's Qian zhong through Shu, and pull it.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，大良造白起攻楚，取鄢、鄧，赦罪人遷之。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, great good maker Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Yan, Deng, pardoned criminals moved them.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Great Good Maker Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Yan and Deng, and moved pardoned criminals there.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，大良造白起攻楚，取郢為南郡，楚王走。

translations.literal: Twenty-ninth year, great good maker Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Ying made Nan Jun, Chu wang fled.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Great Good Maker Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Ying and made it Nan Jun. The Chu wang fled.

sentences.zh: 周君來。

translations.literal: Zhou jun came.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou jun came.

sentences.zh: 王與楚王會襄陵。

translations.literal: Wang with Chu wang met Xiang Ling.
translations.idiomatic: The wang met with the Chu wang at Xiang Ling.

sentences.zh: 白起為武安君。

translations.literal: Bai Qi became Wu An jun.
translations.idiomatic: Bai Qi became Lord Wu An.

sentences.zh: 三十年，蜀守若伐楚，取巫郡，及江南為黔中郡。

translations.literal: Thirtieth year, Shu guard Ruo attacked Chu, took Wu Jun, and Jiang Nan made Qian Zhong Jun.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Shu's guard Ruo attacked Chu, took Wu Jun, and made Jiang Nan into Qian Zhong Jun.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，白起伐魏，取兩城。

translations.literal: Thirty-first year, Bai Qi attacked Wei, took two cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Bai Qi attacked Wei and took two cities.

sentences.zh: 楚人反我江南。

translations.literal: Chu people rebelled our Jiang Nan.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu people rebelled in our Jiang Nan.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，相穰侯攻魏，至大梁，破暴鳶，斬首四萬，鳶走，魏入三縣請和。

translations.literal: Thirty-second year, chancellor Rang Hou attacked Wei, reached Da Liang, broke Bao Yuan, beheaded forty thousand, Yuan fled, Wei entered three counties requested peace.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-second year, Chancellor Rang Hou attacked Wei, reaching Da Liang. He broke Bao Yuan, beheaded forty thousand. Yuan fled. Wei ceded three counties and requested peace.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，客卿胡（傷）［陽］攻魏卷、蔡陽、長社，取之。

translations.literal: Thirty-third year, guest minister Hu Yang attacked Wei Juan, Cai Yang, Chang She, took them.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, Guest Minister Hu Yang attacked Wei's Juan, Cai Yang, and Chang She, and took them.

sentences.zh: 擊芒卯華陽，破之，斬首十五萬。

translations.literal: Attacked Mang Mao Hua Yang, broke it, beheaded one hundred fifty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked Mang Mao at Hua Yang, broke it, and beheaded one hundred fifty thousand.

sentences.zh: 魏入南陽以和。

translations.literal: Wei entered Nan Yang made peace.
translations.idiomatic: Wei ceded Nan Yang to make peace.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，秦與魏、韓上庸地為一郡，南陽免臣遷居之。

translations.literal: Thirty-fourth year, Qin with Wei, Han Shang Yong lands made one jun, Nan Yang exempted ministers moved resided it.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fourth year, Qin made the Shang Yong lands of Wei and Han into one jun. Exempted ministers of Nan Yang were moved to reside there.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，佐韓、魏、楚伐燕。

translations.literal: Thirty-fifth year, assisted Han, Wei, Chu attacked Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, he assisted Han, Wei, and Chu in attacking Yan.

sentences.zh: 初置南陽郡。

translations.literal: First established Nan Yang jun.
translations.idiomatic: Nan Yang jun was first established.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，客卿灶攻齊，取剛、壽，予穰侯。

translations.literal: Thirty-sixth year, guest minister Zao attacked Qi, took Gang, Shou, gave Rang Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, Guest Minister Zao attacked Qi, took Gang and Shou, and gave them to Rang Hou.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，中更胡（傷）［陽］攻趙閼與，不能取。

translations.literal: Thirty-eighth year, zhong geng Hu Yang attacked Zhao Yan Yu, could not take.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-eighth year, Zhong Geng Hu Yang attacked Zhao's Yan Yu but could not take it.

sentences.zh: 四十年，悼太子死魏，歸葬芷陽。

translations.literal: Fortieth year, Dao crown prince died Wei, returned buried Zhi Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the fortieth year, Crown Prince Dao died in Wei and was returned for burial in Zhi Yang.

sentences.zh: 四十一年夏，攻魏，取邢丘、懷。

translations.literal: Forty-first year summer, attacked Wei, took Xing Qiu, Huai.
translations.idiomatic: In summer of the forty-first year, they attacked Wei and took Xing Qiu and Huai.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，安國君為太子。

translations.literal: Forty-second year, An Guo Jun became crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year, An Guo Jun became crown prince.

sentences.zh: 十月，宣太后薨，葬芷陽酈山。

translations.literal: Tenth month, Xuan empress dowager died, buried Zhi Yang Li Shan.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, Empress Dowager Xuan died and was buried at Zhi Yang's Li Shan.

sentences.zh: 九月，穰侯出之陶。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Rang Hou went out to Tao.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, Rang Hou went out to Tao.

sentences.zh: 四十三年，武安君白起攻韓，拔九城，斬首五萬。

translations.literal: Forty-third year, Wu An Jun Bai Qi attacked Han, pulled nine cities, beheaded fifty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-third year, Lord Wu An Bai Qi attacked Han, pulled nine cities, and beheaded fifty thousand.

sentences.zh: 四十四年，攻韓南（郡）［陽］，取之。

translations.literal: Forty-fourth year, attacked Han Nan Yang, took it.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-fourth year, they attacked Han's Nan Yang and took it.

sentences.zh: 四十五年，五大夫賁攻韓，取十城。

translations.literal: Forty-fifth year, wu da fu Ben attacked Han, took ten cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-fifth year, Wu Da Fu Ben attacked Han and took ten cities.

sentences.zh: 葉陽君悝出之國，未至而死。

translations.literal: Ye Yang Jun Kui went out of state, not arrived died.
translations.idiomatic: Ye Yang Jun Kui went out of the state but died before arriving.

sentences.zh: 四十七年，秦攻韓上黨，上黨降趙，秦因攻趙，趙發兵擊秦，相距。

translations.literal: Forty-seventh year, Qin attacked Han Shang Dang, Shang Dang surrendered Zhao, Qin therefore attacked Zhao, Zhao dispatched troops attacked Qin, mutually confronted.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-seventh year, Qin attacked Han's Shang Dang. Shang Dang surrendered to Zhao. Qin therefore attacked Zhao. Zhao dispatched troops to attack Qin, and they confronted each other.

sentences.zh: 秦使武安君白起擊，大破趙於長平，四十餘萬盡殺之。

translations.literal: Qin made Wu An Jun Bai Qi attack, greatly broke Zhao at Chang Ping, forty more ten thousand all killed them.
translations.idiomatic: Qin had Lord Wu An Bai Qi attack. He greatly broke Zhao at Chang Ping and killed all forty more than ten thousand.

sentences.zh: 四十八年十月，韓獻垣雍。

translations.literal: Forty-eighth year tenth month, Han offered Yuan Yong.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-eighth year, tenth month, Han offered Yuan Yong.

sentences.zh: 秦軍分為三軍。

translations.literal: Qin army divided into three armies.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin army was divided into three armies.

sentences.zh: 武安君歸。

translations.literal: Wu An Jun returned.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Wu An returned.

sentences.zh: 王龁將伐趙（武安）皮牢，拔之。

translations.literal: Wang He will attack Zhao Pi Lao, pulled it.
translations.idiomatic: Wang He was to attack Zhao's Pi Lao and pull it.

sentences.zh: 司馬梗北定太原，盡有韓上黨。

translations.literal: Si Ma Geng north pacified Tai Yuan, completely had Han Shang Dang.
translations.idiomatic: Si Ma Geng pacified Tai Yuan to the north and completely possessed Han's Shang Dang.

sentences.zh: 正月，兵罷，復守上黨。

translations.literal: First month, troops dismissed, again guarded Shang Dang.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month, the troops were dismissed, and they again guarded Shang Dang.

sentences.zh: 其十月，五大夫陵攻趙邯鄲。

translations.literal: Its tenth month, wu da fu Ling attacked Zhao Han Dan.
translations.idiomatic: In its tenth month, Wu Da Fu Ling attacked Zhao's Han Dan.

sentences.zh: 四十九年正月，益發卒佐陵。

translations.literal: Forty-ninth year first month, increased dispatched troops assisted Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-ninth year, first month, they increased and dispatched troops to assist Ling.

sentences.zh: 陵戰不善，免，王龁代將。

translations.literal: Ling battled not well, dismissed, Wang He substituted commanded.
translations.idiomatic: Ling did not battle well and was dismissed. Wang He substituted as commander.

sentences.zh: 其十月，將軍張唐攻魏，為蔡尉捐弗守，還斬之。

translations.literal: Its tenth month, general Zhang Tang attacked Wei, for Cai wei Juan not guarded, returned beheaded him.
translations.idiomatic: In its tenth month, General Zhang Tang attacked Wei. For Cai Wei Juan not guarding, he returned and beheaded him.

sentences.zh: 五十年十月，武安君白起有罪，為士伍，遷陰密。

translations.literal: Fiftieth year tenth month, Wu An Jun Bai Qi had crime, became shi wu, moved Yin Mi.
translations.idiomatic: In the fiftieth year, tenth month, Lord Wu An Bai Qi had crime, became a common soldier, and was moved to Yin Mi.

sentences.zh: 張唐攻鄭，拔之。

translations.literal: Zhang Tang attacked Zheng, pulled it.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Tang attacked Zheng and pulled it.

sentences.zh: 十二月，益發卒軍汾城旁。

translations.literal: Twelfth month, increased dispatched troops stationed Fen Cheng side.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, they increased and dispatched troops to station by Fen Cheng.

sentences.zh: 武安君白起有罪，死。

translations.literal: Wu An Jun Bai Qi had crime, died.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Wu An Bai Qi had crime and died.

sentences.zh: 龁攻邯鄲，不拔，去，還奔汾軍。

translations.literal: He attacked Han Dan, not pulled, went, returned fled Fen army.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked Han Dan but did not pull it. He went away and returned fleeing to the Fen army.

sentences.zh: 二月餘攻晉軍，斬首六千，晉楚流死河二萬人。

translations.literal: Two months more attacked Jin army, beheaded six thousand, Jin Chu floated died river twenty thousand people.
translations.idiomatic: For more than two months they attacked the Jin army, beheading six thousand. Twenty thousand Jin and Chu people floated dead in the river.

sentences.zh: 攻汾城，即從唐拔寧新中，寧新中更名安陽。

translations.literal: Attacked Fen Cheng, then from Tang pulled Ning Xin Zhong, Ning Xin Zhong changed name An Yang.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Fen Cheng, then from Tang pulled Ning Xin Zhong. Ning Xin Zhong changed its name to An Yang.

sentences.zh: 初作河橋。

translations.literal: First made river bridge.
translations.idiomatic: They first made a river bridge.

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Xiang Shou attacked Han and took Wushi. Left More Bai Qi attacked Xincheng. The Five Great Men Li went out and fled to Wei. Ren Bi became the guard of Hanzhong. In the fourteenth year, Left More Bai Qi attacked Han and Wei at Yique, beheaded two hundred forty thousand, captured Gong Sun Xi, and pulled five cities. In the fifteenth year, Great Good Maker Bai Qi attacked Wei, took Yuan, and again gave it back. They attacked Chu and took Wan. In the sixteenth year, Left More Cuo took Zhi and Deng. Ran was dismissed. Gong Zi Shi was enfeoffed at Wan, Gong Zi Kui at Deng, and Wei Ran at Tao. They became feudal lords. In the seventeenth year, Lord Chengyang entered to court, and Lord Dongzhou came to court. Qin changed Yuan to Puban and Pishi. The king went to Yiyang. In the eighteenth year, Cuo attacked Yuan and Heyong, broke the bridge and took them. In the nineteenth year, the king became the Western Emperor and Qi became the Eastern Emperor. They all again abandoned these titles. Lu Li came and surrendered himself. Qi broke Song. The Song king was in Wei and died at Wen. Ren Bi died. In the twentieth year, the king went to Hanzhong, and again to Shang commandery and North River. In the twenty-first year, Cuo attacked Wei's Henei. Wei offered Anyi. Qin expelled its people, recruited migrants to Hedong and granted them nobility titles, and pardoned criminals to move them there. Lord Jingyang was enfeoffed at Wan. In the twenty-second year, Meng Wu attacked Qi. Hedong was made into nine counties. He met with the Chu king at Wan. He met with the Zhao king at Zhongyang. In the twenty-third year, Wei Si Li, together with the three Jin and Yan, attacked Qi and broke them west of the Ji. The king met with the Wei king at Yiyang and with the Han king at Xincheng. In the twenty-fourth year, he met with the Chu king at Yan and again at Rang. Qin took Wei's Ancheng and reached Daliang. Yan and Zhao rescued it, so the Qin army withdrew. Wei Ran was dismissed as chancellor. In the twenty-fifth year, they pulled two cities from Zhao. He met with the Han king at Xincheng and with the Wei king at Xinmingyi. In the twenty-sixth year, criminals were pardoned and moved to Rang. Hou Ran again became chancellor. In the twenty-seventh year, Cuo attacked Chu. Criminals were pardoned and moved to Nanyang. Bai Qi attacked Zhao and took Daiguanglang city. They again had Sima Cuo send troops from Longxi, following through Shu to attack Chu's Qianzhong, and pulled it. In the twenty-eighth year, Great Good Maker Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Yan and Deng, and pardoned criminals to move them there. In the twenty-ninth year, Great Good Maker Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Ying and made it Nanguo commandery. The Chu king fled. The Zhou jun came. The king met with the Chu king at Xiangling. Bai Qi became Lord Wuan. In the thirtieth year, Shu's guard Ruo attacked Chu, took Wujun, and Jiangnan as Qianzhong commandery. In the thirty-first year, Bai Qi attacked Wei and took two cities. The Chu people rebelled against our Jiangnan. In the thirty-second year, Chancellor Rang Hou attacked Wei and reached Daliang. He broke Bao Yuan, beheaded forty thousand. Yuan fled. Wei ceded three counties and pleaded for peace. In the thirty-third year, guest minister Hu Yang attacked Wei's Juan, Caiyang, and Changshe, and took them. They struck Mang Mao at Huayang, broke it, and beheaded one hundred fifty thousand. Wei ceded Nanyang to make peace. In the thirty-fourth year, Qin combined Shangyong land with Wei and Han into one commandery. Freed ministers from Nanyang were moved to live there. In the thirty-fifth year, they assisted Han, Wei, and Chu in attacking Yan. They initially established Nanyang commandery. In the thirty-sixth year, guest minister Zao attacked Qi, took Gang and Shou, and gave them to Rang Hou. In the thirty-eighth year, Middle More Hu Yang attacked Zhao's Eyu but could not take it. In the fortieth year, Crown Prince Dao died in Wei. He was returned and buried at Zhiyang. In summer of the forty-first year, they attacked Wei and took Xingqiu and Huai. In the forty-second year, Lord Anguo became crown prince. In the tenth month, Xuan Taihou died. She was buried at Lishan in Zhiyang. In the ninth month, Rang Hou went out to Tao. In the forty-third year, Lord Wuan Bai Qi attacked Han, pulled nine cities, and beheaded fifty thousand. In the forty-fourth year, they attacked Han's Nanyang and took it. In the forty-fifth year, the Five Great Men Ben attacked Han and took ten cities. Lord Yeyang Kui went out to the country. He died before arriving. In the forty-seventh year, Qin attacked Han's Shangdang. Shangdang surrendered to Zhao. Qin therefore attacked Zhao. Zhao sent troops to strike Qin. They confronted each other. Qin had Lord Wuan Bai Qi strike. He greatly broke Zhao at Changping and killed all four hundred thousand. In the tenth month of the forty-eighth year, Han offered Yuanyong. The Qin army was divided into three armies. Lord Wuan returned. Wang He was to attack Zhao's Pilao and pull it. Sima Geng pacified Taiyuan to the north and completely took Han's Shangdang. In the first month, troops were dismissed. They again guarded Shangdang. In that tenth month, the Five Great Men Ling attacked Zhao's Handan. In the first month of the forty-ninth year, they additionally sent troops to assist Ling. Ling fought poorly and was dismissed. Wang He replaced him as general. In that tenth month, General Zhang Tang attacked Wei. Because Cai Wei Juan did not guard, he returned and beheaded him. In the tenth month of the fiftieth year, Lord Wuan Bai Qi had a crime. He was made a common soldier and moved to Yinmi. Zhang Tang attacked Zheng and pulled it. In the twelfth month, they additionally sent troops to station beside Fencheng. Lord Wuan Bai Qi had a crime and died. He attacked Handan but could not pull it. He went and returned to rush to the Fen army. For more than two months they attacked the Jin army, beheaded six thousand, and twenty thousand Jin and Chu people drowned and died in the river. They attacked Fencheng, then from Tang pulled Ningxinzhong. Ningxinzhong changed its name to Anyang. They initially made a river bridge.

sentences.zh: 五十一年，將軍摎攻韓，取陽城、負黍，斬首四萬。

translations.literal: Fifty-first year, general Liu attacked Han, took Yang Cheng, Fu Shu, beheaded forty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-first year, General Liu attacked Han, took Yang Cheng and Fu Shu, and beheaded forty thousand.

sentences.zh: 攻趙，取二十餘縣，首虜九萬。

translations.literal: Attacked Zhao, took twenty more counties, heads captives ninety thousand.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Zhao, took more than twenty counties, with ninety thousand heads and captives.

sentences.zh: 西周君背秦，與諸侯約從，將天下銳兵出伊闕攻秦，令秦毋得通陽城。

translations.literal: West Zhou jun betrayed Qin, with feudal lords allied horizontally, led world sharp troops exited Yi Que attacked Qin, made Qin not obtain pass Yang Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: The West Zhou jun betrayed Qin and allied horizontally with the feudal lords. He led the world's sharp troops out of Yi Que to attack Qin, causing Qin to not be able to pass Yang Cheng.

sentences.zh: 於是秦使將軍摎攻西周。

translations.literal: Then Qin made general Liu attack West Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Qin then had General Liu attack West Zhou.

sentences.zh: 西周君走來自歸，頓首受罪，盡獻其邑三十六城，口三萬。

translations.literal: West Zhou jun fled came self surrendered, knocked head accepted crime, completely offered his cities thirty-six cities, population thirty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: The West Zhou jun fled and came to surrender himself. He knocked his head and accepted his crime, completely offering his thirty-six cities and thirty thousand people.

sentences.zh: 秦王受獻，歸其君於周。

translations.literal: Qin wang accepted offerings, returned his lord to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin wang accepted the offerings and returned his lord to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 五十二年，周民東亡，其器九鼎入秦。

translations.literal: Fifty-second year, Zhou people east fled, their vessels nine tripods entered Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-second year, the Zhou people fled east, and their nine tripods entered Qin.

sentences.zh: 周初亡。

translations.literal: Zhou first perished.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou first perished.

translations.literal: In the fifty-first year, General Liu attacked Han, took Yangcheng and Fushu, and beheaded forty thousand. They attacked Zhao, took more than twenty counties, and captured ninety thousand heads. The West Zhou jun betrayed Qin and allied with the feudal lords. He led the world's sharp troops out of Yique to attack Qin, making Qin unable to connect to Yangcheng. Thereupon Qin had General Liu attack West Zhou. The West Zhou jun fled and came to surrender himself. He knocked his head and received punishment, completely offering his thirty-six cities and thirty thousand people. The Qin king accepted the offering and returned his jun to Zhou. In the fifty-second year, the Zhou people fled east. Their vessels, the nine ding, entered Qin. Zhou initially perished.

sentences.zh: 五十三年，天下來賓。

translations.literal: Fifty-third year, world came as guests.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-third year, the world came as guests.

sentences.zh: 魏後，秦使摎伐魏，取吳城。

translations.literal: Wei later, Qin made Liu attacked Wei, took Wu Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: Later, Wei. Qin had Liu attack Wei and take Wu Cheng.

sentences.zh: 韓王入朝，魏委國聽令。

translations.literal: Han wang entered audience, Wei entrusted state listened to commands.
translations.idiomatic: The Han wang entered for audience. Wei entrusted its state and listened to commands.

sentences.zh: 五十四年，王郊見上帝於雍。

translations.literal: Fifty-fourth year, wang suburban met Supreme Deity at Yong.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-fourth year, the wang met the Supreme Deity in suburban rites at Yong.

sentences.zh: 五十六年秋，昭襄王卒，子孝文王立。

translations.literal: Fifty-sixth year autumn, Zhao Xiang wang died, son Xiao Wen wang established.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn of the fifty-sixth year, Zhao Xiang wang died, and his son Xiao Wen wang was established.

sentences.zh: 尊唐八子為唐太后，而合其葬於先王。

translations.literal: Honored Tang eight son as Tang empress dowager, and combined his burial with former kings.
translations.idiomatic: They honored Tang's eight son as Tang Empress Dowager, and combined his burial with the former kings.

sentences.zh: 韓王衰绖入弔祠，諸侯皆使其將相來弔祠，視喪事。

translations.literal: Han wang mourning clothes hemp entered condoled sacrificed, feudal lords all made their generals chancellors come condole sacrifice, viewed funeral matters.
translations.idiomatic: The Han wang entered in mourning clothes and hemp to condole and sacrifice. All the feudal lords had their generals and chancellors come to condole and sacrifice, and view the funeral matters.

translations.literal: In the fifty-third year, the world came as guests. Later, Wei. Qin had Liu attack Wei and take Wucheng. The Han king entered to court. Wei entrusted its state and listened to commands. In the fifty-fourth year, the king in the suburbs saw Shangdi at Yong. In autumn of the fifty-sixth year, King Zhao Xiang died. His son King Xiao Wen was established. They honored Tang Ba Zi as Tang Taihou and combined her burial with the previous kings. The Han king in mourning clothes entered to offer condolences and sacrifices. All the feudal lords had their generals and chancellors come to offer condolences and sacrifices and view the funeral affairs.

sentences.zh: 孝文王元年，赦罪人，修先王功臣，褒厚親戚，弛苑囿。

translations.literal: Xiao Wen wang first year, pardoned criminals, repaired former kings merit ministers, praised enriched relatives, relaxed gardens enclosures.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiao Wen wang's first year, he pardoned criminals, repaired former kings' merit ministers, praised and enriched relatives, and relaxed the gardens and enclosures.

sentences.zh: 孝文王除喪，十月己亥即位，三日辛醜卒，子莊襄王立。

translations.literal: Xiao Wen wang removed mourning, tenth month Ji Hai ascended throne, three days Xin Chou died, son Zhuang Xiang wang established.
translations.idiomatic: Xiao Wen wang removed mourning. In the tenth month, Ji Hai day, he ascended the throne. Three days later, Xin Chou day, he died, and his son Zhuang Xiang wang was established.

translations.literal: In King Xiao Wen's first year, they pardoned criminals, repaired the previous king's merit ministers, praised and thickened relatives, and relaxed the gardens and enclosures. King Xiao Wen removed mourning. In the tenth month on Jihai day he ascended the throne. Three days later on Xinchou day he died. His son King Zhuang Xiang was established.

sentences.zh: 莊襄王元年，大赦罪人，修先王功臣，施德厚骨肉而布惠於民。

translations.literal: Zhuang Xiang wang first year, great pardoned criminals, repaired former kings merit ministers, applied virtue enriched close relatives and spread favor to people.
translations.idiomatic: In Zhuang Xiang wang's first year, he greatly pardoned criminals, repaired former kings' merit ministers, applied virtue and enriched close relatives, and spread favor to the people.

sentences.zh: 東周君與諸侯謀秦，秦使相國呂不韋誅之，盡入其國。

translations.literal: East Zhou jun with feudal lords plotted Qin, Qin made chancellor Lu Bu Wei executed him, completely entered his state.
translations.idiomatic: The East Zhou jun plotted with the feudal lords against Qin. Qin had Chancellor Lu Bu Wei execute him and completely took his state.

sentences.zh: 秦不絕其祀，以陽人地賜周君，奉其祭祀。

translations.literal: Qin not cut off his sacrifices, with Yang Ren land granted Zhou jun, maintained his sacrificial rites.
translations.idiomatic: Qin did not cut off his sacrifices. They granted Zhou jun land at Yang Ren to maintain his sacrificial rites.

sentences.zh: 使蒙驁伐韓，韓獻成皋、鞏。

translations.literal: Made Meng Ao attacked Han, Han offered Cheng Gao, Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He had Meng Ao attack Han. Han offered Cheng Gao and Gong.

sentences.zh: 秦界至大梁，初置三川郡。

translations.literal: Qin boundary reached Da Liang, first established San Chuan jun.
translations.idiomatic: Qin's boundary reached Da Liang. They first established San Chuan jun.

sentences.zh: 二年，使蒙驁攻趙，定太原。

translations.literal: Second year, made Meng Ao attack Zhao, pacified Tai Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, he had Meng Ao attack Zhao and pacify Tai Yuan.

sentences.zh: 三年，蒙驁攻魏高都、汲，拔之。

translations.literal: Third year, Meng Ao attacked Wei Gao Du, Ji, pulled them.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Wei's Gao Du and Ji, pulling them.

sentences.zh: 攻趙榆次、新城、狼孟，取三十七城。

translations.literal: Attacked Zhao Yu Ci, Xin Cheng, Lang Meng, took thirty-seven cities.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Zhao's Yu Ci, Xin Cheng, and Lang Meng, taking thirty-seven cities.

sentences.zh: 四月日食。

translations.literal: Fourth month solar eclipse.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: （四年）王龁攻上黨。

translations.literal: (Fourth year) Wang He attacked Shang Dang.
translations.idiomatic: (In the fourth year) Wang He attacked Shang Dang.

sentences.zh: 初置太原郡。

translations.literal: First established Tai Yuan jun.
translations.idiomatic: They first established Tai Yuan jun.

sentences.zh: 魏將無忌率五國兵擊秦，秦卻於河外。

translations.literal: Wei general Wu Ji led five states troops attacked Qin, Qin retreated outside river.
translations.idiomatic: Wei general Wu Ji led five states' troops to attack Qin. Qin retreated outside the river.

sentences.zh: 蒙驁敗，解而去。

translations.literal: Meng Ao defeated, dispersed and went.
translations.idiomatic: Meng Ao was defeated. He dispersed and went away.

sentences.zh: 五月丙午，莊襄王卒，子政立，是為秦始皇帝。

translations.literal: Fifth month Bing Wu, Zhuang Xiang wang died, son Zheng established, this was Qin First Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, Bing Wu day, Zhuang Xiang wang died. His son Zheng was established. This was the Qin First Emperor.

translations.literal: In King Zhuang Xiang's first year, they greatly pardoned criminals, repaired the previous king's merit ministers, applied virtue to thicken bone and flesh, and spread favor to the people. The East Zhou jun plotted with the feudal lords against Qin. Qin had Chancellor Lu Buwei execute him and completely entered his state. Qin did not cut off its sacrifices. They granted Yangren land to the Zhou jun to carry out its sacrificial offerings. They had Meng Ao attack Han. Han offered Chenggao and Gong. Qin's border reached Daliang. They initially established Sanchuan commandery. In the second year, they had Meng Ao attack Zhao and pacify Taiyuan. In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Wei's Gaodu and Ji and pulled them. They attacked Zhao's Yuci, Xincheng, and Langmeng, and took thirty-seven cities. In the fourth month there was a solar eclipse. (In the fourth year) Wang He attacked Shangdang. They initially established Taiyuan commandery. Wei general Wu Ji led five states' troops to strike Qin. Qin retreated outside the river. Meng Ao was defeated and disbanded and went. In the fifth month on Bingwu day, King Zhuang Xiang died. His son Zheng was established. He was Qin Shi Huangdi.

sentences.zh: 秦王政立二十六年，初并天下為三十六郡，號為始皇帝。

translations.literal: Qin wang Zheng established twenty-six years, first united world as thirty-six jun, titled First Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: Qin wang Zheng had been established for twenty-six years. He first united the world into thirty-six jun and was titled the First Emperor.

sentences.zh: 始皇帝五十一年而崩，子胡亥立，是為二世皇帝。

translations.literal: First Emperor fifty-first year collapsed, son Hu Hai established, this was Second Generation Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: The First Emperor collapsed in his fifty-first year. His son Hu Hai was established. This was the Second Generation Emperor.

sentences.zh: 三年，諸侯并起叛秦，趙高殺二世，立子嬰。

translations.literal: Third year, feudal lords together rose rebelled Qin, Zhao Gao killed Second Generation, established Zi Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, the feudal lords all rose up and rebelled against Qin. Zhao Gao killed the Second Generation and established Zi Ying.

sentences.zh: 子嬰立月餘，諸侯誅之，遂滅秦。

translations.literal: Zi Ying established month more, feudal lords executed him, then extinguished Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ying had been established for more than a month when the feudal lords executed him and then extinguished Qin.

sentences.zh: 其語在始皇本紀中。

translations.literal: Its words in First Emperor basic annals within.
translations.idiomatic: The words about this are in the First Emperor's basic annals.

translations.literal: Qin King Zheng was established for twenty-six years. He initially united the world into thirty-six commanderies and was titled Shi Huangdi. Shi Huangdi collapsed after fifty-one years. His son Hu Hai was established. He was Er Shi Huangdi. In the third year, the feudal lords together rose and rebelled against Qin. Zhao Gao killed Er Shi and established Zi Ying. Zi Ying was established for more than a month. The feudal lords executed him and then extinguished Qin. Its words are in the Shi Huang Annals.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：秦之先為嬴姓。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Qin's ancestors were Ying surname.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: Qin's ancestors had the surname Ying.

sentences.zh: 其後分封，以國為姓，有徐氏、郯氏、莒氏、終黎氏、運奄氏、菟裘氏、將梁氏、黃氏、江氏、修魚氏、白冥氏、蜚廉氏、秦氏。

translations.literal: Its after divided enfeoffed, with states as surnames, had Xu shi, Tan shi, Ju shi, Zhong Li shi, Yun Yan shi, Tu Qiu shi, Jiang Liang shi, Huang shi, Jiang shi, Xiu Yu shi, Bai Ming shi, Fei Lian shi, Qin shi.
translations.idiomatic: After that, they were divided and enfeoffed, taking their states as surnames: Xu shi, Tan shi, Ju shi, Zhong Li shi, Yun Yan shi, Tu Qiu shi, Jiang Liang shi, Huang shi, Jiang shi, Xiu Yu shi, Bai Ming shi, Fei Lian shi, and Qin shi.

sentences.zh: 然秦以其先造父封趙城，為趙氏。

translations.literal: Yet Qin with their ancestor Zhao Fu enfeoffed Zhao Cheng, became Zhao shi.
translations.idiomatic: Yet Qin, with their ancestor Zhao Fu having been enfeoffed at Zhao Cheng, became the Zhao shi.

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: 'Qin's ancestor was of the Ying surname.' His descendants were enfeoffed and took their states as surnames. There were the Xu clan, Tan clan, Ju clan, Zhongli clan, Yunyan clan, Tuqiu clan, Jiangliang clan, Huang clan, Jiang clan, Xiuyu clan, Baiming clan, Feilian clan, and Qin clan. However, Qin took its ancestor Zaofu who was enfeoffed at Zhao city as the Zhao clan.
